text: I love this place! They use only the highest quality fish and they have fantastic service.  You have to ask for it, but they are one of the few places that have authentic fresh wasabi, not that fake green paste that everyone else has.  I would recommend this place as one of  the best "off strip" sushi joints in town.
Excellent little sushi spot. Service and good quality is what sets them apart. owner/Chef Jospeh makes extra effort to make the experience fantastic. Will definitely return.

Friendly service and nice atmosphere. The restaurant is a little on the small side and was very busy, so things took a bit of time to get to the table.  Owner Joseph stopped by to see if we were enjoying the meal. He was very nice and even walked us out as other people have said. The food was fantastic and very fresh. I had a "Small" Sushi and Roll Combo Party Tray. It came on a nice sized boat and was delicious.

very nice and the staff greeted us kindly. Love the pink accent lighting. Sushi was really tasty no complaints. Waiters were nice and awesome, they got us our food fast. Omg! tempura ice cream was SO GOOD! They only served full roles so it was a lot of food and you couldn't try more rolls.

Have been here for take-out lunch several times before and all was good. Service was quick and food was good.  Not today though.  Came in around 12:20PM and one of the four waitresses noticed me standing near the "Wait to be seated sign" (she was near the bar). She said "Hi" and then disappeared.  So I stood there and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited and waited. After 5-6 minutes of waiting, none of the 4 waitresses came over and asked me if I wanted to be seated, or if I wanted take-out or anything.  No one said a word to me and no one came over. So then I started to feel like an idiot just standing there, and so I left and went down the street to Spicy Tuna. Spicy Tuna was busier than SushiWa, but they took my order almost immediately as I walked in.  So sad SushiWa!

Tried this somewhat hidden joint tonight for dinner! The prices were slightly higher than what we normally pay ($60 for two) but the sushi was good and well worth it! We weren't expecting much when we walked in since there were about 10 tables and only a few people inside, but after we were seated the restaurant filled up and had a few turn overs and lots of people taking out.   We opted for the lobster roll, Chirashi don, and sushi/sashimi/tempura bento box.  The sushi and sashimi was fresh, and they had many different kinds of rolls to choose from. They offered sushi rolls without rice and more unique rolls like torched rolls, deep fried rolls and a large variety of fish.   On top of what we ordered, they offered us tempura noodle soup, Edamame and miso soup on the house.   I was particularly fond of their tempura tonight. Everything was fried perfectly with the right about of crisp and no soggy oiliness that you get at some places.   All in all it was a good experience. I will probably go back during lunch though, since the prices are significantly cheaper then!
The owner Joseph was very personable and the food was great.The Geisha & King roll were delicious and I quite enjoyed the salmon sashimi donburi.

We had AYCE which was awesome!!! The presentation as well as the quality was the best.Lots of choices and a great and comfortable atmosphere. I almost gave them 5 stars except the service was a little slow.Sushi Wa is my new go to place for Sushi.

The inside looks SO much nicer than the outside. Decent menu selections. Our waitress was very helpful in recommending the AYCE and finding things my little kids would like. Both my hubby and I felt the sashimi was a bit fishy although it looked beautiful. The rolls we selected were pretty good. I'm partial to another sushi place up the street but I think this is a good back up place.

I thought this place was pretty good. All farm raised fish, but the service was good and the food was very nice. There was a roll with lobster that was to die for. Much better than the other places in henderson

First time coming here, my expectations were high as a I frequent many sushi spots around Vegas. I heard good things about Sushi Wa so I was very excited. Upon coming in, I was greeted and was seated right away. The ambience of the place was casual and soothing. Not many people were here because maybe it was around 9 pm on a holiday weekend.  I sat at the bar and was immediately asked if it was my first time here by the chef. I said yes, and he told me to ask if I had any questions. The food selection is great with many variations. I  chose to wat AYCE and I definitely got my money's worth by eating here. I ordered and I got my foos right away. Also, Chef Joon oppa was very accommodating and nice to me. He was friendly and made me feel very welcome in his sushi restaurant. With that, I have been coming here regularly.    Food:  fresh and consistent  Ambience:  clean, casual, and relaxing (music is not too loud) Service:  topnotch as always
Albacore with Jalepe√±o on top was delicious. Service was awesome, ambiance was great. It's definitely a nice quiet location for business or a date.
Came on a Friday night with the family and no wait. Fast service and great food as always.
I've been to many AYCE sushi places around town, but this one has, by far, the most rice and the least fish.  All the rice you can eat, with a little fish on top. I will not be back.
Really good sushi and rolls, fair priced and the owner/chef is super nice. Will make this a regular stop.
Excellent. I ate lunch box with friends.  There were nice service, everyone was very friendly .  So I enjoyed lunch time.  Thanx
Great stuff! Service is quick, servers are kind and check up with you time-to-time, food is great, and for AYCE, there are NO LIMITS TO ICE CREAM :D

This place a neighbourhood gem. It was my sister's birthday today, but we were tired and just looking for something lowkey and in our area. She was in the mood for sushi and we ended up at Sushi Wa. There is one server to the place and it's quite cozy. She gave us plenty of time to look at the menu and tried checking up on us until we took too long (oops). We did eventually order and food started coming out pretty quickly, but well-paced afterwards.  She first brought over a radish roll of some kind, with mango and avocado. I was bewildered, and asked if we had ordered this. She said it was on the house! It was delicious and wonderfully crafted. She then brought out another roll which I can't quite remember what was inside. But it was also delicious and complimentary! Lastly, we got some noodles and soup which was flavourful and refreshing. What a great start!  We then got our food. My dad got the kalbi dinner which was tender and plentiful. My mom got a salmon teriyaki bento. And my sister and I overindulged in a small sushi sashimi roll party platter. The party platter was a sushi boat, basically, and had cute added touches of carrots carved into the word "HAPPY" and a radish with carvings on it as well. The sashimi was fresh and sizeable. The sushi could have used a bit more wasabi to stick them on. But they were also individually garnished with green onions and other accoutrements depending on the kind of fish. Beautiful presentation. The rolls were good, but nothing too spectacular.  The truly great part of this place is the service. Joseph, one of the sushi chefs (and I presume the owner), came to our table towards the end of our meal to ask how it was going. He introduced himself and asked us how everything was. We said it was delicious and my mom mentioned it was my sister's birthday and we thanked him for the complimentary rolls. He thanked us, and walked away. About 10 minutes later, the lights were dimmed, a cheesy Happy Birthday track played on the speakers and he brought out a little sushi pizza with a candle on it. It was so nice! He then offered to take our picture and printed it out for us right there.  Joseph also remembered our names by the end of the night and personally walked us out and opened the door for us. He seems like a nice owner and made lovely food. We'll definitely be coming back for the service and the good food too.
Great service and atmosphere.  All you can eat was good.  Liked the korean bbq short ribs. Good to know they're open til late night for a sushi place

SushiWa is a very trendy looking restaurant, which will throw you off on entrance, because from the outside it looks like a mom'n'pop operation. However once you roll in its definately upperclass.  the interior is very spacious, with private booth seats, regualar tables and an expansive bar area which we graciously occupied.  You can get the regular-whatever's-trendy in west LA fancy rolls here, but we befriended the Head chef (by ordering daiginjo sake and pouring a round to all the chefs;-) ) and asked for Chefs choice (Omakase style) but on the traditional side... and it was just crazy good! I think the constant Kanbai's with the chefs helped, cuz we got all the usual, but high grade toro, ikura, uni etc, but he also showed us a flying fish, live and whole, then fillet it before our eyes, and we had flying-fish sashimi, garnished with flying fish wings. Ditto with the Uni Rice where the rice was mixed with seasoning and Uni and served inside the Uni shell. I don't recall all that we ate here, i lot of stuff was new to me, but thats part of the fun in going to a new restaurant! oh they had Orion beer here too, which is a plus. The head chef also showed us a picture he took with the Princess of Belgium? who is apparently a regular there, but what i couldnt understand was, what the heck is the Princess of Belgium doing living in Vegas...

I enjoyed this restaurant for the first time recently and the sushi, sashimi, and service were good. The fish was fresh and tasty, cut well, and the additional dishes were also nice. The personal touch is also very nice. We ordered a sashimi combo that came with soup and salad (we paid for upgrade to seaweed salad), some additional sashimi a la carte, edamame, AAC roll (avocado, asparagus, cucumber), plus a green eel roll, and added another miso and seaweed salad.  The food was straightforward, fresh, and filling. It's a simple, smaller, comfortable place. The fresh aspect on sashimi is super critical for us to be happy. We were happy and plan to return.

CAUTION:  Seven of us went to try out this restaurant because we heard good things about it.  We were craving all you can eat.  It didn't begin well and it didn't end well.  When we sat down the waitress in her 40 or 50 with short hair came over with a not happy face.  We were trying to order our drink and she wasn't patient and just said I will bring you all water and hot tea.  We had a toddler with us and had to stop her from leaving to order our child an apple juice .  She did not seem happy.  Near the end of the meal we were satisfied except the rice has a weird vinegar taste.  However, we had left some rice and shrimp heads on the plate.  She informed us that she would have to charge us for not eating everything.  SHRIMP heads.  Not everyone is gonna eat that.  Come to our surprise she charged us an additional $35 for these items.  It is only $27 per person for all you can eat.  We were also automatically charged a 18% tip because we were in a group.    Moral of the story.  If you order all you can eat from this place be prepared to eat everything or they will charge you.  We won't be coming back and we will tell everyone we know not to go there.

Seriously? This place gets 4/5 stars? I'd give them 0/5 if there was only an option. Ok maybe 1/5 just because of the screaming orgasm and ama ebi. Service was awful. The server, Mark, we got was very rude right from the beginning. Really, why will you question our quantity of orders if we could finish it? Every time we order "Are you sure?" It made us very uncomfortable the whole time especially when we try to order. Just awful! Never coming back! Nigiris have very thin slices of fish portion; rice portion was a lot. They try to make you full because of the rice not because the fish portion. Also after the first batch of orders, we noticed they take longer time to get our orders out. Place wasn't even full at that time. There are other much better sushi joints around town. Friendly, better service, and muuuuch better tasty sushi. Pass on this one!

THE WORST SUSHI PLACE EVER. Nothing for a 5star rating. They tried to keep the good rating by offering some complimentries like free ice cream, some rolls. Especially, the one of free food which was a deep fried one was extremly stinky. They do not throw old and stinky tuna away, just put in a roll and fry it. You never know it is a kind of garbage tuna when you eat with deep sauce. Also this restaurant is very old and takes a lot of time to get food. The sushi man keeps move out of sushi bar to greet people and say goodbye to people. It would be a good a service but he is not a waiter. Foods are below average quality. People who gave 5 stars may have gotten a lot of free food.

The restaurant has a nice, trendy atmosphere with upbeat music and they serve hands down the prettiest sushi I have ever seen. The flavors though, are a little hit or miss. They were not particularly busy when I went, which was surprising for a Friday night and we got good, attentive service. A lot of their rolls are very unique. Some of the rolls were phenomenal (like the pocky), but some of the flavor combinations and their sauces really did not work for me. I also got some nigiri where the fish did not taste fresh.   Overall, this place is a decent all you can eat option in Henderson but there are better places in other parts of the valley.

I love sushi, and this is hands down one of my favorite sushi places in Vegas! The atmosphere is amazing and it's decorated perfect. There are a mixture of booths and tables that are all spaced out perfectly so you never are too close to another group, unlike some other sushi places that can be very crowded and you feel like you're sitting with the table next to you. I always get the AYCE sushi, such and amazing deal! The cucumber salad is some of the best I ever have had, and I have never not enjoyed a roll I have gotten. Unfortunately I live on the other side of town now.. closer to places like OYSHI, but every time I go somewhere else I just miss this place terribly. The staff is always super friendly and the owner is usually there and says hi to tables. My one friend is a regular and they always take great care of us and everyone who dines there. I truly recommend this place for anyone who lives sushi, it's THE BEST! You won't regret it!
Great portion and quality of sushi, this is our first time being here, the sushi is freshly made and good price too. I'd recommend it for anyone craving for sushi during busy weekdays~

I have eaten here three times. The first visit was with a sushi group from meetup.com. The fish is as good as it gets in the middle of the desert hundreds of miles away from the ocean. The rolls inventive enough to keep your interest.  The service while attentive isn't top notch. Too many rules to follow should you choose the AYCE option. Tonight, while entertaining friends from out of town, I had a truly unpleasant experience paying the bill. Without looking at the check, a credit card was presented and charged. They added an additional 20% gratuity and labeled it as TAX. Then they added sales tax to the total INCLUDING the gratuity.  When we questioned the charge, the manager said they automatically add a 20% gratuity to parties of five or more. I pointed out their menu states 18% on parties of SIX or more. He said they've changed policy but have not changed the menu. SAY WHAT? Had to argue with the manager to have the charge reversed. Told him that if he didn't immediately reverse the charge, I would dispute the charge with the credit card company. Time to find a new sushi bar.

Decor 2.5/5       Small, used, old, utilitarian; bathroom dirty. Booths small and not that private. Feels a little "authentic".    Service 2.5/5     Nice enough. Slow. Not disciplined servers. They forgot about me couple times. Took too long to get any drink. Chefs are asian and seem well qualified/pro.   Food 4/5     Free tiny appetizers x 3 nice touch.  Green Salad was average but cold and fresh.  Agedashi Tofu and Miso soup good.  Ebi Shumai below average - flavorless, too dense and jello-like - sauce unbalanced/too vinegary.   Sashimi was fresh. Slightly above average. Inconsistent slices (ie big salmon chunks, too thin sliced tuna).   Overall - 3 to 3.5 Im sure this qualifies as some people's 4 star sushi place.  Overall its not bad. Just rough around the edges - but based on good fundamentals (authentic caring chefs and fresh product). Value is there. Im picky - a 5 star sushi place needs to be nearly perfect or blow my mind. This is not a 5 star sushi joint. I would go back if I was in the area.

What a wonderful little gem that our friend George/Debbie introduced us to.  I've been to a lot of sushi places in town and seemed like with the all you can eat menu's, everyone seemed to be cutting down on overheads.  It's always we ran out of this and we ran out of that.  To our surprise, everything we ordered was delivered.  Food was excellent, and presentation was fabulous.  The service was 5 stars as well.  Definitely recommend this place to all of my family member.  Will come back again even though we travel from Summerlin.

My husband and I stopped here randomly and fell in love with it. The combinations of flavors were unlike any other sushi bar I've been to. The fish was fresh and the amount of rice that came with the all you can eat orders were little. The restaurant itself was beautiful. Very clean, modern and inviting.  We will be back and can't wait! Despite being across town.

Sad that I HAVE to give one star.  We came in tonight as it was my fianc√©s birthday. He looked all over yelp to find a good sushi restaurant that he has never been to as we go to them all the time. We saw good reviews and decided to dine here but I will say it will be the first and the last. I am not a fish eater at ALL! I always order my regular katsu chicken. When my fianc√© ordered ayce and I didn't it seemed to be a red flag to the waitress. Needless to say we know the rules are for ayce and she made them clear several times. Almost to the point that she was accusing us of sharing. We were there for about 2 hours and after our initial dish was served she came rarely to see if he wanted anymore of his ayce sushi. Which is unacceptable. I mean to be served 3 times in 2 hours with no refills even on our water let alone sushi is nonsense. The food was not amazing and the service terrible. Sorry to the others who chose to dine here based on the yelp stars.

The service here is horrible!! Very unprofessional. Our initial server, Geo was amazing, friendly and professional. When he left we got this server from hell. It was almost as though an exorcism needed to take place. She told us that we only had 19 minutes more to eat our food and that she would not bring out any other food because "we had been here too long. " According to my last text to my friend letting her know that I would be there soon I know the we were at Sushi Wa for no more than 45 minutes when she told us this erroneous claim. In addition, we did not receive our food on time after what Geo had given us and couple of the orders were for other tables. Save yourself trouble and go elsewhere. By the way, the store owner ended up calling Gio back to the restaurant because this was such a serious issue. Harassing a customer is never ever acceptable. And she never apologized., but Geo and the store owner did for her.  Don't risk it if the waitress from Hell is still working there!
This place is wonderful, great atmosphere and modern pop music. Would recommend 5 out of 5.

I eat out at least 5 days a week, and this was the worse experienced ever.  The food was good and well presented.  It would have getting a 4 stars but the service took them down to 1 star.  There were 3 of us and we all getting AYCE.  It was almost 30 mins before our order was taking.  Even we sat at the sushi bar, the waitress takes our order not the sushi chef.  The order then put in to the head Chef and only then the other chef only make what the head chef tell them.  After finished our first orders,  we wait another 20 minutes and the waitress never came by, finally my friend stop her as she dash through and rudely, raise her voice at my friend, "YEAH!!!" my friend reply, "can we order?"  she gave him a mean, dirty, irritated look. It seem that we are inconvenient them.  As I look over to my friend, I noticed the waitress was complain to anther waitress and pointed at us.  And I can only assumed that she was complaining how much we order.  Even we only order 3 items each time.  We thought that we were having AYCE???? are we not??? I can deal with the slow service  but straight out rude to our face,  It got me so pissed off that I want to write a review right there and then. Then my friend did not know that one of the dish that he order was consider a sashimi, he thought it was an appetizer so he order a sashimi plate,  instead reply nicely she sound like she was wanting to fight him that he already order 1 allow sashimi per person. I got my order and another 30 minutes gone by she finally come by and wonder if we need anything else,  my friend say that he still waiting for his order and she act surprise after she notice that I was on my phone writing a review, she was nice and apologetic.  Then she ask if my daughter and I want anything else, we told her that we had order desert from the other waitress 20 minutes ago.  At this time All I want to do is get out of this place, before my blood pressure goes up.

My wife and I frequent here pretty much every time we want sushi. It is by far the best sushi bar in the Vegas Area. Prices are good, sushi chefs are amazing, and quality of fish is paramount. Our regular Sushi Chef Waldo is our favorite from all the sushi places we have ever been too, and he does great work. Beautiful and artful plating and great cuts of fish. He always remembers the first thing I always order when I sit down, the Superman Burrito, in my opinion the best roll ever. Definitely give this place your business!
There is no negative things ~~  Food was really good ^^ and very friendly environment ~  100 %sure coming back for sashimi and sushi

We go here all the time for their half-price sushi promo that runs from 11-3. There is no better deal in Henderson! The sushi is pretty good (WAY better than any other sushi you can get for half price) and the service is fast and great.

Not so good. This was my second time at Sushi wa, the first time, it was okay with a good server that my friend knew. I went back because the presentation of each dish was nice for the All you can eat Sushi. with drinks, it is around 35 dollars with tips. I think i deserve better service. The server had to correct my friend when he pronounced the menu wrong. Also, she had to correct me when I did not remember what they DId NOt have. ( I personally think that all the items on the menu should be available and customers do not have to memorize what they have and not). Also, the server forced us to finish all the foods. like when we tried to order more, she said, " you know you have to finish all" and we said okay.   I wouldn't have to go there If i was going to get that service. I would have not went even it was a Free Meal.

Moving to Las Vegas from Los Angeles, I have had a problem finding a decent sushi restaurant. Sushi Wa is the best AYCE sushi joint. You have a wide variety of rolls to chose from plus sashimi (AYCE places usually do not offer) and a great selection of appetizers. Extremely satisfied with this place. It is a little more expensive then other AYCE but the quality of fish makes up for that difference. Strongly recommend!

This is my favorite AYCE place by far! The lady who greeted us was super nice and friendly, the food was super fresh, amazingly good and came out extremely fast! The two servers working (Jenny and Shenna) really made my night! Their service was phenomenal! They helped everyone find things they would like on the menu; they were extremely attentive to our table and not to mention hilarious! I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends. Great job guys! :)

A friend invited us to try Sushi Wa a couple of years ago and we are still loving it! Great presentation!  Nice interior, too bad it's in a strip mall. One caution, don't tell them "something REALLY spicy" you might get ghost peppers. It took a few hours for the heat to die down. :-)
Great sushi, the food presentation is very well done. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Only complaint is the music is horrible, dance club music is not appropriate for restaurants.
My first time here, the sushi is fantastic and full of great flavor. The restaurant is beautiful inside and the staff are professional and accommodating. Recommended!

The following is my opinion of this establishment.  I WOULD NOT COME BACK.  I wish I could give this place 0 stars.... besides having very bland and in my opinion not fresh fish (I have been there twice - hoping the first time was just a fluke, but it wasn't), last time I was there I SAW 3 COCKROACHES behind the sushi counter!  IN PLAIN SIGHT!  Also, I saw a different kind of bug in their bathroom.  Someone PLEASE PUT THEM ON DIRTY DINING.  Then to make that even worse, I saw a sushi chef drop a piece of salmon and then wash it off.  SERIOUSLY?????!!!!??????  If I hadn't paid for AYCE, then I would have just walked right out right there.  I asked to talk to the manager and this Korean guy named "Joon" asked me what the problem was, and when I told him, he said that was not possible.  I said I SAW IT WITH MY OWN EYES.  He said I had "my own interpretation."  So, when the bill came, I paid it and didn't tip (obviously).  Then as I was walking out, the waitress asked why I didn't tip her.  I said that it was because the place was horrible and there were bugs, then I walked out.  Then that guy Joon followed me to my car asking why I didn't tip!!!  He harrassed me and my friend IN THE PARKING LOT, only 20 minutes after saying that I was wrong when I saw bugs at his restaurant... so then he was saying that I had to tip... and I said that the menu said gratuity was added on for parties of 6 or more, and I was only a party of 2, and frankly ARE YOU KIDDING ME????  Needless to say, I won't be going back.

This place has a really nice layout. It's small and there's only a few tables. Most of the tables are separated by a divider so it feels more private than other restaurants.   The food is good! And the people are nice :)

I work close by and we go here every week. Great service and amazing sushi. You can tell the chef (and all employees) really have a passion for sushi and go the extra distance to ensure you are enjoying your meal.

Mos def Good! I'm from Hawaii & know fresh fish- this place has good tasting sushi rice with great appetizers & sushi is pretty fresh - service lacks somewhat - order everything at once cause after that it takes long & u fill up while waiting - strategic planning to get u full lol

Came to this sushi place on Sunday night because my bf & I were looking for a sushi place open after 9pm around the area. We seen the reviews on this place and agreed to try it out. When we first walked in, we noticed that it was very small (probably 5 to 6  tables). We were seated at a booth & decided to order the small sushi & sashimi combo (35 pieces).  The waitress served us  2 complimentary dishes which were fried brown rice sushi with tuna & edamame. The sashimi came in 10 pieces and was not too thick and not too thin. The sushi was good and their rolls were not filled with alot of rice. As for their customer service, it is amazing( why I'm rating this place as a 4 star). The owner took his time to come up to our table to thank us, get to know our names , introduce himself and check  if everything was okay. He also served us icecream which surprisingly came with corn flakes. In summary, I would recommend and come back to this place.

They have great nigiri sushi. Its better than going to a buffet where the sushi has been sitting out on the counter. Instead you keep ordering a little bit at a time and all your sushi is fresh. I love the pepper seared ahi nigiri and garlic ahi (garlic ponzu sauce drizzled over ahi sashimi) nigiri. Anything on the menu is game for you to order and as much as u want (they limit your uni and ama ebi to one per person). You can pay dinner price during lunch if you want sashimi. I recOmmend that if you are there for lunch to just pay the lunch price because whatever sashimi you may be craving you can order it as nigiri. Examples of things to order are specialty fusion sushi rolls, nigiri, salads, tempura, bulgogi, kalbi, teri salmon. Dont forget dessert...mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream.

Had a lovely lunch with my friend. The Scallop roll is to die for! sushiwa is one of my favorite places to lunch in Newer henderson....it is so relaxing and the staff is friendly. The Sushi chefs are absolutely adorable!
Where else can you get sushi until 4am! Amazing service, and delicious food! Would definitely come back!
Great food & awesome experience whenever we visit. Joseph (the owner) makes sure we are extremely happy with the food we ordered.

I just finished my shrimp tempura roll and California roll, and I had to write a review for this place, because it is excellent. I'm new in town, and don't think I'll bother trying to find another sushi place in Henderson.   I didn't dine in, just got carry-out, but the girl that took my order was extremely friendly, was happy to accommodate my requests, and even offered me a beverage while I waited. I'll be back to Sushiwa soon!
Having dinner with great friends. Food is awesome. Been here twice. Love this place. Great price for AYCE.

My family always comes here and only here to eat sushi. Why? Well their quality of sashimi is amazing. Always fresh and has the buttery crisp taste sashimi should have. Even the uni is good and not as pungent as other places. I've had all of their rolls and I think of all sushi restaurants you won't find another like sushi wa. Definitely should go here for sushi if you want quality and good price.
Love the food. Here with great friends. Best salon collar and spider roll. Great service and price.

This is a hidden jem, The service always exceeds my expectations..The rolls are unique and very tasty.. I try and order something new every time but find my old favorites the Superman and lava roll.. It is worth the drive and money no doubt. ..
Waited 15 minutes for service... waited another 5 minutes for water. Not even busy. NO GOOD SERVICE!   Will not come back here anymore!
Such a great sushi place! Very clean and the staff is super friendly. I would recommend to my other sushi loving friends

Sitting at the sushi bar sipping sake right now! So happy, I had I to write a review. Very personable service from both the waitstaff and sushi chefs. Went for the all you can eat. Great deal and worth it!  Single guy on a work trip. Kirk Out

Great lil restaurant with friendly staff and great food. Came here on Friday afternoon for lunch with hubby and baby. Sushi was fresh, rolls were nice and slightly warm (just how I like it). Our waitress brought us apps on the house, which were quite tasty. Hubby had a sushi bento box and I had the lunch roll special where you can choose two rolls. Great value and prices!  The owner Joseph walked us to the door and we had a nice chat with him. You could tell he was proud of his restaurant and it shows with the great service, warm friendly smiles and great food. We will definitely be back!  One suggestion, I was trying to find a menu online to order takeout for a party, but can't find any menu online. Would be great if you could post one.

having been there several times I can say the food is good but their customer service is truly awful.  Just had my third and FINAL experience bad customer experience.  They do not even try tobe customer friendly.  They are doing you the favor - not like you are paying for their sushi.
Definitely my favorite new AYCE location.  Great food and decor/ambience is better than others.  Fish was fresh and A+ for presentations.

My friends and I came here yesterday. The place is small but the food is very good! The chef and staff here are very friendly and attentive. I ordered the sashimi and the fish are very fresh. I recommend this place and will come back soon!

I really love this sushi restaurant!    Not sure why anyone would give this place a bad review...?!  I am a sushi lover and have been to VERY expensive sushi restaurants all over the US.   Obviously, fresh fish is the most important criteria for finding good sushi!    Sushi Wa goes the distance in this catagory.  Believe me, if it isn't fresh, I'd know!  Sushi Wa provides a very nice ambiance in their restaurant.   Semi circular booths and tables are all very comfortable.  If you want one of the booths, come early or see if you can arrange for a reservation before heading out to eat.  What is fabulous here, is the all you can eat menus for lunch and dinner.   Yes, they have rules, but the wait staff was very good in helping us with our choices and explaining the rules to us.   I thought the rules were very fair and simply created to stop people from ordering food they weren't going to waste!    Seems logical to me!  The sushi is amazing!    The presentation is superb!      Cons:   I would like to see the people who bus the tables do a better job of cleaning off the tables!      Sushi can be messy, and the tables need extra care in cleaning them.  Believe me when I say, "I'll be back!"

Ok this place definitely deserves a review. I kept seeing the great reviews so I had to check it out. The staff goes above and beyond. The food is great and fresh and they bring you many delicious items 'on the house'. A charming restaurant. Will definitely be back!

My mom and I went to try out Sushi Wa based on the raving Yelp reviews.  And we left with a bad taste in our mouths.  The food was ok. The portion size of sushi and rolls were small.  The place looked run down. The table was dirty/sticky. Our dining experience was certainly different than most others posted on Yelp. We did not receive any complimentary appetizers.  The service was lukewarm at best and we had to flag the waitress to place the order and for tea refill.  When we finished the meal, the waitress quickly left the bill on our table but went to greet 2 customers who took a long time to place their take out orders.  We finally got up to pay at the cashier and the waitress just stuffed the changes in my elderly mom's hand very impatiently. We also noticed that the waitress was much friendlier to Caucasian customers, considering here is Canada!? Would definitely not worth returning.
Ordered a take out party tray and was very happy with the quality of the sushi.  It was super fresh, balanced and fairly priced.  Would order from here again for sure!

I was at a party with a friend and they said they were hungry, so I pulled up the Yelp app on my Android smart phone and search all restaurants that were still open in the area; it was about 10:50pm on a Tuesday.  Sushi Wa came up displaying a 11:30 closing time.  We got there at 11:10 and set at the bar, the owner came up and told us they closed at 11:30 and that our choices were limited.  I told them we only wanted Sushi and they said no problem. Roy and Ken were the chefs and did a great job.  I served them a few rounds of Black Raspberry Saki and they were more than happy to stay and talk to us.  Great guys and they really seem to love their job.  We ordered their version of a Screaming Orgasm which was very good.  It has a more liquidly dressing but is spicier. There was so much dressing left over that we asked for more Daikon. Ken obliged us with a mountain of the stuff.  We also had the Blue Fin sushi-mi on Roy's recommendation, which was excellent.  Sushi Wa is nicely decorated and very elegant. Perfect for a nice romantic date with plenty of booths that seem to be pretty private.  I will go back if anything just to see Ken and Roy again.  Great guys.
By far the best sushi restaurant out there. Food was amazing and the WA2 meal is extremely worth it. The service was amazing. Overall, I highly recommend this place! 5/5

This restaurant used to be good in the past but now it's just a disaster. Came in on a Friday night, waited for our food for an hour and a half and only got 4 rolls. The wait staff apologized repeatedly but did nothing to rectify the situation. The rolls that did come out were sloppy and fell apart as we picked them up. Definitely won't be coming back anytime soon unless they get their act together, there are plenty of other sushi restaurants in Vegas.
Excellent place!!  Celeste  is the best   screaming orgasm roll is the most.  Clean and great service
My wife and I came here for dinner. Food and service were fantastic. Joseph (the sushi chef) came to our table to introduce himself. Overall a great experience. We will definitely be back.
This place is great for sushi night. Nice location and the inside is comfortable. Tried many rolls and all were delicious and creative. Definitely try the XXX.
I celebrated my birthday here last night.  The service was very good.  And the quality of the sushi was amazing.  A great place to get all you can eat sushi.
Love this place. The Superman burrito roll is an addiction! This place also has some of the freshest sashimi in town. I live in Summerlin and drive over here for sushi. This place never disappoints.

Went in tonight for a dinner, the food was good, but the customer service is the worst! Every time we ordered more stuff she always inpatient and bad attitude ! Let us Felt like we shouldn't order more, and she lied to us said the regular ice cream only 1 per person , and I told her I been here a lot it was always been unlimited for Ice cream! And she admit the Ice cream is unlimited , but she said " you all had 2 ice cream already I think that's enough for you!!!!!???? Are you serious?! You going to a all you can eat place and a waitress tells you that you have enough ??? I don't think she's the owner that will worry the clients will eat too much ! I think she just so lazy to get us food!  I used to be regular here ! But definitely will never go bak ! The food is no difference with other sushi place , but getting treated like this so not wort it!  If you are looking for a all you "can't" eat place this is it!!!!

Amazing service and impressive. Loved how cozy it was. The chef gave us candy at the end and asked us our names. Probably the best service I've had at any restaurant. The lunch is a good deal and the dynamite roll was awesome.

So I had to hit up my old fav sushi wa before I headed out of town again and the new all u can eat (tear drop)......is BOMB!!!!!   At first glance I thought I might be disappointed because the use to have a half price lunch special, but has been replaced by the all you can eat and if anybody is like me they go in on the sushi when its good. The menu for lunch is pretty much all inclusive except for a few items like the sashimi and other more expensive items but every things a go for dinner. I fell in love with this place for their unagi and albacore, but everything is delicious and the portions unlike many other in Vegas are big.   Even though I've tried most sushi places in the city I always come back to Sushi Wa, so give it a try if you're in the neighborhood......and if you're brave try the oyster shooter which is included in the special, the oyster is huge but delicious. Enjoy!!

Food: Excellent - All the pictures you see posted here are real and are presented beautifully - Reasonably priced - We received complimentary sample rolls and appetizers from the Chef: Mango roll, fried salmon roll, noodles in a broth. - Complimentary ice cream: red bean flavour was my favourite  Service: Excellent++ - Waitress repeated our orders to confirm - Chef came to our table and thanked us. You can tell he is quite passionate about his food and business. - Chef asked for our names to try and remember us for next time we come back. - Chef held open the door for us when we left. Thanked and shook our hands again.  Our Party: - Group of 5 - Quiet/empty when we first arrived on a Wednesday afternoon.  Overall: - This hidden gem deserves the 5 star rating. - I'm surprised this place doesn't have a line out the door. - We'll be coming back and spreading the word.  Suggestion for the restaurant: - Please post your menu online somewhere. I couldn't find it!
I'm here at Sushi Wa for supper. This in the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. Their all you can eat deals a fantastic deal!!!
Great sushi.  They take forever to bring you a check, but food is great and staff is friendly.
Awesome Sushi, very cozy, you can feel the owner really loves what he does, great family environment, awesome prices, terrific service, its a hidden gem!!!!  5 out of 5!!!!

I am so blown away by the quality of the food and amazing service of this small restaurant. The food was amazing! The chef even seared one of the white fish sashimi pieces to give the whole dish extra depth. The chef, Joseph, even came over and introduced himself and we introduced ourselves. Was such a nice place. Super impressed and highly recommend it. They even gave us lollipops (love it!).

Sushiwa is by far the best sushi place in North York, if not the greater Toronto area. Joseph is the owner and in charge in the kitchen. Get used to seeing him because he will get to know your name and you'll never forget it!  Here's one of the nicest warm and kindest people you'll meet in the restaurant business and he will serve you until you absolutely cannot eat anymore. The food is 10 out of five. My fianc√© and I go there as often as possible because it's nice to be recognized and it's also nice to be treated a little bit better than the next restaurant

I came to this restaurant for the first time today, based on the reviews on Yelp. The food was great!!! The salmon sashimi was really fresh - and I must admit I am a sushi snob since I grew up in Vancouver. All of the sashimi, in fact was fresh. I also like how they have mini sized special rolls. This gave me a chance to try a few instead of just one. The tea service was continuous and the ice cream at the end with the cereal at the bottom was a nice touch. Best part - the sweetest sushi chef ever. He came by our table to check on us. At the end he walked us to the door. I will definitely come back!

This place is RACIST Last night my wife and I went to eat dinner here. We walked in and an another couple walked in right after us they went to the bar. We chose a booth. THE WAITRESS is attending us while I'm ordering during mid conversation I kid you not. She walks away with out letting me finish my sentence an goes to take the order from the other couple that walked in after us. She brought them water ect right away. Then she came back to my table as if I was going to carry on w my sentence how are you going walk away while you take my order an just disappear because the couple after us were the same race as the waitress . This place is trash fire the waitress . It's first come first serve . Not who looks like me gets first. We are ALL HUMAN . these people have no class .

Been to Soho and thought they did have the best uni but sushi wa has better urchin...  The one star is for the uni alone.  Dined in just a few hours ago.  The host/ waiter was not very welcoming and the entire experience was ruined from the start.  Very poor service from the waiter.  I felt very uncomfortable throughout the night because he truly did begin the dining experience by being aggressive and not helpful (with suggestions, etc.).  It was my first time eating at his restaurant and certainly the last.  Maybe the food was fantastic but I am having a really hard time overlooking the horrible service aspect of the dining experience.    The biggest restaurant sin is when a waiter or waitress attempts to be nice(r) and/ or genuinely friendly towards the end of the dining experience.  Perhaps, that is a way of securing a good feedback, gratuity or a future visit?...  Nah, neither one was warranted because the service was such a disappointment at sushi wa.    I will never discourage anyone from trying this place.  Some of the dishes (especially the uni) were fantastic.  I will, however, caution to potential customers to be aware that the service can be rated a 0 out of 10.  Sometimes a balance of great food and excellent customer service is the best way of attracting and retaining customers... Tonight, I am walking away from sushi wa.  That's okay though... They seem to be doing well, anyways.

My wife heard of this place through a colleague. We've been looking for a good AYCE sushi place near our house, and I think we may have found it. In my opinion, this is the best AYCE in Vegas. Their menu is expansive and all items can be ordered (for dinner, some limitations for lunch). The one thing that got me for an AYCE was their uni (urchin). It was tasty and fresh, not the best i've had, but it definitely tasted the way uni should.  Other pros: The waitresses were so nice. One took my restless 1 year old for a tour around the restaurant and gave her some chocolate. So awesome.  Their rolls are creative. I strongly recommend the mountain roll and the superman burrito, soooo good. The screaming orgasm is also good, up there with I love Sushi's, slightly spicier which my wife and i loved!  Only cons were that the salmon sashimi tasted as though it was washed with water prior to serving, giving it a less fresh taste.  Overall, we've definitely found our spot for when we're craving AYCE sushi!

Sushi Wa is probably the best sushi bar I have ever been to. The food was amazing and the service was great too. Sushi rolls ranged from $8-$14. All in all it was a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

This sushi spot has one of the best atmospheres I have ever seen for a sushi place. They offer comfortable half moon booths which also make for a great first date spot.   The service and staff were incredibly attentive, beverages were constantly refilled and food did not take long to arrive.   The one part I felt lacked was the food itself. The miso soup lacked in taste, I am not sure what kind of broth was utilized but I expected more from it. The sushi rolls, while affordable, were not incredibly distinguishable, it was not enough to make me come back for more.  It was ok sushi, but nothing to write home about. Perhaps it's due to the fact they offer "all you can eat" at a very affordable price ($27 at the time of my visit) which means they may have to skimp on quality.   While the atmosphere and staff really shine in the place, I feel there are better locations for sushi in the area.

Did Uber eats. I got the poke bowl and a ramen. Food was good. I was glad they pack the soup separate from the noodles. So I ate the poke bowl for lunch and the ramen for dinner. I will be dining in one of these day to check out what other stuff they got..

Here's  the deal people on here don't  understand. Its all you can eat there's  a reason some rolls have alot of rice, the place needs to make money! If yoy want sashimi or low rice go with the ala carte option.They still have sashimi and sashimi salads on the menu which most AYCE places don't. The fish portions were good not extravagant but alot better then most ayce places. Also they had alot of appetizer options  which are unique and not skimpy  in meat or chicken. Also the most important  thing is that unlike every single sushi restaurant in that area this one has never been closed down by the health department.

Called late to make sure they were still open and thankfully they were. Showed up at 10pm for takeout and met the very pleasant staff. They were very welcoming and offered some tea and a small noodle appetizer while I waited. Driving back to my hotel I couldn't help but think was it worth the drive yet as I started to eat, it definitely was. Not only was the staff and chef super nice but he food was delicious. I will definitely be back. Well done Chef Joseph!

Was in the neighborhood & craving Japanese food. Saw Sushi Wa & decided to try it. So glad we did! First thing that impressed us was the menu sign at the door telling us they are open til 4am!! We were further impressed when we walked in & saw how nice the ambience & decor was. Some people were walking out as we walked in & I asked them how it was. One guy right away said " it's always good!". Because of what he said my expectations were pretty high - I was not disappointed! We decided to do AYCE so we could try as many things as possible to see what we liked. They had a lot of items to choose from. Our favorite was the kalbi (beef short rib on the menu). The only thing I didn't care for was the ponzu sauce they put on the nigiri I ordered. They did offer to remake it without the sauce but I decided to try it. I have just never seen it served that way. Our server was Celeste & she was great. She checked on us often & got everything we ordered right. We're definitely coming back!

- VERY slow service - Food is so so...not very hard to get sushi wrong as long as the fish is fresh. - Had the all u can eat, but had to cancel because it was SO slow  Overall, gave this place 2 chances already and they have failed to deliver.

Exellent food and service! 10 out of 10 if I could forsure haha! The people are friendly and the music isnt that bad either so I suggest you try this place out oh and get the california tempura roll its tops.

Wow! That's all I have to say, iv eaten at dozens of sushi places and I was really blown away by this place. Service was excellent, fish "salmon sashimi" was very fresh! I definitely will be coming back to this place and recommend it to anyone.

The workers at Sushi Wa are the friendliest people I have ever met in my life! The chef personally came up to my table and introduced himself and asked how everything tasted. He also asked us for our names so he could remember us in the future. Impeccable service AND amazing food.

We were looking for a late dinner on a Saturday and discovered this little gem..open until 12:30am..AYCE $25.  Excellent service.  Nice decor.  The food is delicious and well presented.  This is our new go-to for sure!  Easy parking, tucked away in a corner strip mall.
Great food, nice environment and music.. Oh and they have the softest toilet paper lol would recommend to a friend.

This is my new place to go for sushi, by far this is some of the best sushi I have ever had. The service is great, the restaurant is beautiful, and the food is perfection. Extremely fresh and flavorful. Only negitive is the salmon skin roll, it was not very good quality for some of us who liked it in the past. However they did take the roll away from us for no charge. They even let us make a modification to a roll to add cream cheese, I can't count the amount of sushi places that won't. Great experience and we will be back here.
Really great atmosphere. Server is really friendly and was greeted at the door. Food has good quality and tastes amazing!

So glad we stumbled across this place.  Amazing food,  amazing service. The crispy rice roll in my opinion is the best, but  everything we had was great.  The atmosphere is fun and waiters are very attentive. We've found a new date spot!!!

Food was so great! Some of the best baked rolls.   Went on a Saturday night and they seemed understaffed. The service was so genuine and helpful when we couldn't make up our minds but soooooo slow. Luckily we didn't have anywhere to go.   Will definitely go back but we'll make sure we don't have any commitments after!

I'm assuming this place is better during dinner time?!?   My daughter and I came in for lunch before hitting TJoes across the street. I've never been here until today. When you walk in it is quite impressive, tall half round booths, dark rich colors and a hip atmosphere. We were seated right away by friendly staff.  We decided to go with the lunch box and a couple of rolls. I opted for the salmon for my lunch bento. I highly recommend NOT getting the salmon with your lunch box. Apparently, "cooking" fish isn't their thing. It was a flimsy piece of salmon but it was the $9 lunch box so I get it. But did they have to overcook it? The edges were hard and dry, thank god for the teriyaki sauce. The tempura was tempura, the rice was rice and the California rolls were California rolls, no biggie.   What I found interesting and cost efficient was placing shredded iceberg lettuce underneath the mixed greens. Did I sign up for that? As Cher said on Clueless, it's like a Monet. From a distance it's pretty but when you get up close, it's a mess. It's not word for word but you get my point.   Then after we were finished, our soup arrived?!? Our server forgot.  I'm going to leave the review on the rolls alone. Just look at the pictures.
Can't go wrong with this place. Been coming here a long time. Solid sushi. Not a bad price at all! Good atmosphere, and open till 4 am now

I am giving one star for a reason...  I used to love this place, food quality was good and service was great.  But that all change today, and it was unbelievable what the server had told me.  The Nigiri was not fresh today, food was ok.  The service I would give 0 star if I could.  Every time we are trying to order, the server always give us this bad look.  And we don't really eat that much, trust me.  The worst part was the server lie to us in our face saying there is a limit of the Ice Cream per person...  Which is not true and I told her I have been here plenty time.  She immediate change her story saying it is not limited "BUT I THINK EACH OF YOU HAVE 1 MOCHI ICE CREAM AND 1 REGULAR ICE CREAM I THINK THATS ENOUGH FOR YOU GUYS"  I seriously start to laugh and tell her forget about it.  And this is my first time in my life left a $0 tips.  I thought it's AYCE!!!!  As a business owner, I feel sorry for Sushi Wa owner to have staff like that.
This place is amazing! Late night sushi was litttt. Miko gave us really good service! Definitely coming back :)

The service was excellent, everyone was very friendly and everything was done quickly. The waitress was very nice with constantly refilling the tea at my table; we later just asked for a pot of tea by our table. The restaurant was a little small with just under 10 tables. The food was fresh and well made. I came for dinner with a friend and we ordered 2 regular rolls and some sashimi. I thought it would not be enough, but it was made very large and not stuffed with rice (what many sushi places seem to be doing). There was some complimentary appetizers which is a plus.   I would definitely return and recommend this place.

Sushi Wa is incredible.  I am not a huge Sushi fan, but Sushi Wa is delicious.  I am a big fan of their chicken and rice.  The wait staff is extremely friendly and will answer any questions you have.  The atmosphere is great for hanging with friends and even birthday parties! I highly recommend Sushi Wa!
Great appetizers ,sushi rolls are really good the quality of the fish is always fresh love this place that's my favorite all you can eat sushi place
Great place ! My daughter loves the California roll ! I will be coming back soon ! Jenny was so fantastic and helpful.
Jenny was so kind and professional! Great restaurant! We had a large party and they were so accommodating!! Must go!!

I went to this sushi place because it was across the parking lot from my work place. I only ordered one roll and saw that it was an AYCE place good thing i tried it first the place was terrible. I had the Tiger Roll from there, i tried alot of tiger rolls, but this had to be the worst it was so bland the only taste i got from the roll was the tuna on top that tasted like metal..... seriously if your going to charge $14 for a roll make sure it is good. Needless to say I will not be back

Awesome food and service.. I highly recommend the sushi boat.. It comes with tempura, seaweed salad, music soup and crunch soup, the beef teriyaki was excellent and the chef is very friendly.. They will have Ube ice-cream next week for Pinoys planning to go

This place is a 3.5 star to me. Decent sushi. Decent service. Decent ambiance. Decent price. I would come back but I won't crave it.   At $21 the lunch all you can eat is a good deal. We had a bunch of different rolls which were all ok, but the ikura is crap. Don't get it.

A great spot for true sushi lovers. They add just the right touch of flavor to every dish. So you may as well forget there's wasabi at the table. If you love variety, this place should be on your list.  All you can eat includes sashimi, an extensive menu, desert (moochi and banana tempura, etc...). We will be back!!!
They are very polite, professional, and fast service!  Love the all you can eat even on weekends!  The kids price is half the adult and works out perfect!
My regular sushi joint. All you can eat includes everything on the menu, and everything is good. They have gluten free soy sauce, if you need it (ask for "wheat free").
First time there...they have plenty of staff and the rolls and drinks keep coming...sushi and rice are fresh and bomb ski!!!! Must go...all u can eat is right price!

The service is awesome, the family owned sushi shop really goes above and beyond to make your dinner experience an extra nice one!  The food is average and the place is super small. We had a group of 12 including kids, and the place is really not designed to accommodate this size of a group. The chap chae didn't quite taste like it should. The rolls were good.   It's a fine spot for a casual dinner if you're nearby, but not necessarily worth going out of your way for.
Good is mediocre at best. I ordered via uber eats. Service and delivery was fine. They made 2 rolls quickly. Wouldn't choose to come back because it was just okay.

Wow is all I can say!! Definitely a hidden gem and well worth the find! We ordered a roll party tray and all their rolls were delicious and really fresh. Just the right amount of rice and each filling was well filled. The tempura was super crispy, crunchy and fried wonderfully. We had green tea ice cream which had corn flakes at the bottom, which was awesome!! Now the service was really wonderful!! Joseph, the sushi master, was just epic with random samples on the house for us and even came to ask us how the food was and how our night was going. Great attention to detail and keep up the good service Sushi Wa!!!

This is my first time at Sushi Wa and I am not disappointed. Great service, friendly people. $23 for all you can eat lunch and $27 all you can eat sushi for dinner  I will be coming here time and time again for the drinks and the service and the delicious sushi

Not my normal AYCE place but this place is good! Nice variety of appetizers. I recommend the fire cracker, who's your daddy, heart attack, and the muscles. We had the Rose roll: baby lobster, scallop, mushroom, red onion, on a Cali roll! As for then nigiri...pepper seared baby tuna!! Love love love it! The portions are not small and the nigiri pieces are BIG!!!

Heard this place from a family member that she talk so highly of. I was impressed with the decor, price is reasonable,  food was ok not great liked their ahi tuna poke a lot though. Too bad you can only have one per person if you're doing ayce. And here's the negative part why I'm only giving them 3 stars...service was mediocre at best. Server is rushing to drop plate on the table and by the time she says what the food was she's gone and they are not even busy! Our orders were wrong and our drinks were not filled for the last hour and had the balls to tell my husband he can't order drinks after we paid. Menu needs a lot of work. I don't think we'll come back.

The attention is this place is amazing! It's one of the main reasons for which I would come back. The sashimi was super fresh and all the sides were on point.   Price point is excellent for the area. 100% recommended.

I'm in love with this place!  There are so many sushi places in town and they are all nice.  But the service in this restaurant is amazing and they have the food to match it.  We ordered our food and I felt like it came out in minutes!  We have attentive staff that made sure our glasses were completely full.  The sushi is extremely fresh and you can tell the chefs take their time and do things right.  I love this place, and I'm always here for my sushi fix for sure!

This place is definetly one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places that I go to. 2 of my favorite things that I ordered during my last visit was the pepper seared baby tuna and the baked mussels. Last night was my first time trying the pepper tuna, but when I tried the first one it was so good, I swear I ordered two more orders, it just melts in your mouth so nicely. As for the mussels. If you are a fan of baked mussels, you need to try theirs. One of my top two places to order mussels from. Most sushi places in Vegas has them either too burnt or the cheese that they use gives an odd taste, but Sushi Wa's is perfect. Also ask for Jenny if she's working. I haven't really bothered to make any reviews about this place, but she was the best server I've had there so far. Very friendly and constantly checked up on us to see if there's anything else she can get us (we are A LOT) thanks again Jenny! :)
Best around!  Sheena is a great server and didn't miss a beat!  Definitely a must have if you want quality at a fair price!

Went to Sushi Wa today for lunch.  We have been to many restaurants, but this is considered one of the most memorable meals we have had.  Food: Beautifully presented with details to flavors; all the food was delicious We received 3 complimentary appetizers including - a small dish of soup noodle for each person - a beautifully presented (and tasted) mango roll - a spicy tuna roll - We ordered the following items - All lunch specials came with the salad and soup 1. Sashimi lunch - $12.95 - 12 pieces of sashimi INCLUDING - smoked flavored (that has also been marinated as explained by Joseph our Chef) tuna, halibut and milk fish - Lots of attention to detail - the red snappers have small pieces of green pepper to be eaten together - gives you new flavors - A generous portion of salad - 3 pieces of California rolls and one small serving of daily side dish - it was a freshly prepared fried spring roll 2. Tempura Lunch - $8.95 - Comes with the 3 shrimps and 5 pieces of vegetables - The rice came in a bowl that was in reasonable in portion - Tempura was very crisp and not greasy 3. Lunch special roll set - $12.95 - You get to choose 1 from 6 special rolls (that come in 8 pieces) and 1 from 6 mono rolls (that come in 6 pieces) - We got Dynamite roll and the Alaska rolls - The rolls were nicely done  Complimentary ice cream - we got to choose the flavor The portion of the ice cream is 1.5 bigger than what you will usually get.  More importantly, there are some corn flakes that they have put at the bottom of the ice cream so you get a different texture.  Such attention to detail undeniably warmed our hearts.  Service: heartfelt  How do I begin?  Joseph the sushi chef came and spoke with us a couple of times.  He made sure we are comfortable.  He offered candies to the girls.  He took out his little booklet and asked to write our names down (including our girls).  He also offered the girls to feed their fish when we are leaving.  The waitress was kind and attentive.  Joseph shared with us that he opened Sushi Wa a year ago.  We hope that he will be here for a long long time because hubby joked that we can come every Saturday for lunch now (open  7 days a week EXCEPT for Sunday lunch).  Our girls said Sushi Wa is now their favorite restaurant.  Thank you Joseph :)

Cute and cozy restaurant tucked away in the corner of this center. AYCE Sushi and full menu options.  We split a bunch of AYCE menu items - loved the Avocado lover which should have been called the CRAB LOVER! Stuffed with crab and pickled jalape√±os.  I'll be back!
Best AYCE sushi in Henderson. Love how friendly the staff is! Ordering is quick and love that you can pick from the hot food items as well! Lunch is $21.95 and Dinner $26.95
I don't recommend this place!!! The sushi is not that fresh and the service is horrible. Skip it !

If I could give not a single star I would because management is absolutely awful!!! Never had management be so rude to a customer in my entire life we got the all you can eat sushi and we ordered the mountain roll which was 15 dollars!! and it was disgusting!!! we asked if we could send it back after one bite and the employees INCLUDING management fought us tooth and nail because they tried to enforce their "rules" and charge is for the roll that we clearly only took a bite and where disgusted by it so we called over the server and the manager to came over and said we had to pay for it but then against their own rules! said we could take it home but no one wanted to eat it because it looked like a dog ate garbage puked it up ate it and puked again on the plate after fighting with them for almost 15 mins. They finally took it off but where so rude about the entire situation never been to a sushi restaurant where they won't let you give back food that was disgusting... just completely unprofessional... never ever EVER AGAIN will go there... and their chicken katsu for 11 dollars was the smallest portion I have even seen I was done with it within 5 mins... please if you like sushi and good service avoid this place at all possible...

One of the best sushi gems in all of GTA!!! Prices are fair. Quality of sushi is very high. Owner/Head Chef greeted everybody and made sure everything was okay. Servers kept refilling hot tea without us asking. They even gave us free ice cream afterwards.  Definitely coming back here!!

I've been to this restaurant several times & it's always great. Tonight the salmon belly, uni, sweet shrimp, & tuna were very good. We were in a group & the wait staff was always very attentive to us. We'll be going back again.

Good sushi at a decent price (not too pricy). Would definitely return. We ordered the yaki udon, which was good and not too oily, as well as the King roll and Eskimo roll. I like how they have 'mini' sizes of the rolls, so you can order a larger variety to try!  We also got a free tiny sushi roll to try- they said it is a new addition to their menu (when I say tiny, I mean TINY- like the size of a toonie). It had spicy mayo sauce on it, and wow was it spicy! The biggest disappointment was that we didn't get ice cream at the end of the meal!!!!! :(

4 or 4.5.  I went here with my SO when he was visiting because we already went to Osaka that week and wanted to try a new place.  The fish is super fresh. They have the normal rolls, but their special rolls are amazing!  The decor is great, definitely chic. You don't feel out of place in jeans and a T, though. We went here late afternoon. The LSU game was on (SO went to LSU) and it's a nice place to watch sports. It was interesting...all of the sushi chefs were into the game, but normally at other places that means the rolls take forever to get finished and are low quality. All I can say is...great multitaskers! The rolls were awesome, the fish was top quality, it wasn't busy, very attentive staff.  Try something new and order a roll that sounds intriguing. At some sushi places I am not happy when I do this, but everything here is described well and they tell you exactly what to expect. YUM!

This place is ridonkulous.  I don't use the word "ridonkulous" often but this place deserves it! AYCE is phenomenal. Wa Salad is some incredible sashimi salad concoction that deserves it's own platform to perform on.  Kid friendly yet posh looking on the inside. Standing ovation.  I will be back.  Maybe even tomorrow.  Moved down to 4 stars from 5.  This last trip back, the food was still good bit service not so much.

The best sushi I've had in Toronto. The owner, Joseph, is very friendly and greets customers every time, while making an effort to remember names. They also give you lots of samples on the house. Overall, great service and great food!

Sushi Wa has officially become my favorite sushi place in Vegas.. even if it is on the complete opposite side of town for me.  The sushi bar is stupid busy, and they get food out fast.  My friend decided we were doing AYCA sushi for me, lol, and I usually worry about these decisions because I usually don't down a lot of sushi in one sitting.  Buuut, this AYCA includes sashimi,  and appetizers, and dessert.  There was LA kalbi on the menu, and I get it's portioned small because it's an app and it promotes variety, but damn they were good.  They were done so right, and this was my friend's first opportunity try some Korean BBQ. Yeah, this is another sushi place run by Koreans, and it's good.  She got their garlic edamame and I got the spicy one, it's actually spicy.  I liked it more than I usually like edamame.    We got the rose roll, and it had lobster and baked scallops and sauce and sweet  onion and was really tasty, her favorite is the ultimate garlic tuna roll, it's on a plate surrounded by garlic sauce.  We got salmon sashimi, and this other roll with white tuna on top and I forgot what it was called, and bunch of other stuff I can't remember the names of, I can't remember the menu, but just eat it.  We got coffee and green tea mochi ice cream, it was a nice little end.
We have been here many times, and they have not only excellent food but excellent service. They have ayce of course, which makes this place worth while. The rolls are great, the fish is very fresh!

Excellent service and great food! Read all the reviews and had to come and check it out. Won't repeat all the great stuff about Joseph as it was all true from the little book to walking you outside. We got 2 of the bentos and the portions were great and the sushi was very fresh. We got back from Japan a month ago and it was nice because it was like the super friendly service all over again and good sushi for not being in Japan. We will be back again!

Cant go wrong with the AYCE! Price, and selection is amazing compared to most sushi places. Lovely decor, nice service as well. I ordered a baked roll, attempted to eat it, but my stomach wasnt having it! They gladly took it back and did not charge me for the roll.  Will definitely be back!

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the area. Their lunch Bento is nicely portioned and the price is fair as well for the quality of food they are serving. The feel of the restaurant is nice and cozy and their staff is friendly and helpful especially their chef who tries to come around and see how everyone is doing.

The AYCE option let's you try everything, which hubby and I love. We hadn't been here in a while but we're glad we came, for the most part. The tuna poki salad was good, we loved the Mango Salmon Roll, Double D, and Baked Salmon Roll. Hubby ordered the Albacore Salad and it was huge, so unfortunately he got full on that pretty quick.  The disappointments were the Ultimate Garlic Tuna Roll, which surprisingly lacked flavor, and the Green Tea Tempura Ice Cream, which wasn't very crunchy at all. Also got a very oily sweet potato tempura, which we didn't eat. And one shrimp tempura with the Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura left me wanting more shrimp. They should offer half roll options too, not just for the last roll.
Great place to eat... A small restaurant with big service and great food. Try the spicy tuna... Try something new I am sure will not disappoint.

We love Sushi Wa! This spot has become a regular for me and my husband. To the reviews that state that they don't get enough fish and too much rice - I have never experienced that. All the times I ordered sashimi, I receive a huge slab of fish. All their rolls are great and I've never had bad service in all the times we've gone. Love their Superman Burrito!!

Sushi Wa used to be the best AYCE in its zip code, but I hadn't been there in a few years due to its major drop in quality.   For my niece's graduation dinner, we went there, and the beef appetizers got me sick. I had to run to the bathroom.  Also, none of the fish seemed fresh or even close to it.  I'm not going back, and apparently many others have had the same experience because the restaurant was empty.

Have to visit this establishment every time I visit Las Vegas. Always sit at the bar and talk to the chef as they prepare our orders. I like the AYCE so a variety of foods can be sampled. The food is great. I can't wait until I visit again next year!
Sushi wa is always our go to when we want sushi! The service is amazing !! And the AYCE IS SO WORTH IT ! We only come here when we're craving sushi.

Love going to try new places , but usually you stick to what you know with sushi.  Glad i give the place a try!  The restaurant it self was extremely trendy, food was exceptional and service was as well.  Will be back

This was my first time trying sushi. The reviews seemed pretty good and my friend wanted to go back because she has enjoyed it in the past.  Only one other table of diners, we were seated quickly. We had some questions about the menu and the all you can eat option.  Friend ordered some sashimi while we decided.  Decided to go for the all you can eat $26.95.  We were told she couldn't because the sashimi she ordered wasn't part of the deal.  Expressed my frustration because we TOLD him we were thinking of that option.  The manager gave her approval though we had to pay $9 for the appetizer.  Things were going well. The food was quite slow coming out of the kitchen and we were not getting plates at the same time.  It was throwing off the tempo of the meal.   We were talking and then the waiter decides to tell us that we will be charged for any food left on the plate.   We did NOT over order. It was that he brought 2 plates out at the same time.  Then after we expressed our irritation with him. The manager came over again and said, "I see you are really trying."  Gee thanks, so you won't charge me MORE money.  Left there spending $80.00.   Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

Had a terrific dinner last night, AYCE.  The full menu was virtually available and the sushi was excellent!  The Rose Roll was unbelievable!  We had made I Love Sushi our regular stomping ground, but now SushiWa is on top of our list.

I've been here twice now for the all you can eat sushi and I'm a fan. I recommend going in a group and all getting AYCE so that you can share and try more things without getting full on a single item. It is good quality, made to order sushi. They limit very few items, like you can only get one order sea urchin and of sashimi per person. I loved the Screaming Orgasm and the Pepper Seared Tuna sashimi, definitely getting those again. Appetizers are also included in the AYCE deal ($26 at dinner) which was a pleasant surprise - almost everything on the menu is unlimited. But leave room for desert because the AYCE also includes your choice of ice cream, mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream and banana tempura. I was stuffed but I couldn't resist tempura green tea ice cream.

Took my dad and 2 brother here for dinner to celebrate my dad's belated birthday..  THE FOOD: 4/5 First and most importantly...the food was really good. Albeit desserts, the banana tempura and coffee Mochi were amazing and is one of the main components that would favor the odds in me going again. The diverse variety of interesting  Rolls and side dishes is what I liked most about this establishment. Some definitely better than others, but it all ultimately comes down to personal preference.   SUSHI CHEF/SERVICE: 1/5 Now the service was on the other hand was very disappointing and unwelcoming. When being seated, we asked to sit at the bar to where we could have a view of the tv. (which had my dads favorite team playing that night for Thursday night football) We asked to seat near the middle of the bar and was told they were closing this section down for the night. I asked if they were reserved but was told that section of the bar was not going to be available for customers and would not be seating anyone on that side for the night. So, we were sat in the left corner of the bar near the restrooms where there is little to no view of the tv, which isn't a huge deal to be honest because we were all talking/enjoying each other's company, & if we wanted to eat somewhere to watch sports we'd of gone to Buffalo Wild Wings or something lol. Really not an issue, but definitely a bit annoying considering the fact that within the next 5-10 minutes, as new customers arrived, they were greeted more welcoming and provided more favorable service with no restrictions when asking to sit at the bar, "Yes, of course, please sit anywhere you'd like."Couple that with the fact that every time we'd order anything, our chef was lacking professionalism and displayed bad manners/service. He kept insisting on making it a point that if we didn't finish the food they'd charge us extra. Which is understandable to let your customers know this, especially considering we did order a lot of food, but when your out trying to celebrate a birthday it definitely gives off bad vibes when your chef keeps reminding you of this rule every 3 seconds. Definitely lost major points with us given the fact that with each additional order his body language and tone continued to become noticeably more and more negative/pissy. Several times while he came over to collect new requests, he would hear the first one and while myself or someone in my party would begin to make a new request for other items he would ignore, cut off or immediately walk away while we were speaking to ignore additional requests. Needless to say we did finish everything we ate. But the service from being seated to dealing with the pissy-attitude chef was very underwhelming to say the least.  WAITING STAFF: 4/5 The waitresses/waiters who were running out drinks and side dishes however were extremely polite and professional and were very prompt and attentive to our needs. Outside of the seating situation we had initially had upon arriving, they were exceptional. The servers, specifically the middle aged Asian women who was working that night, were the only reason we decided to tip 20% and are the main reason we did not leave the place with a a bad taste in our mouths from the shortcomings of the chef.    Overall 3/5. Food was good. Service needs to get better. Sucks because all it takes is one person to ruin it for everyone. However in this case that "one person" happens to play a very important part in your restaurant. Hope for the future customers that they do not experience this as this NEEDS to be corrected. That chef is NOT an accurate representation of how the overall staff was. I do not over react like others who when experiencing bad service will immediately bash and do the most to make an establishment look bad.
