Not a horrible/unbearable experience by any means, the food was good and dishes were more creative than your typical sushi bar, but when there is so much competition here in Vegas, places like this simply cannot afford to underwhelm in the service department.   Food for thought.

I'm a little upset about my visit tonight at Sushi Wa. My family and I go there just about any chance we get, but due to changing schedules, new jobs, etc. it has been about a month since we came in last.   We were seated quickly, in a booth that we requested- there were a couple at a table, a few people at the bar, and one other booth occupied when we arrived.   We noticed right off hand that the menus were new. Which made us wonder if the management or owner had changed- because it was a completely different style.   The waitress, who didn't introduce herself wasn't one that we had ever seen before. She brought back our drinks rather quickly, and took my boyfriends order, but as soon as I opened my mouth to ask for my rolls-she walked away. And she didn't come back until she delivered our first order of food.   When I did ask to order, her face completely changed. It was shocking to me.  At first I thought it was just me, but my boyfriend saw it as well. It looked as if I was severely an inconvenience to her, and as if she had somewhere to be.   I know that menu items take time, however, with a restaurant that isn't even 1/4 full, waiting 30 minutes for two rolls that were ordered by my boyfriend the first time is a little silly.   The food was still delicious, I recommend the sex bomb, bonsai, crispy rice, and the seared peppered baby tuna. However, it's the worst service that we have ever experienced-and I'm disappointed in sushi wa. Hopefully this was just a fluke.

I have been coming here for 2 years now, and always recommended this place to friends. However, was recently here and the waiting staff was so rude with derogatory comments. I will no longer eat here due to the rude waiting staff and will no longer recommend to others. I highly recommend the owners of this establishment get nicer waiting staff.
My family and I came for dinner . Just love this place! So fresh and delicious! If you like Sushi this is your place to eat at. The soups are so yummy! You must try the tempura  ice cream... omg !!

-Complimentary Apps (Korean Noodle Soup, Fried Tuna Roll, Mango Roll) -Lunch Bento is a pretty good deal -Volcano roll is one of the best I have ever had in my life but a little pricey at $14.95 -Presentation is always on point and so creative -Owner gave us free ice cream with corn flakes at the end of our meal -Waitresses are extremely attentive  Which restaurant do you go to now a days where the owner gives you complimentary item(s), asks for a personal review, writes your name down, shakes your hand, has good quality food on the regular then; personally walks you to your car and waves to you as you leave?!? Joseph is amazing; his good food and exceptional customer service is what is getting him good reviews and loyal customers. This place is in a plaza and is fairy small but comes with a great experience. I enjoy being here because I feel like the owner actually cares and its realy relaxing as opposed to being at other sushi places where I'm constantly on the look out to flag my waitress down for water.  Don't come here if you expecting an upscale sushi place with expensive decor and unique items, its a little family run spot with good customer service and good food

I would say Sushi Wa is the best place to go if you want to have an exquisite experience of Japanese cusine. They served us on the house small korean noodles (thin noodles as far as I remember), and it was so good. It was just the complimentary food on the house! The sushi, it was the best. It's 30 dollars for the small size sushi platter, but there's already a lot of sushi pieces in it and they are so generous with the fillings! The food was out of this world. They even greeted my mom by playing happy birthday and sticked a candle on our on the house ice cream! (Since it's our first time going here). May God bless this place and everyone else!
Food was great but the nigiris had TOO MUCH RICE. Our server didn't even check on us unless I waved her down.

My wife and I went here tonight. We don't get many times off and we we very much looking forward to it. We have been here before and always had an enjoyable time. But tonight I see why people will stop going to spots due to one night of unenjoyable experiences. We started with poki salad which was chewy. Had to track down the server that was assigned to tables and not the bar to get drinks And such. The staff behind the bar was silent and cold, didn't hear a word until good night when we got up to leave. Like I said we have enjoyed this spot many times but I will think of other options next time we get a minute with out the kids to ensure a great experience.

I went here on my lunch hour with coworkers. As a sushi newbie, this is only my 2nd time eating in a sushi restaurant . The atmosphere was nice, but the service was slow. Very slow. If  you got all the time in the world come on in. If the clock is ticking, pace yourself!  I had the cooked sushi and tempura, very yummy though.
This was my first time here. Definitely coming back. Friendly staff and very unique taste to the food. A lot of care was put into the food that was prepared. Loved it here!

So I live right down the street and been wanting to try this place ever since I saw it. Came in for lunch and the price is reasonable. The environment is nice and appealing.... But the big swordfish hanging alone... Doesn't make sense in the decor. Anyways, the food is good. Fish is fresh and cut in good portions. The waitress I had was friendly and to the point. For the amount of people here for lunch on a Tuesday I did expect food to arrive a little faster. But considering I wasn't in a hurry I didn't mind at all. Now my review of the food is based on nigiri because I do not like rolls. I'm not a sushi elitist by any means, I just like to taste the natural fish with little to no flare. To that aspect, the food was amazing. All the fish that I had was very fresh and minimalistic. Definitely will be coming back for dinner, might even bring the wife.

We had a large party of 31, they were almost prepared with seating for 26, so we scrambled to find other chairs to seat our entire party.  We signed up for the all you can eat for all the adults and Alan carte for the. Kids.  The appetizers are good, spicy edamame, but the agadashi tofu was not good.  The sushi was good and their rolls are a good combo.  Their uni sushi did not seem right, and it was a bit greyish, I could eat the second one, oh and was told if I didn't finish it,i I would be charged extra...needless to say, I hid it in the napkin and tossed it under the table. Hubby said the short ribs, korean, was delish, the kids loved the udon noodles, the hamachi Kama was bony but good, calamari yummy.  They have a huge variety of dishes, sides, sushi and appetizers!  You will be sure to find something g delish to enjoy!

Great prices, great quality, good service, what else does one look for in a sushi place? Also, lots of parking space! However, not too many seats are available so be aware of that. Also, try to stick to the lunch/dinner specials, they really over charge for an extra miso soup or an extra garden salad.
I 100% agree with Alex N. It wasn't that the fish was bad it was more like the whole thing felt like the McDonald's of a "chic sushi restaurant".
Great sushi, nice staff.  Good prices.
Sushi Wa is our favorite place for all you can eat sushi. The food is great. The location is right by our house. And the people are very nice.

TL;DR Very price friendly menu that offers quality for more than it's worth. You won't get full but if you order two lunch specials or a special + maki then you have your money's worth for a very satisfied stomach. The a la carte does NOT disappoint.  Came here because I've read all the tales about how the owner would greet you but unfortunately he didn't greet us today. Bummer. Also no toro, double bummer.  Went in about lunch time and the service was quite slow. Not because the server was lazy, there was only one. So if all the tables (listen there's only like 5) get filled up you can imagine how the service is gunna be when someone's trying to make everyone happy. I applaud this because the server was very nice and courteous.  The sushi here is quite above average I might say. It's not fishy for sure but I question the freshness for specific fish like how dry looking they were instead of the expected oiliness of fresh fish.   Ordering from a la carte was different. Maybe it was because I got fish that weren't necessarily similar to salmon and tuna. If you'd like your fish untorched or torched please let them know, they are very accomadating which is lovely in today's modern society of "I want my food like this" when sushi really is and should be up to how the chef serves it.  A la carte Mackerel Nigiri x2: 1 raw & 1 torched (4/5) I loved the raw mackerel but In my opinion, I didn't like the torched. I knocked off a star even though it was my choice to have one torched LOL.  A la carte Scallop (Hotate) x4 Raw (10/7) OMG WAS THIS SO GOOD. i was so sad to hear they didn't have any tuna belly in so I opted for this because I liked it so much that I ordered another two. Not fishy at all and the sweetness is a great pairing to the rice.  Lunch Special Beef Bento (3/5) Not filling, very pretty, side dishes were all lovely, but imo was sososo bland in a sense that the beef almost tasted like water LOL idk how or why I didn't like it but my dad said it was 'good enough' especially for how cheap it was. Ended up ordering another bowl of rice too.  Lunch Special Sushi & Sashimi (4/5) Cheap, better than average, beautiful, but the sashimi chunks were way too big for me. Very very generous but I don't personally enjoy eating half a piece of sashimi because it was cut too big or eating a whole chunk in my mouth. The sashimi was cut almost like chunks for a poke except it doesn't come with rice lol.  Overall a very beautiful restaurant with instagram worthy art and adorable service. The fish served is definafely better than most places I've been too and would definately drop by if I was in the area again for a budget friendly lunch. Thank you for having me!

After reading all the raving reviews here and seeing that it was in our new neighborhood, we gave this place a try. Why oh why oh why?! Let's start with the positive. The contemporary interior was a pleasant surprise considering the banal exterior facade.   Now for what really matters, service and sushi. Much MUCH! to be desired.   1) The temakis served were overfilled with unseasoned, mushy WARM rice. Nigiri rice appeared about 2 inches x 1 x 1.  Required two bites or a disgusting crammed-mouthful. Length of fish was not slightly longer than rice and sliced too thin.  TWO stars off.   Sushi rice properly cooked and seasoned and freshness/quality of toppings are key to the success of a sushi establishment for more discerning patrons. Fish quality here was fine considering you're in the middle of a desert.   2) twice reminded server that I had not been served my uni nigiri yet. Never got it although we were seated as dinner AYCE diners. ONE star off.   3) took 20 minutes for server to return to take second order. I'm a very patient person--still tipped 20%. Perhaps understaffed for the night? Not server's fault.   4) didn't appreciate being reminded to finish rice. See #1  5) 7:15 pm and they were out of hamachi kama. Perhaps they were slammed earlier. No star off for that.

The other night I came here for dinner and had a really good experience. The employees were really nice and the food was fresh. I ordered an avocado salmon roll (I know it sounds kind of boring) and two pieces of seared butterfish nigiri. However, I do have an excuse. I'm both gluten and lactose free so my options are limited to pretty plain items.   With that being said, my salmon avocado roll was better than most. It melted in my mouth and tasted fantastic! I'm not sure what their secret is but I'll definitely have to go back.   The seared torched butterfish was out of this world! It tasted amazing!  I've had seared sashimi at sushi restaurants before with some disappointment but the waiter recommended I order this and it was unreal. I actually didn't realize it was seared until after I placed my order. The waiter, who was really friendly insisted I would love it. Since I was starving I didn't bother changing my order and am so happy I discovered their seared butterfish. I don't really know how to describe it besides the fact that it was scrumptious, extremely flavourful and tender.   Allover I had a great experience at this restaurant and will definitely go back to dine in or order takeout.
Excellent sushi! Best place so far to get great sushi. Very nice and clean restaurant! The staff is very friendly, we will definitely be back! I recommend the Rose Roll, superman burrito.

This is a great place to get sushi. The fish is fresh and the sushi is amazing. The customer service is amazing and the owner will make sure you have a great meal. The only downside is that the place is hard to find and small. Though very nice. Will definetly come again.

Got the recommendations from my sister in law and she said everything was so good there... had to check it out so me and my fiance walked in and it was empty but the decorations were very modern lounge kind of feel.  The one manager was awesome giving us recommendations on which roll is good... and the waitor was super nice and funny... for AYCE they give you sashimi per person. I got the crunch albacore because I was already hooked on their calamari with the honey dipping and he got the screaming orgasm which I wish I order another one because it was so good!!.. the appetizers were amazing too... their mussels were cheesy and pretty big mussels compared to some places.  overall my experience there was amazing... chill ... friendly ... I definitely will come back....

Delicious rolls. fresh ingredients with thin rice, big chunks of avocado, really tasty.  Great service! The owner asked for our names and offered free ice cream. Imagine that he greeted all other customers and remembered their names, it is now hard to find someone who runs store like this.  Will definitely revisit when get a chance.
One of the best sushi places at Henderson ! With very good price for all u can eat! Loved the baja dish !

My Barber Shop is next door so we have decided to go to sushi wa on occasion. i usually never write reviews and often discredit "yelpers" for being super stupid with complaints like the price etc. The reason for my 1 star is a culmination of several things that made me uncomfortable and ultimately moved me to write this.  #1 - got the impression that they were really busy so i definitely expected things to move a little slowly.. that wasn't the problem, the problem was the Sushi Chef getting Visibly and Verbally upset over incoming orders, and our order.. we were the only diners at the bar and he actually was getting mad at us for ordering (he was busy fulfilling the seated guests orders)  #2 Not Once offered Wasabi or Ginger.. and we were honestly so weirded out by the Chefs attitude we were a little scared it would be awkward asking for it...   Go somewhere better, or definitely don't go for lunch on a Sunday. I would love for them to respond and explain

My dad loves this place and always makes sure to bring me here when I come to town to visit. And I can see why: The variety and quality of the sushi available is top of the line, and the staff/cooks are friendly and informative. Whether you go AYCE or a la carte, it's worth paying too much to spend an evening sampling every kind of roll you can think of and stuffing yourself sick on the wide variety of sushi here. It's expensive but worth it.

Even though this place is quite far from where we live, I love to come here because the sushi is so amazing. Our server Shenna is very attentive and personable. She was so good and we had a large party. I would definitely recommend this place to all of my friends!
Our favorite! !! We get our fix here weekly,  I highly recommend the peppered tuna!  Food, atmosphere and service deserve 5 stars!! Gio the manager and Mark the server Rock!

This place is just okay in my opinion. A friend's birthday promoted my 2nd and probably last visit here. I had been here one other time, and thought it was just okay, but I like to give a place the benefit of the doubt before I decide whether or not it is worth coming back. The second visit confirmed I will probably not be back.  There were 6 of us and the service started out good. We were given waters and menus and after a short while we ordered at least a dozen rolls and appetizers between the table. I was surprised at how quickly the first round of food came out. The rolls were just okay, some better than others for sure. My favorites were the Superman Burrito and the Japanese Lasagna. One thing I don't like is they are very heavy handed with the sauces. They are not very flavorful and don't complement the rolls as a sauce should. I like to taste the fish and not have it covered up with sauce. I also don't like the batter that they use for their deep-fried rolls, but that is no fault of theirs, that is just my personal preference.   Anyway after the first round we didn't see our server for a looooong time. We asked whoever we could flag down to get him to come to our table, but he was no where to be found. He finally emerged and we ordered more food. He was a nice guy, I just wish he came around more often. I enjoyed dessert the best. I got the banana tempura which comes with 6 pieces of fried banana, a scoop of vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. That was deeeelicous. They also have tempura ice cream, regular ice cream and mochi. Bonus points for having coffee flavored mochi :) I probably wouldn't come back here. It's on the other side of town from me, and I just don't particularly care for many of their items.

Had dinner at this restaurant today and we were very impressed. We got the AYCE and I was actually surprised how delicious the food was. We also really enjoyed the service. The staff was very attentive and pleasant. I also loved the decor, very stylish. We had an enjoyable experience and will most definitely come back!
A small place with excellent food. Don't judge it from the outside! What you had will be definitely worthy of what you paid! You can get free treat sometimes which is an extra benefit in here.

Sushiwa has amazing customer service. Jenny was amazing at making sure everyone got what they needed. She's amazing and the food is amazing. The variety of food on the all you can eat menu is among the best I've had. Also, try the white peach blossom cocktail, it's godlike.
Sushiwa is my favorite sushi place ever! The 911 rolls are to die to for! I come here all the the time with my friends for the all you can eat sushi! So good!
Great food and really good service.  The owner was really nice and welcoming. Will definitely go back!

This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas.  I love sushi and typically eat there once or twice a month, and have been doing so for the last 4 years.  I have always been a sushi lover, but always struggled to stay with one restaurant in Las Vegas due to occasional bad fish.  Sushi Wa has never let me down.  I have never left there with a bad taste in my mouth.  Their sushi is always super fresh!  And, I love some of their specialty rolls.  In my opinion, they are the best all you can eat sushi place in Vegas!  Additionally, their staff and new manager are top notch!

Went on Friday night for dinner and the place was busy; didnt have to wait in line because we went slightly earlier before dinner peak time. Staffs were friendly and accomodating. Sushi was excellent (balance rice and fish ratio) and the thought of putting bit and pieces of onion and/or afalfa sprouts in some pieces of the sushi left a good impression on us. We also had a torched salmon roll which was also really good. We will definitely be back.

I came here today with my mother. We came pretty hungry, and we wanted to try somewhere new.  The decor is super beautiful. Almost too nice for an ayce place. The waitresses are very nice and are always refilling your water and tea. The male waiter was pretty good looking lol. And very prompt. The food came out fast. They don't do half rolls, which is a bummer.  First things first. We got a miso soup, two cucumber salads, agedashi tofu, and two rounds of nigiri to start. The miso soup was huge and delish. The tofu was GINORMOUS and sweeter than any agedashi tofu I've ever had. Nonetheless, still tasty. The ikura was good. The salmon and yellowtail was also very thick, minimal rice, and fresh. The baby seared tuna was AMAZEEEE. The cucumber salad, I would avoid. Pretty tasteless.  We got a rose roll, which was again, huge. But okay. Lots of baby lobster and scallops. The superman roll was the hit. We loooove spicy garlic ponzu. It was delish! The pockey roll, or avocado lover was odd. Not what I was expecting at all. The jalape√±os inside were pickled? Which I found odd. Fresh minced or deep fried would have made it better for sure. The bikini roll was also pretty yummy, this was a riceless roll.  All in all, a pretty good place to go. Definitely coming back for that superman burrito roll and try some more stuff.

If you want to know what it feels like to be treated like a princess/prince (whatever floats your boat), this is the place to go!! I have not once felt as valued as a customer as I did here. They REALLY set the bar for high quality customer service. From the moment we stepped in to our last few steps out the door, Joseph (owner) and his employees provided us with the best service anyone could ask for!   Now please take a seat as I begin to narrate to you a tale from my book of WAIT WHAT, IS THIS RESTAURANT FOR REAL?! (because it was that unbelievably awesome).  It all started like this - as we walked in, we were immediately greeted by Joseph. He brought us to our sofa booth and FOR THE FIRST TIME IN MY LIFE, he actually pulled aside the table so that I could sit in with ease. Instead of having to shuffle in like I usually do, he very politely gestured for me to sit, before doing the same on the alternate side for my boyfriend to sit. You should've seen the look on my face.. I was so pleasantly surprised. Then, as we were going through the menu together, the employee caught on that we were first-timers so she asked if we wanted a picture book that depicted EVERY ITEM on the menu. That was a pretty awesome and useful compilation. After we ordered, we were brought our complimentary appetizers and we were given two extra dishes on the house! The first was a deep fried maki roll, and the other was a rice paper mango, beet, and avocado roll! Both were very interesting and beautifully presented.  We had ordered a small sushi and roll boat and beef bugolgi. The boat was awesome - again, beautifully presented, and the variety of sushi was both fresh and innovative! Some of them had been slightly torched and garnished with herbs or scallions, which really added to the aesthetics of the boat and the flavours of the sushi. The bugolgi was great too, but nothing too special that I would have to point out.  As we slowly ate away at our ambitious order, Joseph came to our table to greet us and introduce himself. He shook our hands and asked if we could write our names down in his little notebook so he could remember us by name?! What an amazingly sweet gesture. We talked for a bit before he let us resume our date. While we were just about to finish up, Joseph came to our table yet again and this time, he offered us ice cream on the house?! At that point, I was actually so overwhelmed by his generosity and kindness. I thought it would've been a small scoop to share between the two of us but NOPE, he brought out two full sized portions, one mango and the other ginger. The mango was great BUT THE GINGER DOEEE - it was delicious. It had pieces of candied ginger in it and both ice creams were supported by a base of corn flakes. It was honestly the perfect combination. A nice sweet and light crunch to the creamy and smooth ice cream.  Finally, as we were leaving the restaurant, Joseph walked us out to the door, and shook our hands one last time before wishing us well on our way.  LIKE WHAT?! Did you fully absorb all of that yet? Isn't it slightly hard to believe that there's still this quality of service in a regular restaurant in this day and age?!  Well, there is, and it's right here. SO YEP, 10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND.

OK, this is--THE NEW SPOT!!!-- Really 4.75 stars!!!   They have lunch a specials-1/2 off menu for sushi... Mon-Sat. before 3pm.  The Mexican Roll is a new favorite of myself and the husband!!!! It comes on wantons, no rice... its spicy tuna, onion, mango, jalape√±os and im sure a few other things! Its absolutely AMAZING!!! I didnt think i would like it, that was until i saw someone else order it asked what it was and then tried it... OMG, thats all i can say! The Superman Roll is just amazing also!!! (our favorite by far and we save it for last)   They have great Nigiri as well!!!! The Salmon literally melts in your mouth, the garlic tuna is wonderful, the super white tuna, great!!! They have very high quality fresh fish! I just cant say enough good about this place!!!  And and and... If you go there enough you get your very own set of special chopsticks with your name on them that you get to store there, pick up when you come in, use and they wash and keep them there for you for next time your in!! We got ours today!!!!!!! :) I cant wait to go back and use them! Next time i am going to try the Salmon-Bomb!! Which i noticed once i was too full this time! Husband said we could come on sat or mon next week to have lunch and try it!!!! So now Im really looking forward to going back next week for lunch!!!!!!!!!!   We ate a LOT, and i mean a LOT of stuff... like 6 orders of Nigiri and 2 orders of Mexican Roll, a Superman Roll (not on special, so it was $15) and like 3 other rolls as well........ $65 total/tax incl. Not bad at all!  SushiWa, I thank you for coming into my life just when i needed you..... I was just saying to the husband today when we were leaving that we would have to bring Brian (from the Ka) with us to SushiWa so we could see him and hang out and not have to go to the "awful Ka" ...... just a thought?!??

Went here last month been meaning to write about the excellent quality of there fish. Sat at the bar and JJ was our cook, we did the all you can eat. Great service and food. JJ even made us a little something special after we were full. Thanks for great service and food.

I have been to many AYCE sushi places and I must say this one was awesome, not just for the food but for the whole experience. Our waitress was very attentive, as were the other two men that were on staff. Some AYCE sushi places I have been to that have a time limit will let you order a few items and then just ignore you for a while to let the time pass before they can kick you out. This was not the case, they constantly checked on us and even when we were waiting for food we had ordered, they asked if we saw anything else we would like to order. They had great suggestions too. We had a few rolls, the superman burrito is a must try and the gyoza's were great. They had a large choice of cocktails and sake as well! Thanks for the great experience Sushi Wa staff, I will be back!

This is our go to for AYCE on this side of town. The late hours are great.  I had the bento box.  At 1am it was a good mix of items and really hit the spot.  The mango salmon roll was surprisingly refreshing and crisp quality.  Thank you Miko for always taking of us!  Excellent service.  Asks before I even realize I need something.  I love that!

It would've been 3.5 stars but I do like this place so I round up. Not the best place I've been, but the food is pretty good. Pricing for AYCE is like anywhere else, but they do offer sashimi with AYCE, but limited to one order per person. And the Pepper Seared Tuna, yum!! And the yellowtail.... mmmm  The service, though, definitely lacking. The 2 times I have been there has been on quite nights, with only 3-4 other tables, but yet still takes forever to greet the table. Okay okay, so we usually have 8-12 people and we order a lot, but we make it easy for the servers cause I do all the ordering and I keep it organized. But she had troubles getting all the orders, and some of the orders never made it out, and some got confused, etc.   But they got uni, amaebi, raw oysters, soft shell crabs (very small orders, but no limit), and the superman roll was good too. I usually don't go for many rolls cause they fill me too quick, but they are good! And handrolls... at first they were amazing, but after the first order, we ordered 6 more hand rolls and they went cheap on the fish!  Still, a good place to dine, if you have the time. Good and simple decor, TV at the bar for sports, and fresh quality fish. I recommend this place to lots of friends and family. Had the commute not been so bad, I'd be here every week. Well, maybe in the winter when I don't have to watch my weight.

Found this place on my trusty Yelp app and the Reviews did not lie! Why do I even doubt Yelp still? Anyways this Sushi place is delicious, cheap, and super friendly! We ordered the Small Sashimi and Sushi combo with Kalbi ribs. We also had the green tea ice cream. The fish was fresh and kalbi was juicy and yummy.   The prices are pretty decent and not uber expensive like some other Sushi places I normally frequent. At the end of our meal, Chef/Owner Joseph came to our table himself and asked how our meal was. We were honest as usual and told him that we could definitely taste all of the love and heart he puts into his food.   Come here for Sushi if you are in the area...or even if you are not.. make the trip because this place is that good!

This place is a hidden gem. Decided to try it out since it had a pretty high review and it definitely didn't disappoint. The presentation was nice and the service was amazing. Joesph personally came out and asked us how our meal was, took down our names and offered us ice cream since it was our first time there. On our way out the door he came out with us and gave us a lollipop each. The owner definitely made it a memorable first experience. I would 100% recommend this place to sushi lovers!
Great place and sweet servers ! Food is also great! I recommend the screaming O! Free beer with a yelp review too! :)

Really great sushi had an awesome time with my boyfriend they have these booths that are really tall and romantic!! Plus all you can eat sushi, and if u can eat sushi i strongly suggest u do because it adds up nicely! Also, they are open till 4a so definitely a new late night spot on my list!

Absolutely worth your while. This small restaurant features some best sushi rolls I ever had. And Joseph, the owner, rocks. He greeted me and my parents personally. No wonder this is one of the few that gets a five star rating.

Good sushi, great staff, and very kind staff. Our server was kind and smart, we went there for a late dinner on mothers day. the owner (Joseph) came to our table offered a rose for all ladies. He made effort to learn our difficult Iranian names, then he greeted us in Persian, it was a lovely gesture or at least memorable. Also he took our orders for complementary ice cream.

Came in for a quick dinner and that's exactly what it was. We were seated within seconds of walking in the door. The server took our drink order as soon as we walked in the door. Great service fresh fish. Good food. Highly recommended

If you don't live in the area (Henderson) or nearby you'd never know this place is there. It's hidden in a strip mall, which, I know is such a shock for Vegas (not!), next to the social security office. My husband and I discovered it one day after they first opened and went back several times.   The fish is very fresh and the rolls are very very tasty. If you sit at the counter the chef will prepare a special dish for you; we had something called Screaming Orgasm, and well, it speaks for itself. If you live in the area or have a local who can point the way for you, definitely give it a try.
Very nice restaurant  and close to my office.  Services  is great  and the food  is delicious.  Great for large party, business  meetings  or take your sweetheart

This Korean run place is a step above your typical sushi joint. For one, their sashimi is more fresh. And they put more care into crafting the sushi than other places. Decent price to quality ratio.  We ordered one of the boat set and were very satisfied. There is a good mix of fish in there. Service is a notch above your average place. Yes I was greeted by the owner who is a very energetic guy!  The best a la carte place in my opinion is still Marado which is also Korean run. But this is the next best thing for fresh sea food in the area. The space is quite small though. If you have a large group, might want to call in advance.

I actually didn't know what to expect as it is tucked into a plaza. We got the sushi and sashimi dinner for takeout. The presentation was adorable, they had radish, jalapenos and pea sprouts which actually really added flavour to the sushi. The fish was definitely very fresh and the rice had that perfect texture at the right temperature. Though the only thing I would say is that for approximately $20 for the set (which comes with miso soup and a salad), it's not necessarily the most filling thing. But I would definitely come back for lunch (as they do have good deals) and also try the rolls as well.
The service is always great, and the sushi is always fresh.  The ayce is great and you should try the fresh wasabi!

Sushi Wa Located in Henderson , a nicely decorated all you can eat sushi and Japanese restaurant offering a variety of sushi and Japanese inspired entrees and appetizers. This place is Yelp friendly as I noticed they suggest you ask how to get a free drink or app from the server.  My only confusion was that they wanted my to write the review before I obtained my free drink right there on the spot which didn't make sense to me as I don't review a place for he most part until after a few times even. So I mentioned I'd show them my review next time I come in !  I tried a variety of nigiri, sashimi, hot appetizers and they were all good. I generally don't go to all you can eat sushi spots but this one hit the spot ! Their service was more than exceptional.  I think next time I go i will try the Ramen!
Sushi is good but service is so slow, rude and disorganized it makes it impossible to recommend this place.  Too many other sushi places that treat their customers far better.
My new favorite sushi spot!  Beautiful decor, great music, and the best sushi I've had in a long time.  Best of all-amazing service.  We were so impressed and will definitely be back.

Man, this place was so much fun to eat at.  As we all know, I tend to dine solo.  If I'm hungry, I'm gonna go eat.  I can make friends where ever I'm at.  Cue scene: Saturday night 10pm.  I'm starved... After my disastrous breakfast, I realized I hadn't eaten since then. So I check out my trust Yelp for something close yet tasty.  Enter SushiWa and their AYCE.  I think what hurts this place is you have to know what you're looking for or else you will pass it.  I don't like the fact that I can't enter this center off of Eastern if I'm heading south from St. Rose.  If you turn on Coronado Center, it's the first driveway.    I stroll in, and the place is practically empty.  Bad for them, but that means I get my own sushi chef. Yay! As other people have mentioned, the fish is fresh... Very fresh.  Also, they are known for their rolls.  The rolls are very Americanized, which is something that I have a love/hate with.  Some of the rolls had a bit too much sauce for me (I like to taste my fish).  Don't get me wrong, they have sashimi and a limited traditional sushi menu, but it's pretty American.  I can understand the why behind it.  The cool thing is that when I just started asking for things not on the menu they could make it, which sparked an interesting "where are you from" conversation.  THE CHEF EVEN STARTED TO LEARN MY PALATE AND CATERED THE SUSHI TOWARDS ME!  That's service.  That's five stars!  Now, there is a bit of a language barrier with some of the chefs as English is definitely not their first language.  One of them even apologized to me at one point, I told them don't worry about it because it's not like I can speak his language anyway.  Also, I found the Korean influence on the menu interesting.  I'm certainly gonna go back and try the bulgogi.  I also loved that I could keep getting oranges for dessert-- orange that looked like a pumpkin, orange that looked like a cat.  Oh and they have Orion and another beer that is slipping my mind right now.  Whatever it was, it was $9, and boy was it tasty!  The best part was the staff themselves.  Did the waiter forget to refill my tea once?  Yes, but when he saw me pick up my glass and rushed to me apologizing profusely for his mistake.  It actually made me feel badly that he felt so badly about it.  The chefs were so much fun to hang out with.  I was laughing so hard at one point that I started crying.  Joon, Ken, and "buy one get one free" totally made my night.  I didn't feel like I was out to eat by myself, but like I was at a friend's house that could really cook.

Food is great but service is lacking,. Especially the Japanese looking lady who stands around. I'm not sure if she is a waitress or a supervisor but her attitude needs some improvement. I do not want to go into detail but my brother and I did not feel welcome at all. We felt insulted even because we eat a lot but then we ordered the AYCE so that should not have mattered. She kept talking to our servers until they came to use less and less frequently. She even held up an order for some reason before it finally reached us. We followed the rules on their AYCE menu so none of her attitude was called for. My brother and I agreed to find another sushi place as our go to. Never coming back.
Best sushi ever. I just got done eating and I am amazed at the service and quality of the food! Shenna was amazing ! The best server I have had in a long time!
Great service, pretty lenient on time limit when it's not busy, and also offers all you can drink. Not too many fancy rolls but definitely a great place to go if you're going for all you can eat!

Sushi Wa is currently my favorite Sushi place!  I personally like that they bring items out 1-2 at a time, I hate having 50 plates at the table...just my opinion, but I can see by some reviews, some yelpers are gluttonous and are angry about that.  The ambiance is nice, I like the booths...I always feel that the service is good- one time I felt neglected by the female waitress, but today we had a different waiter (cant remember his name) but he is my favorite.  The screaming orgasm is delicious, as are the Who's Your Daddy-- I will keep coming back!
Great all u can eat and great service. We love coming here because we can get right in. Get the fresh sashimi
Worst sushi bar ive ever been!! Service sucks the server was very rude and slow. And all sushi has too much rice. I dont even wanna give one star for this restaurant.

We had a huge party of about 12 people or so. The waitress was nice enough to accommodate us by fitting the tables together for us.   To be honest, the sushi we had there including the sashimi was just alright. I've had better else where. But the sushi chef was so kind, he came to our table and I was assuming he asked if the food was good (I don't speak korean).  And at the end of our meal, because we were a big party, he served ice cream in a huge bowl. One for each table. When we left, the chef personally saw us out. But overall, despite the excellent service I don't think I will return for the food. Sorry chef!

Love the handy Yelp app because we came across this place while in Vaughan last night. The reviews truly speak for itself. Service is just amazing and to top it off, the food was also fresh and delicious. The restaurant is quite small so we were lucky to get a table since it was a Friday night and got there early enough. My fianc√© and I ordered the kalbi appetizer to start ...sooo good by far one of the best, it had so much flavour! And then small sushi & sashimi combo which was plentiful for the best of us. It came with 35 pcs for $30...totally worth it and every single piece of fish was fresh! They also gave us complimentary appetizers: vermicelli soup noodle and two specially made rolls. We loved the decor of the restaurant...Japanese style booths and even a cool sushi t-shirt hanging on the wall next to our table. To sum up our great experience, like every other review here, Chef Joseph came by to each table to ask how our meal was and even gave everyone free ice cream and candy! Now that is what you call personable and friendly service. We will definitely come back here if we are ever in the area. Stellar service and quality sushi!

OMG, this place rocks!  I found it after my last favorite sushi place closed.  You MUST try the Superman Burrito Roll and the Dynamite Appetizer.  Their baked mussels are to die for and I LOVE the Screaming O Sashimi.  I can't get enough of this place and we're here a few times per month for the all you can eat.  Also the Bikini Roll is yummy, no rice, just sushi wrapped in cucumber.   Can't wait to go again on Friday!  Yummy!  :)

I was surprised to see Sushi Wa did not have at least a 4+ star rating overall.  I was turned on to this place about a month ago from a colleague and have since been back twice.  The short story is:  I love it.  The $22 all you can eat lunch is a great value when you consider virtually everything on the menu is available, fresh and super delicious.  While the exterior of the restaurant is seriously underwhelming, the interior is very tastefully decorated with a cool modern vibe.  I also like how people can store their own chopsticks in these big racks with their names on the boxes.  I've had probably 6-7 different rolls, regular sushi, desert items (great Mochi) and have found portion sizes generous - and I reiterate most importantly - the fish was very fresh!  The service was also exceptional.  I've only sat at a table, so I can not comment about the Sushi Bar service experience.  All in all, I can't wait to return!

I really enjoyed the house noodles, it was a good appetizer that a lot of Korean restaurant no longer serve.  The salmon sashimi can use some improvement.  Presentation was really good.  I find the sushi roll rice a little hard.  Overall service was excellent. 3.5 stars

Me and my husband absolutely LOVE this sushi spot. In fact we come here for every special occasion. Birthdays, anniversary, date nights. Its just that good! Romantic yet fun. The food is fenomenal I always eat my tush off! Haha

Best fish in Vegas offering all you can eat. Joon gets his yellowtail from Japan, salmon from Scotland, halibut from Hawaii, etc. They care about offering a top product. The atmosphere is very modern and service is fast and friendly. Bring all my friends from out of town to have some great sushi.

Me and my boyfriend wanted to try sushi for our first time and we choose the right place! We did the all you can eat which was helpful in trying serval rolls for a good price. Our waitress was very helpful in advising what rolls we should chose! We'll be back for more.

I was nervous about dining here as we'd noticed that many yelper friends had rated it just below taking a cruise off the italian coastline :). Alas, we were nearby and the Mrs and I decided to roll the dice.  Taking a gamble paid off. The yellowtail nigiri was some of the freshest and highest quality cuts I've had in Vegas. I thought the salmon was gonna swim off the plate and it tasted like butter.  We also tried the Pocky roll which is about 10lbs of avocado with some crab and albacore inside. I love avocado so this was yummers but it might be too much for some.  I've been back 2 more times, we did the all you can eat once. The price for all you can eat is competitive with other restaurants at this level but maybe even a little better as you get at least one serving of sashimi and one or two other specialty items which you wouldn't usually get with A.Y.C.E.  Highlights: -Pocky Roll -Mango Salmon Roll -Pokey Ahi Salad -Salmon Nigiri -Hamachi Nigiri -Banzai Roll -Good selection of asian beers including Hite which I didn't see on the menu but they did have in stock

A.Y.C.E. SUSHI! Do you hear me?!?! ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI!! (And at an affordable price!)  Who wouldn't like this place? You can pick just about anything off of the two-sided menu to order. However, be mindful of the color-coded symbols next to some of the items, because some items can only be ordered once as part of the AYCE special. And, it's more than just sushi: soup, teriyaki meals, appetizers, etc. Rolls are customizable (within reason) and I haven't had anything that I didn't like.   They sell Coke! In town that seems to be pro-Pepsi, it's so nice to have a nice cold Coke.  Service can be a little slow at times (not the wait for the food, but the initial acknowledgment from your server, which is a little odd since the restaurant isn't that large). However, their overall staff is pretty attentive, refilling drinks and clearing plates at a healthy pace.   This has become our "go to" sushi place for us. I can't wait to start bringing our out-of-town guests here.

Where to start... This is not an authentic Japanese restaurant!  We sat at the sushi bar, but can't order directly to the chefs in front of us. Why??because we had the all you can eat menu.  When you have an all you can eat menu and put tons of restrictions;  it is not all you can eat. I guess that's why we had to order from the wait staff. They were the ones to make sure we didn't order anything not on the "all you can eat" menu. The good part.. The fish was decent, but something is always lost in translation when non native people try to present themselves as authentic! I would have given this place a high rating, but they choose to play the bait and switch game with their customers. We got our bill and saw that they included gratuity in all our bills even though we had separate checks. They even charged more than the percentage stated(also mentioned by Andy S.)  So, I won't be back!

Every time I come here is fresh and unique. In Vegas is the best place for your money. Clean environment, great staff and just great sushi. Highly recommend for anyone to try. JJ is one of my favorites sushi Chef but others are good too. I like the fact that they have cold Sake on draft, they call it bamboo. I wish all sushi places had sake on draft. They should learn from sushiwa.

We drove a long way to have dinner here. There is only one waitress, and we were waiting almost 30mins for the food. These rolls we ordered are not bad. We ordered a small Sashimi boat. However, there are only five kinds of fish, and the Salmon Sashimi are not fresh enough. Tuna Sashimi are OK, but no particular comment for the other sashimi in the boat, not good or bad. Overall, three stars for everything.

I haven't been here in 4 years, so when we were in this part of town we decided to drop in to do some all you can eat. Long story short the hostess sucked from the moment we walked in, til I signed the check and was walking out. Even the worst restaurants  I've been to, had the respect to say "thank you" after I spent a good sum of $$. But not today...no "thank you," no "hope you enjoyed it," not even an "f*** you," as I walked by thanking them. For what? Not quite sure.  Wasn't a total loss, our Server was okay and the rolls were excellent, but not enough for me to come all the way back again.

One of the best sushi places in the area; it doesn't have "all you can eat" menus but it's definitely worth getting their dishes which are very tasty and generous in size. The chefs and the waitress are very friendly and sometimes give some free treats!
The best sushi ever!!!!!! This is a great place for All you can eat sushi ! The staff are friendly and the fish is always fresh.

Mmmmm I felt like this place had some good stuff and other stuff was mediocre. I don't want to diss but state some suggestions in hopes that they will make it better for the future.   I was mostly dissapointed in the presentation but service was great. Everything just kind of came out mediocre.. can't really say it any better.   My dragon roll looked like there was barely any unagi on top and the shrimp tempura was so small I couldn't taste it.  The salmon skin salad needs help.. just doesn't look like anything, random veggies put together and the salmon skin tasted like some other fish since it was way over cooked and cut so small....  The sushi was all very good and again service was awesome. I would definitely come back but I know what not to order and what to order.  Ya feel me? Oh plus I appreciate how late it is open!

Food was good , Farley priced! Great Service !! Nothing really to complain about . For two people the portions were big for us like the rolls it would have been nice to just do half of them. Too rich to each eat four of the same thing. My only complaint!!  Portions were big for a sushi place lol ! Weird I know but my preference only!

Sushi Wa has always been mine and my family's first choice to visit when we want to dine out for Sushi. Past visits have been good, sometimes great, but to say the least never bad. Food is good, ambience of the restaurant is also good with great music. Last night's visit however makes me think twice about visiting this restaurant.  We were seated in a booth (there were four of us) across from the sushi bar. One server came and took drink orders and provided us with the menus. He appeared to be out waiter but to find out he wasn't. After the drinks arrived and we made our selection we waited for a bit. The server than showed up with our plates, took our order (AYCE). After the first round of order was almost finished we wanted to put in another order and this is when the issue began.  We got our server's attention and asked if we can put in another order - her response was "please wait a little bit". She then proceeded to walk the restaurant, checking on other tables, booth, and bar area, giggling and talking with these guests. About five minutes passed and I again flagged her down and asked her if I can order. Her response "If you put in another order now, because the kitchen is backed up, it will come out slow." All of us with exception of my husband ( as we were all speaking in Korean) looked at her with shock. She was actually telling us that we can't order the food because sushi chefs were busy! It felt as though she was scolding us about our pace and how orders should be placed based on the convenience of the sushi chefs. After the shock settled we advised her that we will be understanding of the wait (as few large tables arrived) and she finally took the order. She continued to "ignore" our table and only visit when we flagged her down throughout the dinner.  At the end of our dinner my mother asked her if we can order dessert. Her response was even more shocking to use. She began looking around the table and noticed three lumps of rice that was left on the plate. She began to lecture my mother how that is not the policy of their AYCE and the restaurants need to charge us for the left overs. She also pointed to where her boss was seating and told us that He had pulled her aside and spoke to her about our table, how we can't continue to leave lumps of rice. She also added that she can be fired by all of this. Then she called out to one of the servers to come and take our dessert order.   I am not sure if this is the service that is given to all patrons at this restaurant or she feels that she is comfortable enough to talk or provide lack of service to us because we are Koreans. I have received better service at Dick's last resort in San Diego and their motto is to be rude (fun rude) to their customers. The way that our table was served and spoken to is definitely not something I expect to receive when spending over $100 at a restaurant. In addition, to be told when I can place my order and getting scolded at the end of the dinner is certainly not the way I wanted end my dinner with my family.  To say the least, Sushi Wa will never be our first, second, or last choice to dine. Our server's performance definitely left us wondering if the money spent was worth is and obviously it is not.

When we walked in, it definitely felt like a modern/unique Japanese restaurant. The lighting was more dim lit and intimate which we liked. We walked over to the sushi bar and really the ambiance is all that made the experience. It took about 5 minutes for them to figure out we didn't have menus, the chef at the sushi bar didn't speak much English (he was hispanic) so he kept disregarding us, we didn't have a set waiter for our drinks and appetizers, and they forgot to bring us three items we ordered. To top it off, I think it's silly that you can't share with others in your party that ordered AYCE. The sushi wasn't all that great and I'm pretty sure I won't go back there.

Boyfriend was craving sushi & this place is literally down the street from where we live so we decided to check it out even tho a lot of the yelp reviews mentioned horrible service. I don't know if it's because we came for lunch and it wasn't busy, but everything was AMAZING!   We were immediately greeted & seated upon entering the restaurant which was surprisingly large & beautifully decorated. We sat at the bar and chose to have the AYCE. Our waiter was extremely polite and helpful in explaining the menu. His timing on checking in on our needs was perfect. The sushi chef even checked in on us periodically to see if we wanted to order anything else. So to sum it all up, it's unfortunate that so many yelpers had bad experiences here with their service but thankfully, ours was PERFECT! We'll definitely be back!  And the icing on the cake... SUSHI WAS FANTASTIC!

I've been here twice picking up orders for customers who've ordered from Postmates, and decided to grab some take-out this morning. First of all, they are open til 4 a.m. which is perfect for a night owl like me. Second of all, the service is super responsive and food preparation is very quick.  Lastly, the sashimi & sushi are amazing!  I ordered cucumber salad, garlic tuna, sex bomb, and the salmon roll (spicy because I LOVE hot!) I have eaten sushi in many cities and this ranks in my top 3.  I will def come back for AYCE ($23, lunch/$27,dinner) soon.  This is my new late nite sushi spot.

The food here is delicious and the price is also very fair. The atmosphere makes you feel that you are in an upscale sushi establishment. From my experience the fish has always been very fresh here and the fish to rice ratio is also very good. They dont try to overly fill you up with rice. The staff is super friendly. We like sitting at the sushi bar where we can converse with the chefs and of course get our food that much quicker.

This was the first time at Sushi Wa for my wife and I. We received excellent service from the moment we walked in. Our server seated us and served us tea very promptly. We placed our order and when the first item arrived we were a bit puzzled trying to figure out if we had actually ordered it, only to later find out that it was a complimentary deep fried tuna appetizer on the house! Everything just got phenomenally better from here. The Geisha roll was fabulous and midway through the meal, Chef Joseph personally made a stop at our table to chat with us and wrote down our names. He was pleased to find out that it was our first time at the restaurant and offered us the most amazing mango ice cream with honey cornflakes on the house! Once we paid our bill at the counter, he personally walked over to say goodbye to us (he remembered our names!); offered us candy; walked us out the door and waved till we got in the car! At this point, in a state of complete euphoric excitement, my wife and I looked at each other trying to process what had just happened! The experience was almost unbelievable since it's so rare to find people like Joseph these days, with a genuine commitment to serving customers sincerely. I'd highly recommend anyone reading this to go check out Sushi Wa. Hands down, the best sushi restaurant in the North York area!

Came with my cousins for the AYCE because of the 4 stars. We were really excited to find a new sushi place but we were really disappointed. We weren't satisfied with any of our orders and the sushi rice was terrible. Definitely won't be back.
Great service from the owner and the food is on-point. Would highly recommend to friend's, family, and any sushi lover.
Love this place, the food is always amazing!!!! Service is just as good!! Love the sushi selection one of my favorite restaurants

Ambiance is modern and sleek. Service is good; the employees are nice and helpful. The fish is fresh and the rolls are amazing; i got the garlic tuna sashimi and several other rolls that were pretty good. They serve beer and sake; I got the cold house sake.
Excellent fresh sushi and great decor. Waiters are friendly and the drinks inventive. If you like sushi you can't go wrong here.

Had a very very bad experience here, mark our server is very rude.. From the very beginning while ordering our food on AYCE, he stated "this is a lot of food" he made us feel right away that we are "too much". (We are eating sushi AYCE almost 3x a week so we know what we can eat and we know what we want..  Secondly, im surprised with the sushi theres a lot of RICE and very thin fish.. And the sashimi you can only order one..almost seems like they actually prepared it with more rice on the fact that we ordered a lot..   third, he is watching us like we are criminals eating sushi, hes like the walking camera which is so annoying!!!! He likes to question us every time we are making an order.. Like "are you sure?"  I don't think ill be coming back here.. The food taste good tho and the place was really nice, the other staff seems very friendly and nice but MARK..
Really delicious lunch meal and priced well. Bento box shrimp tempura came with miso soup, green tea, small summer soup & edamame ( Not sure how to spell it). I will be back!
I love this place so much. The staff is very attentive and the food is so good! I love the ambience and decor. Very modern and cozy with the dim lights. All in all 5/5 in taste, comfort, and service!

Ordered from Postmates, that nighmare is another story. The restaurant manager admitted they "don't use real crab and don't have time to write every detail on the menu." The staff took turns yelling at me. $200 for garbage. Why the high reviews? Not ONE thing we ordered was as described on the menu and it took two hours for the pleasure of being tremendoulsy disappointed.

I rarely give 5/5 stars to restaurants unless they blow me away. And trust me, I'm very critical about the places I go to.  My partner and I went to sushi wa based on yelp reviews. We were expecting really good food and nothing else. I mean, it's not a Michelin star restaurant so my expectations were not high.  We arrived and the place was semi busy. We got seated right away. There were a few tables and it felt cozy.  We ordered a few appetizers, maki rolls, and sushi. We loved all of the food. The rolls and sushi are a lot smaller. We noticed that the chef puts garnishs on the sushi which was a lovely touch. It's the little details that make your experience better.  Near the end of the night, the chef, Joseph, came by to our table to greet us and ask us how our food was. He asked us for our names and grabbed our desserts. It was very sweet of him. He didn't do this for us, but when a table leaves he comes outside with you to say goodbye. Joseph and the staff were very attentive and blew us away with their service. This is why they get 5/5 stars and they'll see me again!

This sushi place was delicious, had great food presentation, and (I'm assuming?) the chef/owner even came to our table and asked how the food was. He took time to learn our names and we got free hand rolls and ice cream! The setting is nice too, a Japanese vibe due to interior design of the restaurant (the Japanese cloth stuff idk what they're called). The waiter was very friendly and overall had an amazing experience. Definitely recommend this sushi place and would come here again!

First time here in a while and first time for dinner. This will be my new go to spot for ayce in Henderson. Staff was very attentive sushi chef was friendly and food came at a great pace. Food was fresh and had great flavors. My 12 year old who loves sushi ate the most she ever has and tried many things. I will definitely be a regular here from now on.

This is the first time we've visited this restaurant and it was great! The staff is friendly and the food is terrific. They have "all you can eat" if you like and a great menu! I can't believe we've missed this place tucked in the middle of the shopping center before now.
Fantastic service, fish is super fresh. This is my go-to local spot, I've never had a bad experience ever

Horrible service. We ordered uni that came to our table looking discolored and smelling really weird, we told our server and he's like "well if it's bad then don't eat it." What a ridiculous response!  At one point we also tried to order more and our server was like "you have more food coming...just wait" and he refused to take our order.  Overall just tremendously rude. Sushi was not fresh. Lots of rice that was way too filling.
Amazing!  Delicious sushi, salads and soup. Quick and friendly service and owner, Joseph, was so sweet. This will be our new go-to restaurant.
Sushi Wa is my favorite place to come for sushi. The Japanese lasagna and garlic tuna are really good here.  The servers are friendly and the service is good.
Small place with a big heart  His is not an upscale restaurant, however, the Food is very tasty, nice size dishes and the owner is very nice Best sushi in a 3 km radius

All you can eat and very nice atmosphere.  Not the best sushi in town but is pretty good!  The side dishes are pretty good and they have a lot of choice.  Recommend the nigiri ones rather than the rolls.  Price is average for ayce sushi.  Will continue to frequent here.

Another sushi joint owned by Koreans. This means that they also have a couple (ribs and bulgogi) on their [AYCE] menu. I enjoyed coming here, but it is hard to make it a consistent visit because it can get quite pricey even without the AYCE.  I suggest coming here to eat their uni (sea urchin) and octopus though! It is one of the most fresh sushi joints for those two that I have had!

This is one of the best sushi places in town. The all you can eat is so incredible! I've never felt so great leaving a sushi restaurant, this place will take care of all you sushi needs and more.  Great staff, great atmosphere and great food. A must go for sushi lovers.

This is one of my favorite places for all you can eat. We used to live on the opposite side of town and would drive across town for this place. Their sushi is fresh and They have great drinks too! I had my birthday at this place and we always bring family in here when they are in town!!!

My favorite sushi in las vegas area.  Try the Hawaiian roll and superman burrito!  Fish quality is better than other places and the flavors are popping! Decor is nice as well and adds to the experience.  Sushi chefs are friendly and helpful.
Was ok people are friendly sushi you can not order half order on all you can eat.  Sushi was ok fair.
Amazing Sushi!  Wonderful Service , if you want some of the Best Las Vegas, NV (Henderson) Sushi  this is a Must Try!!  Each time we go here, it is never a disappointment. #ChefDanny, #Amazingg!!

Great place for a date night. We did all you can eat and the sushi was extremely fresh. My boyfriend loves nigiri and the fish portions were way more generous than many other all you can eat sushi places. I highly recommend the wa salad. We will definitely come back!

I go here all the time, decided to finally write a review. This is my fave sushi spot by far. Fish is always fresh, I never get any bad pieces, no matter what time or day I go. And I love the mussels. Favorite roll- superman burrito.

I love this place. The only downside I've experienced is parking sucks on a busy weekend night with my big ass truck. But that's a really hardly a quibble when you're talking about the fantastically savory menu--food and drink--here. I love the decor and the service has been splendid whether I've come as two or twenty-two (the latter being my first experience and we damn near ran the kitchen out the house with the all you can eat option). Speaking of that opportunity--they call it the AYCE--if you've got the hungry and the stomach space to match, do it. You won't regret it save for the weight gain. Get your sushi here.

I hadn't been to SushiWa in forever and decided to revisit the first place I had tried Live Uni (YUM!!) earlier this week. To those who've never dined at this sushi joint, you need to look at the specials board BEFORE you peruse the extensive menu. That's where these talented folks showcase their fresh, seafood delicacies, and you can decide how adventurous you want to be with what you eat! This time around, my bizarre food moment came with my first taste of torigai (Japanese Cockle)... last time, it was geoduck (large clam). That's not to say that the folks at SushiWa don't do everything else... you can certainly find your fair share of fresh sashimi (their yellowtail, salmon and tuna are always good), and all the crazy rolls you can eat. I would also highly recommend their crispy rice -- a thin layer of crisped rice on top of which is a perfect portion of spicy tuna and other accoutrements including some caviar eggs -- DELISH! SushiWa is a little bit more expensive than some of the other sushi joints in town... but I don't mind paying more for a food adventure now and then. GO. And make sure to have your own Andrew Zimmern moment.

Annoying and weird. First two words that come to mind. Oh--and pretty bad service. Made reservations, arrived on time. Only 6 tables were sat when we arrived, most of which already had their food. The restaurant is pretty small, so with 3 working sushi chefs and a back of house staff and several servers, it's really odd that their ticket times are as long as they are. They looked overstaffed IMO.  For starters, I know it's annoying to serve families, I've worked in everything from franchises to fine dining. If serving families is too overwhelming to you--you should work at a bar.   We ordered AYCE, and two of my kids just ordered regular entrees. We knew what we wanted ahead of time, figuring it would make it easy for the server. Nope.  Our daughter's COOKED entree came out, soup first then 10 mins later--  the rest of her entree. About another 10-15 mins went by and we were still waiting for JUST our sashimi. With 3 chefs, a slow restaurant that was clearing out, NO OTHER patrons even entered--and we still didn't get a few pieces of raw fish. On top of that, the waitress seemed VERY overwhelmed & flustered. She's in the wrong industry. If you can't wait on a *few* tables, I.. I.. don't know. It was almost funny.   Our two kids finished their meals, then finally a few plates started to trickle out. We didn't want to be rude,but we eat sushi all the time, we've been there several times, so we needed to know why it was taking so long. The waitress (who was still very flustered) blamed the kitchen then mumbled then said "well you're not the only people eating and they're making lots of food right now". Meanwhile, when we looked over, two of the three sushi chefs were just standing there, not visibly busy.   Wherever. So we just wanted to eat & go home. We ordered a bunch of rolls. She then says "you can only order 6 at a time". It doesn't say that anywhere on the menu or on any sign. Every AYCE place would gladly bring (which would calculate to 2 rolls per person) what we ordered gladly because they always charge for what you don't finish. #whyareyouweird she was being lazy. I get it, you don't want to carry plates and do side work. So we just took a few rolls off our order as we knew we'd never go back there again & we didn't feel like driving to another restaurant since it's a school night.   Anyway, the sushi was good, but not good enough to go back. We'll be sticking with restaurants elsewhere. It's a shame and really their loss. They lost a lot of future business.

Excellent service. Didn't have to ask for anything more than once. Joon helped us at the bar the entire time and the sushi was incredible. Fish was fresh and the bulgogi was delicious. Myself and two others had all you can eat lunch and our bill was $70. Unbelievable food for that price. Service and food for this price is the best on this side of Vegas.

Best atmosphere for local sushi restaurant, lounge-like. Miko and Yoon always delivery excellent service. This has become my go to spot for sushi. Also, it's s plus they're always open at 4am. I would definitely recommend the vanilla mochi, I've never had creamier vanilla ice cream than that! Although all of their mochi is fantastic. They even have coffee mochi. Good variety of items on menu. I would just hope they work on the batter of their fried items, they tend to taste bitter and like you're chewing oil, no flavor at all. Pork belly could use more flavor rather than just relying on the sauce to add flavor. Bulgogo is surprising good here! Lots of flavor, even comes on a skillet. Miso soup is never overly salty.

The staff here really go out of their way to be attentive! Chef Joseph makes a point of stopping by and asking how everything is, and remembers your name when you come back! The on-the-house appetizers are delicious, with a seafood broth and a crunchy and flavourful deep-fried tuna roll. Top quality sushi whether you dine in or get take out. Can't go wrong with this place.

My experience here was very upsetting. Food was alright but service was bad. The Asian lady that was a waitress was so rude, and wasn't helpful at all. There was other people sitting in our table that ordered food too and after we ordered. I waited and waited for my ordered and a few things I didn't get. after I asked where they were and she said it came together with the other peoples food sitting on the same table. I wasn't aware that it was put together with our orders put together. SMH.
Exceptional service. Never felt so welcomed in a restaurant. Joseph was great. Very good food and value for the price. Will bring kids back to eat again.
Come here 5 years in a row to celebrate my birthday and worth the trip every time! Good food and good service! Wa special roles are super special! Happy Birthday to me!
Another great experience tonight. Best AYCE in town in terms of service, quality and variety of rolls.  Gio does a stellar job in managing the room.

Say it in a Snookie voice... "Sushi Waaaaaa". Wow, what a dated reference.  This location is right next door to my barber and I've been wanting to try this place for the past couple of months. Sushi Wa has the basic look and feel of the old standard sushi bar, but with food items like the Super Spider Roll, Shrimp Killer, and the Superman Burrito Roll, needless to say the menu is far from basic.   I rolled in (pun intended) around 3pm and the place was empty, perfect! My lunching partner and I sat at the bar and ordered a small meal because we were in a bit of rush. We stayed on the beaten path as far sushi orders go with Spicy Ahi Tuna Roll, Calamari Tempura Roll, and a bowl of Udon. Like I said, "we were in a rush", which now I realize is bad idea to go to a new place and not take the time to snack on their interesting and funky faire.   The Calamari Tempura Roll was plated beautifully and set the tone for my hunger right off the bat. The large rolls filled with crab, avocado, and coated in a tasty fish sauce were not only easy on the eyes, but they didn't stand a chance against to my chopstick to mouth skills. This plate was accompanied with a generous helping tempura calamari along with little dollops of japanese mayo and dots of spicy oil in the center. Amazing!  The Udon was a nice break from the calamari munching mayhem. The noodles were cooked to firm perfection and the broth would have been slurped down with a straw if the server would have obliged my gluttonous tendencies. The fish cakes and tempura veggies that came with soup were a welcomed addition to this large bowl of awesome.   The Spicy Tuna Roll, fell flat. I mean like Wile E. Coyote falling from a cliff flat. So much so that I didn't finish it, which says a lot. Who doesn't finish sushi? I can't quite put my finger on it, but it just had an interesting texture and a weird flavor profile.   This location still gets a 4 stars because just like the majority of the meal, the service was stellar and I didn't walk out feeling like my wallet was just bent over and taken advantage of. I will be back to try aforementioned rolls and this time there will be no time crunch, just seaweed wrapped, saki soaked, sushi eating enjoyable dining.

Had dinner here tonight.    I think they were "off their A-game" in the service department.  I'm not going to go into detail because I'm not going to hold it against them... but my tea was cold, they forgot to provide: the individual small plates, the soy sauce dish and the wasabi/ginger side.  But all was remedied quickly once we pointed it out.    They are OH-SO-NICE.  So.... definitely not going to hold the minor infractions against them since the sushi and rolls were Killer Grinds.  Enjoyed the AYCE... started with the edamame and seaweed salad.  Both were great starters... fresh and fast.  Then started in on the fish... salmon, yellow tail, white tuna.  All very good and fresh....and big pieces of fish too which just a little bit of rice.... so they are more than fair with their portions.  Ordered the albacore with jalapeno... it came wrapped in red onion which I'm not a fan of onion so I picked the onion out and ate it.  Was Great without the onion.  :)  Then we ordered the Scallop Crunch, Mountain and 007 rolls.  They were all different and all good... I can't say which I liked better.  The Scallop Crunch had a nice crunch to it while the scallops were tender, the Mountain was a baked roll that was served with a spicy sauce that was awesome... just a nice little kick nothing shocking... and the 007 roll was so simple it was refreshing.  We ended with Tempura Ice Cream... it was 'ok'.  Nothing to expound upon... should have gotten the Mochi instead... next time.

Can't go wrong with anything you order!  Fresh, lots of choices and delicious!  Will definitely come back every time I visit. My favorite is the Halibut sushi with obo leaf and lemon.  And they pepper seared tuna is so flavorful.
Super good sushi!! And vegan friendly!! Great atmosphere and staff is always super attentive. Perfect sushi spot!!
All you can eat is the way to go! If you can, sit at the bar. The sushi chef's are very friendly and give great suggestions

A great Sushi place, amazing AYCE sushi menu....gonna take a return visit to try all the menu but was not disappointed on any dish.  Fav was pepper seared Tuna but I love sashimi(available on the AYCE)...so many rolls on the menu it would take 8-10 visits to try it all.  Tapas menu and more!  Becoming my fav sushi place in Henderson bar none
Excellent food and service. Excellent value and thanks to Joseph the store owner.  I went there 4 months ago.  Delayed review sorry.

Went for our Anniversary and this is usually always our spot to go eat Sushi and we honestly hadn't been in a long long time. We had Ricky "JJ" and he was just fabulous... Good to converse with and he made us a little anniversary surprise... Top Secret stuff! Just so much flavor and refreshing. It's great to return to a place and get the same excellent service and delicious meals. The fish is always top quality and fresh.   Ahi Poke *best poke in town* Rose Roll *very filling Pepper Seared Tuna Salmon Crunch Roll Rainbow Roll *Ricky's Original* Promised I would not give out secrets...

My family and I came here for AYCE sushi. While the sushi and sashimi we ate were fresh and delicious, the service was mediocre. Our drinks weren't filled until the end of our dining experience; at one point, it took us quite a while to get the attention of our server so we could order more. However, I would give this place another chance as the food made up for the service. The Screaming Orgasm sashimi was mouth-watering, and the rolls I ordered were flavorful and filling.
Best sushi in town. June is phenomenal, staff is great. If you're looking for sushi, this is the only place to go.

Finally tried this place after living right up the hill for almost a year. Definitely the best place we've been to south of 215. Everything we had was good, it was later in the afternoon, service was excellent.

Would have been a great experience but our server/waitress older chubby Asian lady was not letting us order our full order saying we order too much and said order next time, my wife only ate 2 things and was waiting for her veggie tempura, pork belly and chicken katsu which were canecelled, can't believe I paid full price please retrain the waitress, this would be a 0 star rating if I could select no stars

Amazing.  This place has the freshest sushi I have ever tasted.  I used to think I knew fresh fish, but clearly I was wrong.  Once I ate the yellowtail nigiri here, it was so flavorful and delicious that I thought he must have killed the fish himself just a few seconds earlier.  (I found out later that this was, in fact, the case.)  Same went for the baby tuna, and the salmon, and it was simply amazing.    I'd definitely try the Monkey Brain, it was amazingly good, with a shiitake mushroom, cream cheese, and spicy tuna on top, covered in tempura and fried.  Very good.  They have an interesting selection of other fish, as well, and the rolls are pretty good, too.  Keep in mind, from 11:30 to 3, Mon-Sat, they have happy hour, which many of the sushi items are half off, and this is what I recommend to just sit and sample the fresh nigiri.  If you come at dinner, get the rolls.  All of them are gigantic, and more than worth the full price.    The place itself is very well decorated, with stone and contemporary stylings, although the music in there can be hit or miss.  I've been there about 3 times now, and one time it was bouncy loud hip-hop crap with repetitive rhythms and vocalists who talk the whole time instead of singing.  The second time it was techno remixes of pop songs, and that was more bearable.  The third time was nice, with more Japanese style singing and a little bit of a trance feel, and a little bit of a big-band feel.    Very good place over all...  Freshest fish I've ever had.
