Go to spot in Henderson for nigiri. Try the "Sushi Bomb" but be cautious, it will explode and all you can do is hold on for the ride.

My husband and I love sushi! If we could afford it we would be eating sushi like they do in Japan...breakfast lunch and dinner! We've been to sushi places everywhere and we know what we like and we know how much we can eat. Oh did I mention my husband started off as a sushi chef? Well, we went to Sushi Wa with high expectations from one of our best friends...and I must admit...the sushi was great as we were told. But here's the sad thing...the waitress we got every time we go there always limits our orders! I mean c'mon...we know what we wanna eat...and we're paying all you can eat and if we can't finish it you still charge us for unfinished food...so why limit us? That type of service is not needed...and on top of that they always take forever to bring the food and the bill. You would think if we placed a larger order in the beginning then you wouldn't have to worry about coming back to our table. I think it's rude to limit your customers when they're paying to eat All You Can Eat!   I'll score 2 stars on great food and deduct the 3 stars for service.   Sad thing is..my husband and I miss their sushi (especially the nigiri and sashimi sushi). We are not sushi rolls type of people :/  We'll see if we go back or not.

Food is ok. Not enough Vegan options. Katie is the best server there.  She's warm, friendly and takes time to explain the menu. If i ever go there again , I  ask for Katie because everyone else is so rude. Jenny had the nerve to take make water glass away and bring it back filled with a dirty glass and already squeezed lemon. Disgusting! She also had the nerve to question my husband about ordering before I knew what I wanted. Very rude! 5 stars if they add more vegan items to the menu and get rid of the rude staff!

I've been to a couple of sushi restaurants with AYCE and Sushi Wa hands down is the best one. Their staff is great, their food is great, the room ambience is great, and plus its open till 4 freakin' AM like what theee?!?! Anyways, my personal favorite order is favorite roll is the Mango Roll (I'm pretty sure it's only from this place too since from the other places I've been they don't have it) and I totally recommend that with some green tea tempura ice cream!
I love this place! The worlds best eel ever! So much amazing sushi! You know it's so good that over order but it's worth every time! I keep coming back time and time again!

Sushi Wa -  the ambiance here is nice, modern chic.      We had a huge party of 24, made a reservation the set up was quite confusing. But we got it handled.       Obviously 24 people could get pretty confusing for AYCE but the server was patient. He did forget things at times but we we tried to be patient and understanding.     Quality of sushi was good. I liked how they actually have sashimi in the AYCE

We decided to try this place based on the good reviews on Yelp, and this is the first time we've been disappointed. The sushi was ok. The garlic sauce seemed really oily, and not even that garlicky. The most disappointing part was the speed of service. If I knew we'd have to wait 15 minutes between each order, I would have just ordered everything at once. It took 2 hours just to get 4 rolls and several small dishes from the kitchen. I've never been to a sushi place that has taken this long to get the food out to the customer. Kind of funny how they say you only have an hour for AYCE, but it took 2.

It pains me to write this review, but not as much as the guilt I feel for subjecting my friends to the disaster that occurred on Friday night. What I thought would be a fun sushi night turned out to be a nightmare. I left before witnessing said nightmare, but from hearing what really happened, my review would be much lower if I had been there. If I had known what I know now about the service, particularly one waiter, I would have picked one of the many other sushi joints in the area.   Anyways, the sushi was pretty good. Highlights of the AYCE were the very crunchy calamari w/ two choices of dipping sauce, the Hamachi Kama, and the Seared Tuna Nigiri. Portions are big, especially the rolls. Some of the seafood could have been fresher, like the Uni; but, overall, the sushi was satisfactory. The food alone deserves 3 stars.   What doesn't deserve 3 stars is the service. At first, the service was good, our server was nice. At this point, my review was sitting pretty at 3 stars. But as the night progressed, I could tell our server was getting frustrated due to the orders and the amount of people at the restaurant. Large parties are always difficult, I understand that; however, if everyone in the table is ordering AYCE, it shouldn't be difficult to split the bill. Having to leave early, I needed to pay early. After asking our server multiple times if I could pay early, he finally agreed (after saying no initially) and took my card. However when I got the bill, I immediately knew something wasn't right. I was overcharged by $3 or so, but I was in a hurry, so I just paid and left it at that. Service deserves 2 stars.   Maybe the server was having an off night, but I made reservations in advance for our large party, so they should've been more prepared. I'm kind of relieved I missed the fiasco that occurred after I left because if I had stayed, I definitely would have lived up to the Sushi Wa name and cried (*Wa wa*).  For small parties, Sushi Wa is a-ok, but large parties beware!  *EDIT* One of the owners contacted me and apologized for what happened, hence the bump to three stars.
I really like this place.  I think this restaurant is best sushi restaurant in Toronto!!!
Sushi Wa has the best sushi in all Vegas and Henderson!!!!  They have the best menu and Jenny is the most incredible server we have ever had!!!

Came in a bit less than an hour of closing time to have a beer, got an udon soup and sushi on the house! Extremely attentive and all together a very welcoming environment, loved it and definitely recommend for such a service!

Just came home from a disappointing visit at Sushi Wa. Wish I had gone back to Oyshi instead. Service staff was pleasant and attentive, but out of three chefs, there was only one who was pleasant, and he wasn't the one serving me. The menu was explained poorly. One order of sashimi per person, (huh?) and one order of sweet shrimp.. description that took much longer than necessary to get across. I had eaten the rest of my food (2 rolls, 3 different orders of sushi, the sashimi, and a couple of appetizers) and the sweet shrimp was MIA. The one pleasant chef, upon my inquiry, mentioned it was coming. But it felt like every time I spoke to my chef, I was bothering him. And what was his name? Well, according to their chef jackets, they were all named Joon Choi. The sweet shrimp came out right as I was asking about dessert. I had given up. To be fair, the quality of the fish was good. 4 stars for that. But there was so much more that was wrong. The rolls were poorly wrapped, the carrot in one of the rolls should have been thrown away. I had to pick it out! Seriously. I tried their Korean Bulgogi. Bad. Just Bad. And then... the sweet shrimp arrived. I. Have. Never. Had. Shrimp. This. Bad. I couldn't eat it. I asked for the red bean mocha. The waitress asked if I wanted it as I finished the rest of my food. When I indicated I was not going to do so, she told me they charged for pieces I didn't eat. I understand that policy is in place to keep down waste... but when I told her the food was undesirable, she didn't really say anything. In the end, they took it off my bill. But what a waste of a night of sushi! I ended up feeling full but  extremely dissatisfied. Never again.

The chefs do not deserve this. The food is pretty great and quite fresh. However, the service at this restaurant was absolutely atrocious and quite a hostile environment. When my family and I came here for the AYCE, we expected a great meal. After a few orders, the waiters (and what I assume is the owner) got tired of coming and we were forced to wait 15-20 minutes between orders. The owner brought us our check before we even asked for it and kept staring and laughing at me. I assume this is because I'm a big man and can eat quite a bit. They forgot quite a few of our orders as well. If you have a big stomach but no soul, I suggest you eat here because the owner seems to lack one as well as soon as he sees customers who can eat quite a bit. Otherwise, if you want a non-hostile and nice service staff, I suggest you eat at another restaurant.
Great Sushi ! The best experience since long time. Small place, excellent 5 stars service. Food great and price was not crazy like some other places. A must try place if you like sushi.

So we just ate here for the first time tonight.  We love at Bathurst and Wilson and have been going to wakame which has gone down hill faster than usain bolt can run.   The food here was fantastic!!!  The service was impeccable.   Hey brought out free appetizers with some newer dishes on their menu. Delish!!  The avocado salad was amazing.  The rolls equally as good. The kicker on the whole meal was when the head chef and owner, Joseph, came out to ask is how the food was, where we lived, how we had heard about them and then proceeded to ask our names and wrote them down in his little book.    Needless to say, we will be back over and over again.

I don't know if they get much business here because the mall it's in seems kind of quiet. But... what a great find! It's a place I'd imagine in Santa Monica or West Hollywood only not as crowded and not pretentious.  The tofu salad was very tasty. I generally don't like Japanese salad dressings but the one on this was quite good. On the other hand, I had a seared tuna salad that was a little too heavy on the dressing and I couldn't taste the fish.  I'm a purist when it comes to fish. Give me sashimi! However, it's fun for me to look at a menu and see that mango is being used in rolls. I tried the salmon skin roll the last time I was there and can honestly say I'd recommend it.  There's something on the menu called, "monkey brains" but I noticed it on the way out.
Love this place. Definitely one of the top all you can eat sushi restaurants in the Henderson area. Great atmosphere and very clean. Sushi is always fresh.

My husband and I have visited here numerous times.  We decided to go on 07 April 2018 at around 14:00.  As we entered, Joseph behind the counter immediately said hello.  The waiter, I think his name was Aaiden, greeted us right away.  He cleaned off a table, and we were seated.  The place was packed.  It isn't all that large, but this was the first time that it was so busy.  They upgraded their menu and their prices.  However, the food was exceptional and the service was excellent.  Joseph, the owner came by three times to our table to make sure everything was in order.  The food was excellent and satisfying.  When we left, Aaiden thanked us and the other waiter as well.  Walking out the door, and heading for my car, Joseph came outside and called out to thank us and bowed.  You don't receive service like this anywhere else.

I love this place!!!!!!! The sushi was fresh and tasty and my waiter was really nice. I think this is my new favorite!!! Great AYCE deal at lunch and dinner and their menu has plenty of options. YUMMY!!!!!

I came here last night and am happy I tried it but I probably won't be back.  We had a very nice server although she was kind of all over the place.  Several times she tried to deliver our items to the tables next to us and then did the same with the other table's order.  Kind of strange and not so good since it's food related.  Now onto the food!  They do not offer half rolls for the AYCE however they do offer your choice of 1 of the sashimi options which is nice because that is not something that is normally offered at AYCE.  The sashimi came with 4 nice size slices of fish.  Delish!  For the sushi options, they give a lot of rice and are pretty strict on the leftover policy.  They probably give about double what a normal AYCE sushi restaurant would do in terms of rice.  They have a nice selection of mochi flavors including coffee which was so good!  Overall the experience was just OK.  I liked the variety that they offer but the rice overload, no half rolls, and mix ups with orders were a bit too many flaws for me to go back
Free beer with the yelp review!! Score!! Our server is polite and informative, this will be a definite come back spot for me

Came here for my bday and the sushi was great! We come here for the AYCE the "sushi" (shasmimi) is always fresh. The white peach blossom drink is super tasty with a fizz, (12$). Favorite rolls in include the Japanese lasagna, the philledelphia roll, and the mango salmon roll! Definitely worth it!

I came here with some buddies for the All-You-Can-Eat option and it was NOT disappointing in the least!   For $25.95, we ate some of the best sushi we've ever eaten, and in copious amounts. I ordered approximately 7 or 8 rolls, and I enjoyed all of them, though the Mexican Roll was my favorite.   The neat thing about the AYCE was also that it included appetizers. The Spicy Chicken was fantastic and the gyoza were decent. Another highlight was the chocolate mochi for dessert  :)  The service was excellent as well. The waitresses were all very funny and accommodating. They also were very good at moderating how often they came to the table with the next round of rolls so we were never overwhelmed by the amount of plates on the table.  Definently a great place for a good AYCE deal on sushi! Come if you're hungry for fresh fish at its best!

We were looking for a new restaurant to try out and we're craving sushi. This place was nearby and had great reviews. Quaint and quiet with beautifully prepared dishes, good quality and superb service. Our waitress was kind and attentive, sushi chef and owner Joseph was beyond hospitable, what an awesome experience! This place cares about quality, presentation, and service.  We ordered small family combo and couldn't finish the food. Everything was so beautiful and little touches they added to the sushi and sashimi was a really nice touch and really elevated the experience. Our pallets were so pleased! Definitely recommend you to check it out and thank you Joseph for your hospitality=)

I may get a little insulting with this one, so all you five star raters, clench your butt cheeks.  This place made me hate everything that sushi has become. A posh dining room with third rate service and food. For the first time in my life I sent a sushi roll back. They actually dared to serve a mango salmon roll with still green mango that was so unripe, i lacked the drape over the sushi roll.  There is so much wrong with this place that it made me question my taste for raw fish. In Vegas where good food is always a stones throw away, I recommending directing those stones towards this restaurant.

Sushi Wa Wa Wa! Just love saying that! Saw full star avarge rating for this restaurant on yelp so I decided to go on an adventure with JC #2 to see if this place does live up to its 5 stars rating.  Walked in on a Saturday afternoon around 1 and this place was half full, mind you this place is relatively small so once it gets busy I can imagine a wait line. The hostess was super nice and placed us as one of those romantic booths with great privacy! Then shortly after the owner and the head chef, Joseph, came to greet us and introduced himself which I find very appreciated!  The menu has a large variety of choice, but since we were craving for some sushi and sashimi, we decided to go with a Small Sushi, Sashimi and Roll Tray/Boat. 35 pieces for $30 is very reasonable. Sushi wise, the different kind of fish are very fresh, however, the portion of the rice is a little too much on the Nigiri. The tray also has different variety of sushi and sashimi which I really appreciate as some other restaurants tend to give you the typical Salmon, Tuna, Snapper only. Joseph was also super nice giving us appetizers and dessert on the house!  When we were leaving, Joseph also was kind enough to walk us out! Talk about VIP treatment!  Overall,I would give this 5 stars, sushi and sashimi are decent and service is amazing! I will for sure be back for more!

My first time here the atmosphere and staff are amazing.  The food is above average not your typical "All you can Eat" sushi Resturant.  Danny was very helpful suggesting specials that were not listed on the menu. The Ultimate Garlic Tuna Roll was worth coming for. Ask for the Pink Scallops.  This place continues to impress us. The staff and fresh fish are always perfect.

Please,  this is the worst place I 've been to so far . The service was horrible , there was 1 guy running around like a hamster in a wheel doing everything . I came in with folks that ate and left and i was still waiting for my order to go , rainbow roll and a sashimi  combo ,40min really? I had a hungry husband and a baby waiting for me . The food quality was really below average , avocado on top was brownish , my edamame  was falling apart coz it was over cooked , fish was small and not so trusty so I microvawed  my salmon and gave tuna to my cat  . Never again !

We had a pretty good experience at Sushi Wa. I'm glad they stay open till 4. We came in around 2:30AM and were the only ones there. It was nice, but I hope they get busier during the late hours.   Our server was very nice and polite. She took our orders promptly and the sushi chef was very nice too, checking in on us.   We liked the salmon sashimi, I liked their ikura too. Their spider roll was one of the best ones we've tasted too.   The bikini and lava rolls were also ones that stuck out to us. They were pretty big portions.   For dessert we did strawberry mochi ice cream, pretty generic but good:-)  Would definitely come back for the ayce when I'm back in Vegas.
This is definitely one of the best sushi in town. They got fresh wasabi and the quality of the sushi is fantastic.

Went for AYCE lunch ($21.99) and had a nice experience. Quality friendly sushi chefs that seemed to care if I enjoyed my food. Great deal for the money and quality of food.  Pro-tip: Order some fresh wasabi (extra $2) and you will never want to go back to that pasty green crap ever again!
We love coming here with family. The owner is very friendly and service is great. Love the small complimentary appetizers. Rolls are good too!
Good AYCE menu!  Very nice selection for rolls and other menu items.....and it is close to home!

Pretty good sushi for the most part, nothing special to yelp about. Decor is semi modern and there are some intimate looking booths to sit in, but we were not even given that option for some reason. Service is very good and refills of drinks happened very frequently. Good rolls, but like I said nothing that really stands out. I had a order of UNI, but it wasn't really that tasty. It needs to have that fresh ocean taste that only true UNI fan will understand, mine had that unfavorable "mediciney" taste to it. I often order UNI at sushi places and it takes 10 to 15 minutes for it to come to the table for some unknown reason, maybe it's frozen and needs to be thawed out? Well the UNI at Sushi Wa came out right away, but tasted off.  The All you can eat price is a few dollars higher than all the rest, but then again it's not a huge negative, but just saying. I REALLY  don't like to hear loud obnoxios hip hop music when I am trying to have a decent dinner. I guess they are catering to the young crowd, but it would be cool to have some traditional Japanese lounge music playing softly in the background? I would actually trade loud conversation from diners than listen to loud music.

My friend and I were looking to try out a new AYCE sushi place. Although Sushi Wa didn't have as high a rating on Yelp, my friend wanted to give it a try. There are so many sushi places on Eastern, almost too many options.   This place is adorable. It seems like a nice, high end sushi place. When we arrived there was basically no one in the place, but by about 20-30 minutes later and the place was pretty busy.  We both ordered AYCE and each started off with Baked Lasagna and Mussels. Mussels were pretty good but neither of us cared for the Baked Lasagna. I've had better at any other place I've been. There was a lot of cream cheese on top if that's your thing, I'm not that into it so I usually take half of it off. Regardless of that this roll doesn't compete with surrounding spots. There is definitely some kind of distinct, additional flavor being added and I'm not really into it. It wasn't bad, just not as good as other places I've been.   We also ordered the Fire Cracker ($6) and it really good. Equally as good as any other place I've ever had it. I highly recommend trying it. I don't think it's as spicy as it sounds, but there is definitely a kick to it. Popcorn Scallop was also pretty good. The sauces they served with it were ok.   Beef Teriyaki roll was ok. My friend liked it more than I did. I don't think I'm ready for a meat/sushi infusion yet.   Rose roll was pretty good, description says that it's a baked baby lobster on top of California roll with eel sauce. I'm not sure but that doesn't sound like what we got. It was a roll covered in a lot of stuff, I tasted scallops, there was definitely a really good creamy type sauce. This dish looked kind of messy, but as actually not that hard to eat. The only thing I didn't like about it was the red onion that was mixed on the top. They were pretty easy to remove but one snuck through on my last bite.   Screaming Orgasm was pretty good, but again I've had equal or better at other places.   My friend ordered the Las Vegas Roll, I didn't try it. 4 Kinds of fish, crabmeat, avocado all completely deep fried. It's not my thing. I don't mind some light tempura, but I'm more of a raw sushi kind of girl. I did try the sauce that was in the bowl because my friend didn't like how spicy it was. I usually like anything spicy, but this didn't have a great flavor.   So for my first visit here, I'd say it went ok. I mean I don't think I'll be rushing back here. I feel like I can get better value at any other place. The best thing about this place is the ambiance. Service was ok. Servers seems to be friendly, but also ambivalent. It's also one of the more expensive AYCE places that I've tried. I don't think that mixes too well with the level of deliciousness. Sushi quality seemed legit, but I also want quality flavor.
First all you can eat sushi place I found in Vegas that serves sashimi. Taste very good too!

I judge all ayce sushi places on the caterpillar roll.  That being said...  The caterpillar roll was bland. There was no real taste of eel, from the actual eel or the eel sauce. I don't use wasabI and soy for this roll because I like the eel taste, but I did here.  The crunch scallop roll was generous. This was also on the bland side of the taste spectrum, but it's scallop so that's not surprising.  The spicy tuna roll was all heat and no flavor. This was disappointing.  The cucumber in the rolls was chewy. Cucumber is supposed to be crisp and crunchy.  The service is great though. My water glass was never empty and the server was always available for questions.  The pricing was fair for what I got and I left full, so that's good.  But I really was not a fan of the taste of the food.  It was an ok choice for a sushi lunch gamble on the other side of the world from where I usually am.  Would I come here again? Not likely.
wowwwwww! Its so delicious! We really loved so much and will be back for sure! Its so good quality of sushi! Top 5 in my life!

Great food at good prices. I ordered 2 special rolls in the mini size: the eskimo (torched butterfish on top of dynamite roll) and the green eel (avocado wrapped eel roll). I didn't expect the size of the rolls to be so large! The proportion of rice-to-filling is perfect! They did NOT skimp out on the filling for these rolls. Although it took about 15 minutes to get our food (table of 6), it was well worth it! The plating is very pretty and most importantly, the food is delicious. The butterfish roll may be more fishy than what most people are use to if you aren't a sushi fanatic. However, I definitely recommend the green eel to everyone though!  The service is amazing. The waitress offered us complimentary ice cream (as I see with most of the other people have received as well), but it was a pleasant surprise to us. The chef (Joseph) came out personally to thank us for eating. Strangely he asked us for our names and wrote them down (assuming that we become regulars and he can call us by our names?). Either way, the service was great. I plan on coming back in the future possibly for takeout (there is a 10% discount!).

Lemme start by saying:  If I could give this place a 3.5 I would. The fish was great for the all you can eat price. The environment was awesome, large alcohol range, and the menu is huge. The staff was also friendly. My first complaint is that you can't order half rolls until your last order. Personally, when I come to all you can eat sushi, I like ordering half rolls to have more variety. My main problem with my first and only visit here was that the staff, while they were very nice, they kept forgetting or messing things up. As someone with experience in food, I get mistakes happen. But after an incorrect drink, two plates that we didn't order, and our forgotten tempura ice cream, it got annoying. I would be open to visiting again for the food, but am open to finding another sushi joint.

2nd time here! I ordered the following: Saut√©ed scallops in butter, Fire cracker, Spicy garlic edamame, Pimp my roll, Masago nigiri, Miso soup, Red bean ice cream.  Fire cracker and the scallops were AMAZING! My family and I had 2 orders each of these appetizers YUM YUM!  Spicy garlic edamame is terrible, dry and ours looked wrinkly. Pimp my roll was okay. Masago was yummy. Miso was perfect. Red bean was good. So overall a decent sushi experience. Service was quite fast and my only complaints are that the special rolls don't seem very creative and the spicy garlic edamame is really bad. The appetizers are beyond fantastic and the nigiri is decent.  This is a pretty good place for sushi.  Will come again mainly for the fire cracker and scallops!

WAAAAAA! pretty good. Upon hearing about this small Sushi bar in the Bathurst and Steeles area of the city I just had to try Sushi Wa. Korean owned Sushi Wa is serving up some classic Japanese dishes with some hints of Korean fusion here and there. For those trying to find the small restaurant, its got the smallest entrance beside the Me Va Me.  Upon entering in, you're greeted by the chefs behind the counter and waitress.  Depending on what time you arrive, wait times can vary as the place has limited seating/ booths, however we were lucky.   In terms of ambiance, the place is small, cute and cozy, however I feel they could definitely fit a few more tables and chairs to accommodate the dinner crowds.   For food both Jen and I kept decided to order their: **Wa 2 (for 2), selection of sushi; california & crab, nigiri, sashimi salmon, BC salmon, smoked, etc. Beautifully presented on a small wooden boat. This meal came included Salmon, Beef or Chicken Teriyaki,  vegetable/ yam tempura, edamame, and dessert (Green tea ice cream with frosted flakes).  **Cinderella,  torched sushi, cooked salmon, avocado, cucumber, crab meat wrapped with salmon on top. Deliciously presented, and as full as were, it was enjoyable.  IMPORTANT: Only improvement recommendation:  Lay out should be slightly changed to accommodate more guests as a few walked out due to long waits during dinner time.
Sushi is very delicious and fresh. Yum yum. Service was above and beyond. Aaron is funny and personable and very quick to deliver.
Loved the AYCE selections they have!  And the quality of the fish was superb!  Service was excellent!

Extremely Unhygienic restaurant!! There was a dead COCKROACH in my dish!! The menu was nice and had a lot of choices. But the food was clearly not up to the mark. All the sushis that we ordered had a stale smell and look to it.. The salmon was clearly brown. I tried a piece and it was totally inedible. We ordered tempura and inside the plate there was a big dead cockroach! I was shocked and showed it to the lady who took our order. She would not believe us at all and would not apologize for this mistake. I was expecting a replacement for the plate but she would not even do that. After this I snuck  into the kitchen to check the hygiene level and it was disgusting. I saw about 4-5 cockroaches running around on the kitchen floor. I cannot believe that they can maintain such a poor hygiene level. I had to pay for all the dishes, yes even the cockroach one!! I have vowed to never come back here again. If you too do not want to get sick then I would recommend you to skip this place.

Came in today from nor Cal. Went in search of a place to eat from my hotel. Saw the sign for sushi next to another restaurant and a yogurt place. Decided I would try it.    Was very pleased with great service,  great sushi and some excellent green tea. I had spider roll, mango salmon roll and veggie tempura. The spider roll was one of the tastiest I have ever had. The crab was just perfect and fresh. So was the mango and salmon on the other.  Very fresh tasting. The vegetable tempura was also very fresh tasting and not overcooked or over fried.  If you like green tea,  try this one, you will be pleased. Best of service by waiter and sushi chef. I Would recommend this restaurant if you want fresh and tasty sushi.   They also had lots of other options for people that don't like sushi, including bento boxes, teriyaki and traditional Japanese.  If I lived here I would visit regularly. Keep up the good job!

Visted here this weekend and was really disappointed. I and my friend have driven for a long time to try this 5star sushi restaurant. There are not many kinds of fishs and quality of fishs were not good, not too bad though. The size of portion was pretty big, but shape of sushi looked not professional. The service was not bad, slow.   This restaurant has not many seats for people and they can not control people even they are not so busy. The one thing that I liked this place was lots of parking lot.   If you are courious about this restaurant, just should go to all you can eat restaurant. Do not waste your time and believe other comments.

Worst sushi I have ever had. I wish I would've asked for my money back because I truly feel like I wasted it here. The sushi didn't taste fresh, even the mango on the mango salmon roll wasn't fresh. The service wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't good. I'm amazed that this place received 4 stars. Not surprised to see it slow on a Friday night.

Sorry to say the service was aweful from the chefs.   Waiter (nice guy) seated me,  and grabbed me a nice sapporo (yummi).  Then i sat for 10 mins with nothing from the chefs (By the way im at the bar seating). Usually, a hello, let me get u started, how can i help u.  Nope, nothing, just me n my sapporo while dude next to me was chowing down.  So i paid for my beer n left.   I used to come here n had my own chopsticks but now i know why i stopped.    To bad, its close to home.

This is an awesome place. They have an all you can eat dinner for $26.95 that includes pretty much all the menu. Be sure to come hungry. Everything is great quality. The place is relatively big but reservations might be worth it for peak times.

I've gone to Sushi Wa several times now, since it's literally within the same business complex as my work. The big perk for me was the "1/2 Off Lunch" special, which had sushi (6-8 pieces) for anywhere from 2.50 to 5 bucks.  They no longer offer this, and the 'new' lunch specials are meh. I dont go to sushi places for california rolls. $9 for a few pieces of veggie tempura, chicken/beef teriyaki, and 4 cal rolls with a small salad.  The food itself is good, and service is nice.. But I usually planned to gorge myself on decent sushi for $10, not a cheapie bento.  Of note, they do have an 'all you can eat' for $21.

I have loved going to sushiwa ever since my mom had taken me there a few years ago. Service was prompt and the food was decent. Last night I went there with my boyfriend and felt sick towards the end of our meal. When we got home, I vomited and am still feeling unwell today (tender stomach, bad 'movements'...).   I called sushiwa and told them what I ate so that they could check their ingredients and to prevent this from happening to someone else, but a rude manager, who I believe is named Gio, told me that I could not have gotten food poisoning because the rolls we ordered had cooked fish. Even so, if the fish had not been handled or cooked properly, or if the other ingredients in the roll had gone bad, there are a number of factors could have contributed to my feeling sick.   Gio did not apologize for my sickness after eating at sushi wa. He was very short with me on the phone and did not say that he would check the ingredients from the rolls I ate.   I do not post this out of anger or for vengeance but because, terrible customer service and lack of empathy aside, it is unacceptable for a restaurant not to investigate such a complaint thoroughly. Indeed, all Gio had to do was apologize for my poor experience and promise that he would check the freshness of the ingredients and the handling and cooking of the food.   Needless to say, we will not be going back to sushi wa. Eat at your own risk.
Best food ever. Everything is so yummy. Other than the male manager ready to have a stroke, making sure no one sharing the all you can eat, service is great!

The first couple of times I came here, I was really impresed with the innovative sushi combinations. However the last couple of times, I've came, the service has become  slower, the food is not as wonderful as the first couple of times I've been. It is AYCE sushi, which is awesome, however it can be a tad pricier than most AYCE joints. But if you're in the Henderson area and looking for good sushi to try without driving too far that is AYCE, this is probably the one to go with.

This is a hidden gem. Not a lot of people know about Sushi Wa since it's tucked away at the Bathurst and Steeles plaza situated next to Me Va Me. The quality of sushi here is extremely high and their specialty rolls are astounding. Not only is the food fantastic but so is the service, especially Joseph who will make sure to greet all customers and remember their names. Joseph is one of the sweetest people and I truly love his personal touch service.   For starters, their taco yaki balls are scrumptious with a spicy kick. The complimentary crunchy soup is so good, you'll want to order a full portion.   I love their Crunch roll with df shrimp & tempura, avocado and chips on top. Their fish is very fresh. I also love their Eskimo roll with torched butterfish. So delicious!  The spicy salmon and tuna rolls are amazing. They are composed of chopped up fish with tempura and it's a flavour explosion in your mouth.  You can't go wrong with anything here as it's all delicious and very fresh.
Really good food and service. A large variety of special rolls. And the staff are extremely friendly. The sushi chef came around to personally greet us. Supa awesome wow

When I rate sushi places I factor in food quality, customer service, atmosphere, and overall value. I have been here twice, both times I had excellent service, great food, and overall it was at the right price. Their baked rolls are excellent. Just a heads up, they use a good amount of mayo and other sauces in the baked rolls but they're delicious. Obviously I have been to better places, but these guys do a great job. I recommend them, its a great place to try out.

I've been to a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas, and I have to say that this place is one of my top picks. They have a bunch of sushi rolls with ingredients I haven't really seen in other places and their modern, intimate decor adds a really nice touch to the experience.  My favorite rolls include the rose, bikini, dragon, fried salmon, and fried scallop. Rose roll is pretty good because it isn't too saucy and the combination of scallops and mushroom is really good! Bikini roll doesn't have any rice since it is wrapped with a cucumber shell which provides a refreshing and healthy alternative to the other rolls. Dragon is a favorite for those who like eel and eel sauce on top of a california roll. The fried salmon roll is delicious because it is basically a sushi roll stuffed inside crispy salmon. Fried scallop is good too, imagine popcorn scallop on top of california rolls.   Service is really good: the staff refills your drinks periodically without you having to call them over and they are very polite. I would definitely recommend checking this place if you are within the area. The price is comparable to other AYCE places even if this place seems a bit fancier (at least on the inside)!

Sushi Wa is my favorite sushi restaurant! This is the only place I will come for sushi! The food is delicious, it's served in timely manner and the wait staff is friendly and courteous! We have brought here our three children with their spouses and numerous out of town visitors! Everybody has given it high remarks!  Definitely a five star restaurant!

Good price for the all you can eat.  Interesting sushi choices.  Had one that tastes like a whopper.  One was like lasagna.  Nice atmosphere.  Good customer service. Quick.  Correct.  Good suggestions from them.  Ill be back.  We did some damage here, they lost $$$ with us.

I really like Sushi wa.  The prices are pretty fantastic, and the quality of food is always top notch.  I am never disappointed when i come in for lunch or dinner.  The only issue I have with this place is that customer service is a little iffy.  The older woman there always seems angry and upset.  I really like the younger server.  She is really nice, but when the older woman is working with her, she tends to yell at the younger one and gets really awkward.  Other then that this place is awesome.

Finally ! A sushi place open until 4am !!! I don't know why but I'm always craving sushi or just hungry in general around 1am-3am so this is perfect  lol ! We sat @ the sushi bar area so it would be fast and easy, and the sushi chefs were so fun and entertaining ! The service was definitely amazing. I wish I got his name but he was soooo fast as he made everything right infront of us ! All the choices are so different when it came to the rolls but they were great ! The nigiris are AMAZING !!! We definitely took advantage of the "all you can eat" with this one !!! We got almost all the nigiris and tons of orders of them ! For late night sushi craving, this was AMAZING quality ! I can't wait to try more of the other rolls when I come back ! I got lucky to find this sushi place that's open until 4am but even luckier that their sushi is actually super yummy !!!  Definitely a MUST TRY !!

Of course I had to save review #100 for Joseph! A+ Service. A+ Food.   Sushi Wa is great. This is my favourite sushi place in North York/Thornhill.  Seriously, this place has heart.   The rice is soft and fluffy, the fish is always fresh. Each piece of nigiri is delicately constructed, with its own unique and tasty twist, and melts in your mouth. The quality of each piece is consistent visit after visit.  We usually get the sushi + sashimi + roll combo for two, along with two other rolls because we want to try everything, but we are always so full after the combo it's a struggle to finish everything! At the beginning of this year, they expanded their menu to include some really crazy rolls. From what we've tried so far, they're pretty awesome.  The staff is always friendly, and they always try to be very attentive, even when there are a lot of people in the restaurant. At the end of the meal, the owner Joseph comes around every time to ask for your name, offer you free ice cream, and really tries to remember your name for next time. He's always so friendly and happy to see you.   Always a happy dining experience here!

Very good quality sushi. Please note that it is only a la carte and no buffet style!! It is a small restaurant and extremely busy so either make reservations or go early. We saw several groups of people leave because they had to wait. A little on the pricey side.  However they give you soup, and delicious free appetizer. Service is good and fast. The owner walked us and opened the door for us asking us to return soon. Very nice gesture.

I really like having another all you can eat nearby. They have amazing salmon. The chef will be more than happy to give you recommendations. The Superman roll was my favorite. The chef was more than happy to create something for us too. Fast service. Never waited for my tea to be refilled. They even left us the pot. Definitely will be going back.

We stopped by this simple restaurant because we just happen to be in the area. It blew us away by the quality of the food and the service provided. The owner and sushi chef came to our table and talked to us, offered us free ice cream because he learned we were not from the area. This pleasant surprise was honestly the best quality for price point in the GTA. If you're in the Vaughan area/ Bathurst and Steeles area, please check this place out!

Consistently one of the best sushi places in the Valley. Joon and his team provide high quality and creativity for a fair price and in a great setting. I eat there at least twice a week. Conveniently open till 3am every night. Their $28 all you can eat is the deal of the decade. Highly recommend giving it a try.

I just ordered from here for the first time and it was delivered within 40 min just as they said! I ordered a lot of the rolls in the "mini" form which is very reasonably priced and not exactly mini. The seaweed salad was amazing and was served with avocado! The sushi tasted just like if it was delivered to my table right from the kitchen.  I will definitely order from here again!!

Sushi Wa is a small and quiet and little sushi restaurant  located on Bathurst and Steeles.  I'd passed by this place many times and finally got to try it upon recommendation by my brother.    For starters, the service is exceptional; the waitress is very polite and during our first visit, provided us with a large photo album with picture of the dishes they served.  We even got some complimentary dishes and dessert on both visits!  Their complimentary rolls are unique; one was a mango radish roll, which was very refreshing and the other was a spicy roll of some sort.   The owner of the restaurant, a man by the name of Joseph Kim came out to speak with us and ask us about our meals.  He also asked us for our names and wrote them down.  We also got free ice cream after too.  After our meals, he thanked us and walked us out.  Grade A service right there!   Finally, the presentation of the food is amazing and instagram worthy, so do remember take pictures of your orders!!!

5 stars no doubt!! As it was mentioned before the service was great and very fast too. Our waitress was very nice and brought us some complementary appetizers and ice cream for dessert. The sushi was very fresh and delicious, and I loved how they decorated the plates. They clearly put some work into it which you don't normally see at a sushi bar.  The prices are very reasonable too, I'd even say cheap considering the size of their rolls (huge!!). Joseph (the chef) came up to our table to ask how the food was and took our names, so he can remember us, if we decide to come back. I think that was very sweet) Overall it was a great experience and I'll definitely come back!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(237/365) "New And Improved???"  First off, it's more like 3.25 stars.....  Never did I think I was gonna step foot in this spot again...if you read my previous review, this was way back during the Yang Dynasty and was our first Yelptern's UYE where we were held captive....Ugh!  A former Goyemon employee suggested I come try this place out as they made some changes and things have gotten better and that they're still in the process of making things better...okay cool, so we arrive with an open mind into a comfy booth, go with AYCE ($26.95) and we order an assortment of things. Assorted nigiri, a few appetizers, hot items(dynamite, kalbi), a Pocky Roll, some sashimi one order per person, AYCE Dinner only,  also some uni and Amaebi which are also one order per person.  The atmosphere is cool and the fish quality and presentations are solid, and the apps were delicious. The only downside is that the sushi rice was totally bland and needs work. I'm glad we got to try Sushi Wa out again,  but they need to also offer half rolls, a few more side dishes,  and add flavor to the rice in order to compete with other AYCE Sushi spots around town.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \u  3.25

My favorite locals sushi place in the city!  Joon is the best!     Am a little of a sushi purist, so I don't go in much for the rolls, but whether you're into rolls, sashimi or nigiri, the fish is always super fresh!  And, if you are a little adventurous, check the specials board--  fresh orange clam, sea urchin and kobe beef sashimi make frequent appearances...  and don't forget to ask for fresh wasabi.  It is a must have.

I'm totally disappointed! My husband and I go here to eat all the time, we left town for about a month and when we returned the first thing we wanted was sushi.  We noticed after we sat down that the menu and  prices had changed, and also the "rules" for AYCE. Then we waited 20 minutes for 2 rolls and a miso soup. (We were the only 2 people in the restaurant)So sad we really love the staff but the service and quality have left the building.  We've  gone back once since, hoping it was a fluke....... but unfortunately we had the same experience.  There are SO MANY OTHER CHOICES.  Sorry guys!

A very nice place to stop by and have AYCE.  The fish here is always fresh and the portions are much better than other places in the area. The staff is very polite. The prices are a bit on the higher side but I believe it is worth it.  Not sure how other people were served but whenever we ordered straight sushi the portions were generous.  I will definitely come here again.

I have been to 100's of sushi restaurants in the US and over sea's. I loved this sushi restaurant because of the service, atmosphere and amazing quality of sushi. Recommended adventure dish, ask for the sweet shrimp sushi and ask for the heads with it.  They batter the heads in tempura and are made to eat whole. I promise its amazing, and the taste is out of this world.

We have been here multiple times over the years. The food itself is good and the decor and dining ambiance as well making it a good choice for group occasions. But the service is actually pretty terrible for a few reasons. First reason is they don't greet you in any sort of nice fashion. Then you sit there and wait quite a while for a person to give you water or menus. After they come, they walk away so fast and they don't come back. When they do come back for the order, they take a bit of time to make it. Then they don't come back for your next round of ordering. We know how they roll, so we just try to order all we want in the first time, rather than smaller rounds. But then we end up over ordering and becoming overstuffed. All you can eat sushi problems. I just wish they would get their service game together, because then we would definitely go here more. There are just better options with better food and better service around here. When I bring in people from out of town I would prefer to bring them here due to the seating and ambiance, but I just can't after past attempts. I brought my brother there from out of town with his wife and kids, and we ended up with a free voucher card with $15 on it because we were there for two hours and they knew the service was bad. I can't bring people here until I know it's fixed. Edited: I edited my review to remove the part about the ordering with paper and pens, I must have remembered that part wrong, we do have two sushi restaurants we used to go to with that same issue. But yes, I do know this is the proper restaurant and I do have the free voucher gift card somewhere that was given to my out of town brother when I brought him there with his family. This was a couple years ago, and we have been back a few times since. Its the size and shape of a credit card and If I can find it I will take a picture to prove it. One of the last times we went we were with another couple who had also been there before and we joked about the service as it unfolded again to be sub par. When we do go,  we know what to expect but we keep crossing fingers that it would have gotten better by now. It's definitely not a good business practice to respond how you do to patrons. Best advice is to learn something from what you are reading and make improvements. Not try to appear that everything is perfect and your patrons giving you feedback are crazy. This review is real, but the service is still a joke. We have been back a handful of times since, but not in the past 6 months. We will try it again when the time is right.

By far the best sushi in Vegas.  Joon, JJ, Yoon, and Yuly serve up the most diverse and extensive menu I've ever seen. From the mind-blowing Superman Burrito roll, to the mussels, to the white tuna sushi, you can't go wrong.  The servers and staff are super friendly and very attentive.  My wife and I love this place so much that I actually proposed to her here.  If you haven't tried sushi wa, then get in your car and get down here!  You won't regret it. They now have a late night menu that goes until 4am!

My boyfriend and I were on the way to get some meat jun but, he changed his mind and wanted salmon skin handrolls... and obvi, Sushi Wa is our favorite for that. We were both excited as we haven't been back for a minute.   Initially, I was going to order just a bento box with one salmon skin handrolls but, BF convinced me to do AYCE.  We order about 6 (4 spicy for him, 2 regular for me) salmon skin handrolls; and since they don't do half orders, we went light on ordering too much.  So, 3 specialty rolls, hamachi kama, and gyoza to start.   I got my handrolls and they were just as good as I remembered.  Then got the specialty rolls SMOTHERED in mayo...ugh, I forgot they like to sauce up their rolls.   BF got his 4 salmon skin handrolls and they were double the size of mines...I thought they put a lot of jalape√±o in there. Turns out they STUFFED the roll with rice! Like, really...That's their game of making you full.  I mean, I've seen other sushi spots do this but, this place used a ridic amount of rice.  BF ate about half the rice for each roll and they leftover rice coulda made 2 specialty rolls.    The waitress picked up his plate with all the rice and showed the sushi chef.  I didn't see but, my BF said they were pointing, looking, and talking about him.  So disappointing as we were excited for our lunch and this just kinda ruined the mood/day.  Thankfully, they didn't try to charge us for that rice but, that is most def our last time there.  The sushi itself isn't anything to miss anyways.  So with that: BYE SUSHI WA!

Wa, wa, wa? Sushi Wa is my new favorite place. Let's start with the Ahi Poke salad which is better than anywhere. It is dressed with fresh small bites of fish, perfectly sliced seaweed, and the right amount of seasoning. I'm not a huge fan of Poke, but I'd return to get more here.  As the Mr. said, Sushi Wa's fish is super fresh. They cut nice thick pieces of Yellowtail. Their sashimi plates are creative and delicious too.   If this were my restaurant, I'd remove the TV from behind the chef station but, otherwise, the Asian decor takes me to another country, far away from the strip mall this restaurant actually resides in.  What turns this 4 into a 5 are the sushi chefs. They crack jokes, talk, offer special tastes. They're fun to be around.

I used to think Sushi Mon and Yama Sushi were the best spots in town. Then my friend recommended Sushi Wa. I was thoroughly impressed with the food and the extremely friendly staff. Our waitress Vanessa was absolutely a pleasure to speak too and shared her recommendations which were spot on for our liking and preferences. I am already looking forward to retturning to this Amazing establishment!!

Tonight I came here with my husband as a treat to myself for dreadful month end accounting that I am about to endure.  It pains me to say that I did not truly enjoy this place; maybe I would have a year ago. A year ago, my sushi preferences had no standards, sauce me up and make it crispy.   When we arrived, we were kindly seated to a large booth for just the two of us. We for a moment felt like kings and the bar got set really high. Within a minute of sitting down, a young gentleman came and took our drink order. He got our drinks (me water with lemon and my husband an Asahi pint for $5). As soon as he came back with our drinks a minute or so later, he asked to take our order. We weren't ready and asked for 5 minutes to look over the menu. He said "sure" gave a wink and went on his way. My husband and I found him charming and we both exclaimed how much we thought he was going to be a good waiter.   Unfortunately, he did not come back. We had a female waiter who was nice as well who replaced him, it just kind of came out of nowhere.  The female waiter came to our table and we asked a couple questions to determine if we understood the rules correctly before getting AYCE for dinner. At that moment, we put in an order for 4 rolls and a white fish with ponzu sauce sashimi.  The rolls we got were: Mountain Roll, Pocky Roll, Bonsai Roll, Energy Roll. The rolls came out within a few minutes of ordering and we were ready to feast.    At a first glance, each roll looked good in appearance. They weren't particularly bite size and I found a roll to be more than my mouth could handle at one time. Additionally, the Pocky Roll should not be called a roll. It is really a mound of imitation crab meat with a few accents of fresh fish covered in avocado slices. This was good, but also not very "fresh" tasting even though it is on the "fresh fish roll" menu portion. I believe this item should be moved to the appetizer portion of the menu, because we were surprised when it arrived. My husband was not interested in this, so I struggled to eat it by myself.  Now my criticism for the other rolls, Mountain, Energy, and Bonsai is all the same. Each of these rolls were over sauced. We love sauce, so when we say over sauced, we mean over sauced. Out of all the rolls, the Bonsai was our favorite because it tasted the freshest and most balanced. However, it was not good enough for a return visit. The sashimi was the best part of our meal thus far.  So we finish our first order, and we are waiting for the waitress to come back by. I had been out of water for a while now and we hadn't seen our waiter since being served.  Thankfully, there was cross fit silliness being shown on TV to distract me from my empty water glass and dry mouth. Meanwhile, waiters were helping out families at other tables and refilling their cups.   By the time she came back, we were kind of ready to give up. I asked for a miso soup, and we also order ice cream deserts. Weirdly enough chocolate sauce came on our ice cream (strawberry mocha and green tea ice cream) and I never received the miso soup .I didn't bother to correct the wait staff because I was ready to leave.   Oh yeah, for whatever reason, the central table in the restaurant was being used a busing station. It was collecting dirty plates and it had the water pitches waiters were filling patron's glasses with.  Overall, if Taco Bell is good Mexican food to you, then you will think this is good sushi. Otherwise, it is what it is. This is the most expensive sushi place I have been to that provides this quality of food. I do not see myself returning for a visit until I hear about positive changes in the quality of food and improvement with wait staff tending to guests.  I apologize if the review seems harsh, but I hope that it makes a positive impact on this restaurant.

Great AYCE sushi been here twice now. The service is good. The appetizers are good. The price is comparable to most AYCE sushi places. They have a good beer and saki selection. The sushi chef pays attention and is attentive to the customers at the Bar. The staff seems very friendly.

I love this place.  I love their AYCE but what sets it apart is also their cooked items are extensive and yummy.  I could eat their salmon collar all day long!  The fish is fresh and I love that they have a half price AYCE price for kids.  I love Goyemon also (esp. Bc they have half rolls) but I'm not paying $27 for my 4 year old!  Now if only I could get half rolls here......
Good sushi i've tried hawaiian roll. All are deliciuos. There's a lot of selection and wuality of taste. Affordable.
Sushi Wa was wonderful. I had to go back the next day just to ensure that it was as great as the day prior.

I was craving for sushi recently and got bored to head to Yonge street where I usually dine. So glad to find this petit but delicious sushi restaurant which is more convenient for me. The restaurant holds 7 or 8 tables, including 3 booths by the windows. The ambience is neat and comfortable.  I ordered take-out. During the waiting, the staff brought us a complimentary appetizer. When our dishes were ready. The owner (I guessed) himself delivered the package to us, asked our names and thanked for our visit. We felt touched with such a warm and sincere welcome.  About the food, I think it was worth for the price. The presentation was nice even though it was a take-out. I tried the special roll set lunch of lionking plus crabmeat. The portion was quite adequate and fresh. As for the tempura lunch bento, the chef was very thoughtful to cut two small slices on the container to let the steam out and presumed the crunch of fried food.  I saw some popular dishes on the menu like salmon chirashi, sushi rolls. As well, some special dishes, such as aburi sushi (torched sushi). Will definitely try next time.

Food/server, very good.   Management- the worst.   Visited with family in from out of country- a group of 10, one elderly. 4 of us ordered AYCA. Because of this, they asked that we move seats, abuelita was uncomfortable moving seats at the triangle shaped table so they watched us like hawks to ensure we weren't sharing between a la carte and AYCA. At one point, the manager got loud, waived his finger at my kid yelling, "you cannot share!"  He was wrong- they were sticking to the "rules" and sharing between a la carte orders. I had an exchange with him and for the rest of the meal he sent his largest statured busser to circle our table.  It's a shame. Chefs are excellent, server was fantastic and visibly uncomfortable with her manager.  ...we're not returning.
Amazing as always!!! Service and food so good. Totally worth the money for the all you can eat.

Not a bad place to bring a group of friends for sushi and a few drinks. They have an exceptional selection of premium Japanese beer and sake. Rolls are decent but very filling. If you're doing the all you can eat, be sure to pace yourself. I like that the appetizers and desserts are also included, but again there are a lot of fillers so choose wisely.
Some of the best bang for your buck on AYCE. Some things are limited to one and you will see why. Serious chunks of fish, big servings, tasty sauces. Wish I lived closer!

The place is a bit hidden.  Not really in a popular plaza.  However, the decor inside is nice.  They do have happy hour specials in the afternoon, and I think they just started doing two for one drinks at night specials.  They also have a DJ playing now on certain days.  I guess they're trying any gimick to get people to come, but what might work more is spending money on advertising than on a DJ.  The sushi does taste fresh though, and service is great.  This isn't really cheap food, but what type of sushi is unless it's prepackaged in some grocery market which isn't something I like.

Came here with the family after seeing the 4 stars on Yelp, I was definitely more disappointed than impressed. Two big things that made me take stars.   1. The food was decent but their sashimi selection is very small and very limited. Their sushi selection, rolls, and hot foods were good but nothing "wowed" me.  2. Every single time our server would come to take our order (we were 4 people doing AYCE) she would ALWAYS have to comment about how much food we were ordering and if we were 100% sure we wanted what we just ordered. This made no sense to us because we were well aware that there can be charges for left over food. This honestly ruined the mood and the food which is why I took an additional star from my review.

Upscale feel to the decor. We went in today and we were the only patrons, but that's probably because it's been raining all day. The staff was very friendly and the food was amazing! This is now one of my favorite sushi places. We had the pocky roll, the rose roll, the superman burrito, baked green mussels, monkey brain, and the energy roll. They were all to die for. We wanted to try more things but just didn't have enough room. Didn't even have room for dessert. We will definitely be coming back.
Had a nice lunch with 3 kids. Fresh fish, attentive service and reasonably priced. Kids really liked the chicken teriyaki which they tend to be picky about.  Thumbs up.

Everything about this place is perfect :) the sushis are fresh and delicious plus the portions compare to the reasonable price are great. Josef, I guess the owner, welcomed us with three different dishes on the house

The perfect example of what customer service should be. Their food is amazing and their all you can eat pricing is amazing! Their ambience in there is great and their lighting is comfortable even on those, "I drank too much the night before"  days. The sushi is so fresh and their spicy rolls are killer.  I have referred so many people to this place and I recommend it to anyone looking for great service and amazing rolls!

2 stars mainly just for the food (presentation and taste) other than that the customer service was horrible from the time we called to check the hours till the time we payed the bill and walked out. There are way better all you can eat sushi places (sushimon, Sakana) unfortunately this was the only place open till 4am, as we get off of work late at night and needed to get our sushi fix on. Our waitress (I think her name was Jenny)? Was super rude, didn't seem to give a hoot about us, and we cringed to order or ask her any questions about the menu without getting talked to like we were stupid or get some kind of attitude from her. Really didn't want to even tip 10% but I could never do that even as horrible as it was. We tipped 18%, thinking maybe she was just having a horrible night, or maybe the customer service field isn't the right choice of profession. Although we never will be coming back again, we'll still give it the benefit of the doubt.

I would really love to give this place more stars because the food is good but the service is HORRIBLE!  They sat us and then took all more 15 mins before some came over brought us menus and took our drink order.  It took forever to get the waitess to come over and take our order.  I order the simplest rolls out of the whole table and did not recieve my rolls till everyone had recieve their rolls and were finished eating.  This isn't the first time I have been here, I gave another chance and both times the service was awful.  They need to hire more staff.  Don't go here if your in a rush because even lunch took us over 2 hours.

Sushi is great. No complaints there! But 1 waitress has made us not come back. We end up getting her EVERYTIME. Her attitude is terrible and she gets mad when ever you want to order something else. It's all you can eat, I'm going to eat as much as I can. Not kidding, you can see her disgust on her face when my friends and i come in to eat. Idk what we did, but we will not be back.

Excellent sushi experience! Wonderful sushi chefs who will make anything for you! And I mean anything! Attentive and friendly staff, excellent decor and interior design.   Will definitely return! The sashimi is excellent!

Oishii desu yo!  Man, I wish I had tried this place long ago.  Why have I avoided Sushi Wa in the past?  Mostly because their menu used to be pretty pricey and it looked too upscale to take my two rambunctious rug rats to.  Unfortunately, that relegated me to eating at too many sushi bars that wouldn't know a fresh fish even if it was thrashing on a cutting board.    But along came my chance when some clients thought it'd be a good idea to try this joint.  Upon arriving, there were comments about how nice the place looked.  In fact, the place looked like it didn't quite belong in a strip mall tucked next to U-Swirl (no offense to U).    Sitting down, everyone chose to do AYCE, which meant I had to suppress the desire to order everything on the menu (and to order 10 scoops of ice cream).  Yes.  I am a pig.  When it was time to order, I probably should not have been the one to do so.  Here's the rundown of what I can remember:  Oyster Shooters - suckas was HUGE!  Best to shoot the sake and quail egg, then pick out the oyster.  Raw Oysters (3 per order) - too big for me, but good flavor.  Soft Shell Crab - I love it that you don't have to have it with rice.  Nigiri sushi was impressive for the way the fish drapes over the rice and the quality of the hamachi in particular was notable.  Mexican Roll - This was so not my cup of tea.  It's like they took the leftover spicy tuna and mixed it with a bunch of crap.    Deserts were AYCE, which, if left unattended, I would have shut this place down.  Lucky for them I was with clients and didn't get crazy.  I actually ordered one of each of the 6 or 7 flavors of mochi ice cream, but I changed my order to two scoops of green tea ice cream and the banana tempura.  For better or worse I didn't order sake...this was supposed to be business meeting, after all.  But I did check out their alcohol list to see what I was missing and they actually have some really good sake on there.  Try the Wakatake or Kurosawa black - good stuff you don't find in most local sushi restos.    Why have I avoided Sushi Wa in the past?  I don't know!  They have it all, ambiance, fresh fish, good sake and all the desert your tummy can handle.  Check this joint out at www.bomb.com.

Me and my best friend come to this place the most for our sushi craving for this very reason: Best quality of fish with the most affordable price.  I always start out with a seaweed salad- their portion size on this one is small but it's not a big deal because you get so much food later on that it's a great starter.  Then I pack on nigiri, everything from big belly tuna to seared pepper to yellowtail and salmon. Their fish quality versus some cheaper joints like Blue Fin & Daisho knock them out of the water and give the most bang for your buck if you're a fish lover like me. And for these, they don't scrap you on portion- I could barely fit the whole piece in my mouth. Still did and it freaking MELTED with flavour.  My friend ordered Shrimp Killer- good for people looking for a lighter choice. It didn't come with much eel sauce but when we ordered a second one with extra it was overkill so just compensate with soy or something.  I ordered a Salmon Crunch- much more on the heavier side which is why it only came with six pieces because one piece feels like an entire roll. But very cooked and comes with two sauces on the side to dip them in.  We picked off the rest of my friends scallop crunch roll when the manager Gio (who'd been serving us all night as well) came up to check our IDs for some complimentary drinks for being such frequent customers. This really made up for the off putting vibe we got from the female server who silently got our menus and took our plates with frozen ice on her face.   Nonetheless he really made us feel welcome by remembering us and appreciating our feedback on social media. I got to sample a light peach sparkling sake while my friend got a raspberry sake straight. I would've enjoyed more of it if I weren't driving but it was a great cap to a great meal next to the always amazing banana tempura that is a must for leaving room for!  Beyond satisfied for this trip, already looking forward to next time!
No worth my time to give a lengthy review of Sushi Wa. Food was ok, service was terrible!

One word: Excellent!! :oP Try all these during lunch $21/$22per person, all-u-can eat:  Appetizer: Seaweed salad, Monkey Brains, Miso Soup, Galbi Korean Ribs, & Soft Shell Crab. Sushi: Uniagi Nigiri, Salmon Nigiri, Yellowtail Nigiri, & Garlic Tuna! Rolls: Dragon Roll, Spider Roll, Sex on the Beach, Salmon Skin Roll, & Mango Salmon Roll. Dessert: Tempura Banana Vanilla Ice Cream.

Small restaurant BUT excellent service.  It's just like a neighbourhood restaurant.  Owner will try his best (when he is available) to greet every single customer.  He is very kind and nice.  Staff are friendly and very helpful.   Their sashimi is very fresh.  Love their sushi / sashimi / roll combo, with pretty presentation.  Also love their dinner bento: good price, great quality, big portion.  Their tempura coating is perfectly thin, love it too~  This restaurant is getting busier, so it's better to make reservation.

I've eaten a lot of sushi/sashimi in my life time and I have never really been to a place where EVERYTHING tasted amazing.  Sushi Wa has met all my expectations..! FINALLY!   Not only was everything fresh and delicious, IT WAS ALL YOU CAN FREAKIN' EAT.   YES. I believe it was about $26 for dinner...my party and I probably ate over $700 worth of fish...like to the point where I started feeling BAD that I practically ate the whole entire ocean...but in a cruel sort of good way...my bad Ariel XD  Food aside, the restaurant itself is very, very nice. It's dark but sophisticated and feels very fancy. Their presentation is impeccable as well. They make sure every slice of sashimi is placed perfectly and that every plate is fresh and clean. The waiters are exceptionally kind and so are the sushimen. They carved up A LOT of fish for us that night. KUDOS!   All in all, if you're near Henderson or Vegas and looking for some legit sushi/sashimi, hit this place up. No regrets. I promise! :]
Best Ayce sushi I've been to in a while. Great service, very polite staff. Food was very good quality.  Will definitely come back to again.

Great sushi spot.. I'd say this is comparable with I love sushi due to Sushi WA has all you can eat.. The sushi is just as good.. They also have very nice staff. My waitress is very kind and Funny.. Have to check this spot out.. I'd recommend the xxx roll.

I'm sad for 3 reasons.  1. Sushi Wa is a far drive from my residency and from work.  But because my friends raved about this place, I really wanted to take the time and drive to try it.  2. My favorite kind of sushi which is the simple Salmon Sake Nigiri was laid on top of a super huge portion of rice and more importantly, the fish was NOT fresh.  HUGE disappointment!  3. My favorite roll which is the spicy tuna over crispy fried rice here was bland!  The fish looked like it has been out for days and they don't use fresh jalapeno?  Makes no sense.  I was a bit disgusted.  I also had their Yellowtail Nigiri; also not fresh.  I tried their garlic edamame; no taste and not even a hint of garlic.  When you say there is going to be garlic in a dish, I better taste it.  It's as if they like they completey forgot the ingredient and it's in the freakin' name.  Boo!  Then, I had their Ultimate Garlic Tuna Roll...and THUN THUN THUN.....again, no taste of any garlic.  The roll even sits on a bowl of soup that only makes it even worse because the soup base doesn't taste like anything but yuck.  I couldn't believe my dismay!  The one star goes to one appetizer: Fried Oysters, and one roll: Volcano roll.  The volcano roll was a little too much on the saucy side that if I had to finish it myself, I would feel guilty for my because of all the mayo clogging up my heart valves.  But because it had sauce, it was the only roll that had any flavor.  This was a huge disappointment.  Not only the taste, but the fish wasn't fresh.  Fresh comes first!  The wait  staff though was really nice, and the place is decorated nicely; kind of too fancy though.  Also, they over do the food presentation.  They need to work on the food taste rather than the presentation.  Just because something looks good, does not mean it tastes good.     I'll end on a positive note though.  They do have coffee mochi for dessert.  Not many AYCE sushi places have this mochi flavor.     If my friends convince me to go back to try their orders, I don't know.  Because the fish might still be from today.

All you can eat was unbelievable and the price for it is the best in town. Favorite roll was the 4 of a kind; and don't be afraid to try something new. They have a wide variety of things to choose from and this is honestly 1 of the best sushi spots in town

Fresh wasabi never had it before got it here I love it I was digging into that little dish between all the sushi I thought about ordering more for desert  Sushi was better than most a lot of interesting rolls can't remember any names.  The one I liked the best reminded me of a baked green mussel.  A roll topped and baked like a green mussel.  The second best thing there other than the real wasabi was the interesting appetizers. Monkey brains a mushroom stuffed with spicy tuna then fried then a crab shrimp and cream cheese fritter thing killer green mussel a few others that slip my mind  ohh and fresh wasabi

Phenomenal! The fish was delicious. You really can taste the difference from other sushi joints. Roy was my chef, he was fantastic! I had the Ultimate Salmon Roll, Garlic Tuna, Phillie Roll, and the Pimp My Roll. Everything was wonderful, especially the garlic tuna. I've never had fish that tasted so fresh and just melted in my mouth. I found the Pimp My Roll to be too spicy for myself, but the flavors were good. I will definitely be going back for more!!

Had take out here before, but the service dinning in was excellent. We were seated immediately, and were provided with snacks & icecream (at the end of the meal) on the house.   Ordered the SSC-1 (35 pcs) priced at $29.95 before tax which was standard price. The sashimi was very fresh and cut generously (not thin and dry like other establishments)-- it was presented beautifully. As everyone else had mentioned, the chef came out to introduce himself as Joseph and asked us for our names as well as feedback on his restaurant. Must say, it is very rare for business owners to do that these days, but it made us feel valued as customers.   I think I've just found my favourite go-to sushi joint at this hidden gem. 5 stars because I left happy with the entire experience as he walked us out. Gave extra tips for this mom & pop shop!

Been here a lot of times but this last time, really bad service and overwhelming rice underneath a thin layer of fish. Couple years ago, this was my go-to sushi place but now, wont be coming back. The screaming orgasm and the amaebi nigiri was still really good but all the other nigiris were all very thinly sliced over an overly large portion of rice. It seems as if I'm just eating a big chunk of rice. Couldnt even tell if there was fish on top.   The biggest factor of this one star review is really the service. I'm not sure if it was just our server or just generally speaking. But, it was terrible. On the get go, once we said our first batch of orders, he just questioned us if we would be able to finish all those cause they charge for leftovers, etc. Now, we've been eating AYCE sushi for the longest time and we already know what our limits are. But making that statement seems more like an insult rather than a reminder. Then he kept asking the same question after every order. Now we felt like we were challenged.. so we had like 4 batches of a ton load of orders that we finished (no leftovers). With those statements and questions, we felt totally uncomfortable throughout our dinner which just ruined the whole night. Towards the end of our dinner, we kinda had the attitude of anger and sarcasm not just towards our server, but with the whole restaurant as well. Btw, server's name is Mark.

When I moved to Las Vegas, Sushi Wa was the first place I had sushi. That was years ago, before they changed over to an AYCE format. My husband is not a sushi eater and Sushi Wa was always a place we could go together for dinner because they serve teriyaki chicken bento boxes all day.   Fast forward a few years... My mother was in town with her boyfriend visiting and wanted to go out for dinner. My husband suggested Sushi Wa. I was a little concerned, I had read about the less-then-amazing experience some Yelpers had at a recent UYE. Since our group was fairly small, we decided to risk it...   The hostess allowed us to select where we wanted to sit and brought out both the AYCE and regular menus. We decided pretty quickly that AYCE wasn't going to be worth the money (it is $26.95 per person, and they limit sashimi to one order per person) since we weren't super hungry.   The three of us split a Philadelphia roll, a spicy tuna salad, and the sashimi combo (4 pieces each of tuna, salmon and yellowtail). My husband had the bento box and we all split an order of edamame as well as two bottles of nigori sake. The sashimi was sliced nice and thick, and I love that Sushi Wa makes their Philly roll with asparagus, gives it a nice yummy crunch.   Total damage with tip was $100. This isn't too bad for dinner and drinks for 4 people, but we really did not have that much food. The decor is very nice and service was decent, we had multiple people check on us throughout the night and never waited long for anything other then the bento box which was understandable.  Will I be back? Maybe someday. There are a LOT of other sushi options in the area though...

This is by far our favorite sushi place. Such Quality and detailed service. The Sushi is amazing. They also just started staying open for late night sushi. (I believe until 4 am) which is wonderful for us late nighters!
Unbelievable service and food. Believe the reviews, don't hesitate just go. Best place I have been to. Joseph the owner is a gem.

Sushi Wa a couple months ago was just another sushi spot for my girlfriend & I to try, but now it has become the ONLY sushi restaurant we attend. Three things blow it away from every other sushi spot; 1. The food 2. The cleanliness 3. The friendly staff. The entrees that are available to eat with AYCE are delicious along with the fresh, mouth watering sushi! The tuna sashimi just melts in your mouth! Also, every time you walk in, and once seated you are in awe of how consistently clean the restaurant is. Dirty dishes never stay on your table for long at all! Lastly, but not least the staff here is always greeting you with a smile from beginning to end!
