Their priority is making your lunch/dinner a meal to remember, and eventually return to dine on the amazing delectable food! SUSHI WA IS THE PLACE TO BE PEOPLE!!!!
Went for the the all you can eat lunch and wasn't that impressed. Most of the rolls on the menu had nothing but crab - no shrimp options. Overall food was good and nice place.

Love that this place is opened late :) friend and I (who is visiting) had a late night craving of sushi. Place is very nice/clean. Our waitress was very nice and helpful. I had the crunchy roll very good! The eel sauce was very good too. Defiantly gong back :)
Perfect place. My server was very nice and kind. I love this place!!! If you want the best sushi come here! They are open till 4AM!

I haven't gone out with my wife in awhile and we wanted to go somewhere close to the house that had Ayce so we came to Sushi Wa. After we got seated it took them 10minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink then after we got our drinks as we were about to order the Asian lady said hold on and she turned her back on us and grabbed something from another table then when we were ordering she said hold on I'll be back in the middle of ordering our food. Was trying to figure out where she went as she was gone for 3or so minutes, I seen her taking dirty dishes from another table so we waited for a few minutes. She never attended to us so we decided to take off, horrible service and it wasn't even jammed packed. I wanted to try the sushi there but o well maybe not meant to be maybe it was a sign but even it was I still give it a 1 star because customer service should be #1

I've been going to sushiwa for years, it is hands down some of the best sushi in town. I know this sounds sooo generic, but the fish is fresh to death. And their AYCE comes with SASHIMI. Pro tip order the screaming orgasm sashimi and use the broth as a dipping sauce!

This place is awesome!  I have been eating  here since it opened and speak with the owner frequently.  The staff has always been good, and they cater to make certain my wife and boys enjoy their dining experience.   I enjoy their specialty rolls, and especially the Superman burrito roll and 911 roll for those that love avocado. Very good sashimi with great tuna.  Try the Baha for nice yellowtail with jalape√±o, if you like a little spice.  The 911 sauce is a must for spice. The tuna poke is also very good. It can get busy, but generally service is very good and prices are reasonable.
first time here!!! Great service and they're really friendly and love this place and cant wait to be back soon!! .
Best sushi in town, can't wait to dig in!! This is the perfect spot for special occasions or just a casual night out. Kid and family friendly! Just awesome!

We want to eat some Japanese food over the weekend and search nearby and found this location.  We decided to give it a try.  The restaurant is very small with limited seating.  Luckily we are there early and able to get a seat.  We order 3 mini rolls (torch salmon, soft shell crab and spicy salmon) and a chirashi dinner.  The portion is decent and food is fresh.  After our dinner, both waiter and waitress came and ask us if we want to pay the bill now.  Maybe the restaurant seating is limited and they want us to leave asap once we are done.  While we are eating, we saw the chef came out to greet the customers.  He didn't even get a chance to come by and we left.  The chef Joesph came outside of the restaurant and ran to us and had a few chat.  I was surprised he came out.  He felt bad that we left before he can come to talk to us and was offering us ice cream next time we come back for dinner.  We will come again with the quality of food and he takes the effort to run outside of the restaurant to talk to us.

The worst!! Buyer beware!  DO NOT GET ALL YOU CAN EAT!! Service is terrible, food sucks!  Took my family there and they watch you like a hawk to see if you share.  Made us feel very uncomfortable!  Really!!i would not feed my dog the food.  DO NOT GO THERE!

This place always delivers. From the moment you walk to the food you eat, the feeling at this sushi bar is as if they were waiting for you all day. The staff is very welcoming and warm the food is very delicious and the fish is just the right temperature.

I love AYCE sushi so I came to check out their sushi. The nigiri was amazing and the restaurant decor was really nice. There was only one problem. I love AYCE sushi because I love ordering A LOT all at once and I come hungry. Throughout my meal, I was reminded over and over again that I had to finish everything to avoid getting charged extra. This was a total buzzkill. I understand the server was probably trying to help me by informing me, but after the 1st time was plenty enough. Food was great, customer service was not.

This place is on point!!! Geo was serving us and was amazing. Service, fish, and atmosphere were perfect! This reminds us that the bigger names are just fads and that we need to be supporting a crew like this. Recommend strongly if your in the area and would drive there over other sushi places any day! Mahalo to Geo and the Crew!

Sushi Wa is great if your looking for something quick and a la carte.   Pros:  - the head chef, Joseph, is always so kind to us whenever we come. He comes and greets our table, asks for our names and tries to remember them each time we come. He really is a sweetheart.  - the servers: all of the ones I've encountered are very sweet and take our order fast - appetizers: instead of the typical miso soup, you get a vermicelli noodle soup which I like - sushi: sushi is alright (7/10) for me but pretty good. Favourite rolls includes the Green Dragon and the Smoked Philadelphia Roll  - tempura: tempura is always so crispy and fresh. Love the yam one personally   Cons:  - store: the store is a little older and could use some renovations.   I will be coming back. Great service and team at sushi wa. I really recommend going if your looking on filling that sushi fix!

Great restaurant. The best sushi place in town. I usually come here 2 a month, and have always been satisfied with the food. And the fact that they give you a good small alcoholic drink. And they offer salmon belly which I absolutly love eating.

Still have the slowest service in town. They finally got nice servers crew but the cooks still need help. Usually you get your first orders pretty quick. When they magically stop working on your orders. And when they finally resume (let's say 50min after placing the order), food comes out as a mess (your "baked" roll is cold in the middle, for example). Be ready to spend an hour more here than you spend in other AYCE places... No more sushi Wa for us sadly
Very friendly service! Fresh sushi, delicious -chef puts extra seasoning on the netas and it really shows. Chef named Joseph does table checks and just goes the extra mile with everything

this was our first and last time coming here.    we had 2 servers.  the first one (tall/skinny) was nice.  the second server was shorter and NOT NICE.    i let the 2nd server know that our sprite tasted more like soda water and she said it was sprite (basically saying i was wrong) i asked for a coke instead of arguing with her about the taste.   the 1st server was nice enough to say they had to change the bag on the sprite.    we got 1 tiny serving of ginger (like 3 slivers of ginger) / wasabi for the 2 of us.  we asked the 2nd server for more ginger.  she never brought it.  we asked the 1st server for more ginger (since the 2nd one didnt bring it) - she brought it.    then they changed servers and didnt tell us so we waited forever to place another all you can eat round.    after the 1st server let us know they changed up, we decided to just order dessert and be done with the place.    1st server convinced me to get 1 banana tempura and 2 different scoops for ice cream instead of 2 banana tempura (since they use an entire banana).  ok, cool...sounds amazing.  2nd server drops of 1 banana tempura with 1 scoop of ice cream.  1st server comes back after the dessert is eaten. i let her know we didnt get what she suggested and the 2nd server didnt seem to care, come back or ask us about it.    then the owner drops off the check and asks if its ready to be picked up.  sure....   hey, thanks for asking new customers how their experience was. it was kinda crappy!      SIN CITY SUSHI - sit at the bar.  better service. better sushi. better experience.

Good sushi, however last time I was there I had a very unsavory experience. The sushi bar was full so my parents and I sat at a booth. I ordered All You Can Eat, and my parents ordered a la cart. When my food was delivered the manager set mine down on the opposite side of the table and said if I wanted to eat I would have to move so that he could see if I was "sharing". I HADEN'T EVEN TAKEN A BITE! I told him that I was happy where I was and that I would not move. He argued with me and I told him that I was a very good patron and that my family owned a business in the same complex and that I have been a regular and that I didn't appreciate being treated like a criminal. He huffed and puffed then left. Another waiter who overheard came over and apologized saying that the manager was awful and a 'dick'. I had to agree. The owner was not there that day and apparently the manager got a big head with the little responsibility. He continued to circle my table, watching me like a hawk while I finished my food. While the food was great, I couldn't enjoy it. And honestly, if I hand't been so hungry I would have gotten up and left in the beginning. My dad was fuming and disgusted and the manager. After years of going there, we haven't been back since.

this place is awesome! great food (the AYCE is among the cheapest you'll find) friendly service and I love the environment..DEF check it out!  *the honey bread is so simple yet so delicious, very good dessert
Been here 6 times.  All you can eat is worth it. The superman burrito is a must have. Even if I'm full, I still gotta have it. The Uni is hit or miss. I guess depends on the season or their supplier.

... Where to start... I first tried sushi wa based on some awesome reviews I read and really wanted to find a place in Henderson that can be my Togo place... Well when I arrived I was immediately told to try the tuna because it was fresh well this was sad because it was far from fresh so I began to try things that they didn't recommend and I ended up having a good meal the freshest fish that day was the super white tuna.. So I only killed 2 baby cockroaches on the sushi bar table that day and despite the not so fresh fish I decided to go again and take a friend the next week... Because I liked their dynamite and mussles  We had a sushi chef named waldo .. Waldo seemed to have a bad attitude and didn't like the fact that we Ordered a lot of food in fact one order he doubled the portion saying we ordered two orders instead of one which I know I wouldn't have ordered two orders ... Also I found out that they charge you if you order fresh wasabi I had it last time I was there and when I ordered it today they said there would be a charge come to find out I was charged for it last time but was not told so watch out ...  Now to the worse part of this meal there... I ordered the super white tuna and ate the first piece quickly I swallowed everything when I should have spit it out.... The fish was rank and bad and didn't even smell right I pointed this out to Waldo who smelled it and told me there was nothing wrong with it ... I asked his sushi chef friend to smell it himself and that guy said it was bad and apologized....   It's now Monday evening and I'm finally over the terrible bout of food poisoning That overtook me for the past 3 days since .. I'm finally eating solid foods rather then chicken broth and burnt toast... I never ever want this to happen again ... I believe that sushi wa does not keep fresh fish or quality control as I've read a lot more reviews about their quality issues.. Needless to say I will never eat here again nor will I recommend you eat here either I will also tell everyone I know about my ailment and 3 days of bed rest acquired from their poor quality control performance

My first visit to Sushi Wa was yesterday and the first thing I noticed when I walked in was the raw fish smell. I figured that could be normal for a sushi place?  We ordered the salmon scallop roll, philadelphia roll, and monkey brain (which was my favorite, mushroom, cream cheese and salmon).   I was suprised that although it was Weds there was no one else in the place. The decor is nice but they don't serve vodka, just wine and beer.   Would definitely return for more monkey brain!!

Awww man!!  This has been my favorite sushi joint for a year-ish!  The Japanese Lasagne is to die for.  We got the all you can eat sushi and was ignored the whole time we were there.  It was taking 20 minutes in between each order. WHA???  It wasn't even busy. The waitress was evil, she was rude and I swear she shit in my food because after I left I was sick!  I was so nice to her and tried to give her the benefit of the doubt, she had helped me two times before and it was the same story. So now, here I am venting my experience here.  WA, ditch that waitress, she's tainting your business. The runners were delightful and very sweet.   Really sucks, I would gleam over Sushi Wa but after this visit, I won't be going again :(

I will keep coming back again and again! I love this place. I recommend that you try it as well. AYCE included one order of sashimi, which most places don't do anymore. All of the rolls are fresh and the presentation is impressive. I usually order Tuna sashimi to start which is always good here, but my favorite rolls are bikini, hawaiin, mango salmon roll. I finish off with Unagi Nigiri because the sweet eel sauce tastes more like a desert to me. Sushi Wa is also on the Uber Eats list and they give you a 10% coupon for your next in restaurant visit. Perfect!
Best all you can eat ever! So much variety and options to choose from. Service was fast and very hospitable. One of my all time favorite sushi places.

Accidentally found this place when I was going to get a haircut next door.   Thought it was going to be a hole in the wall but when I walked in at 11:30 am I was taken back!  Beautiful interior and really authentic Japanese, but modern like I like it!  Very Spotless inside!  The place quickly filled up for lunch!  I started off with miso soup and a house salad!  Soup was good salad was not! Old lettuce for sure!  Then I had tuna sashimi and it was excellent!  Good Value for the amount! Usually doesn't work that way!    Proceeded onto a Veggie tempura and Salmon roll both excellent!  The  service was perfect and I liked the fact that there were real "Japanese" sushi chefs and employees, kept it authentic this way!  Whenever I come back to Vegas I will make the trip off the strip to come back!  It's only a few miles east on the 215 off Pecos Blvd.   I
Nice fresh fish, nice sized portions, friendly service, classy decor. A solid AYCE sushi spot if you live in the GV area.

Excellent food, great service, friendly owner. Slightly hidden in the Plaza. We've been here twice now and both times we have had excellent experiences. Joseph  and the main waitress are very friendly.

Unpretentious little place tucked into the north west corner of Yonge and Steeles. My review is for takeout. Friendly service and a nice treat to be served a mini crunch noodle soup and tea while I waited. Solid 3.5.  I read the scallop was awesome so had to have an order of scallop sashimi. It was delicious! Next up I loved that they offer mini rolls so that I could try a couple. I went with the torched salmon(Cinderella) and torched butterfish (Eskimo - need to find a better name for this one). The torched rolls may have been missing a touch of sauce on top of the torched fish, but they were still quite good.

Strengths: Friendly staff, nice ambience, open until 4am, spacious dining area. Great food!    Notes: I ordered pimp my roll and tonkotsu ramen. The ramen broth can be done a little creamier. Everything else was perfect. The roll was awesome!   Will go for lunch next time.ramen lunch special at $16 ramen and special roll
Great sushi, great service! We eat here allot and the sushi is always super fresh and at the perfect temperature. It truely is one of our favorite restaurants in Henderson!

Sushi WOW. This place truly lives up to the hype.  The prices are on par with other sushi joints, but the quality of the food and service are exponentially superior. After my friends and I ordered, we were given a plate of rolls on the house, which were delicious. I ordered the sushi + sashimi dinner combo. The fish was all very fresh and delicious, and presented really nicely - noticeably more so than other restaurants. Once we finished, the owner, Joseph, also gave us the VIP treatment - asked for our names and offered us ice cream (which was served with corn flakes - seriously life changing). I may have to fully commit to this place from now on... I don't think other sushi joints will do it for me anymore.  Another cute addition to this place is the place mats with sushi etiquette comic strips on them... Loved it!

This place was such an after thought I wondered if it was worth reviewing.   Two stars for being open so late, but that's the main thing it has going for it.  The beginning of April I pre ordered my role at probably 2am, and when I got there I stood there at least 5 minutes before being acknowledged.    This late at night I usually let service pass because I'm just greatful I can get food so late.  However,  the rolls are not cheap if you are doing Al la carte rather than doing all you can eat.  The fish and execution are on not high enough to merit those prices.   It seems artificially inflated to get you to choose the option of gorging yourself all night.     The roll I got was bland,  it was wrapped in cucumber, and the decorative cucumber on the side was not even cleaned. I rubbed my finger on it and dirt came off....if this is what you offer who would want all you can eat.
Great place to have all you can eat sushi. Fish was extremely fresh. Service was fast, efficient and friendly. Our waitresses was very helpful with our sushi roll selections.

Great service and the food was delicious for the price point. We came here for lunch on a Wednesday so it wasn't too busy.   When we inquired about one of the rolls, the waitress pulled out a photo album of pictures of all the different rolls so we could see what they looked like. And I liked that there wasn't a lot of rice in the rolls, compared to other restaurants.   They gave us complimentary appetizers and offered us free ice cream for dessert. When the chef/owner (Joseph) realized we worked close by, he also gave us a discount on our bill.   We would definitely come back.

What a shame..... Normally at a restaurant, either the waiter/ waitress service or the quality of the food reflect the rating on Yelp... This one is on the owner.  The Korean man/ owner was by the front door when we entered the restaurant. No greeting, just how many and lead us to table. Seems very impatient and got frustrated when I asked questions.... The most responses I got was "ask your server" Ok....  The rest of the servers were actually pretty nice and friendly.  Food taste and quality were surprising good... For AYCE sushi.   Would be a 5 stars rating if the owner weren't there to host... Sad....

I have never had sushi as unique and amazing as Sushi Wa. The owner and staff are awesome, and the AYCE idea is brilliant and a great deal. The rolls are phenomenal and the ambience is really nice for a group dinner or even a date night! TVs, bar, large dining area, everything you'd need. I have eaten sushi in pretty much every state I have been to or lived in, and I have been to the most well known and highly ranked sushi restaurants in the Bay Area as well as Southern California and Hawaii. Sushi Wa comes close or is even better than any of them. Something about the restaurant and the rolls I just really love. I hope everyone gives it a try! Great location too.

Wow. Wow. Wow... I've tried multiple sushi restaurants in California, but hands down, this place is one of the best places I've ever tried. Their fishes were fresh, tempura oil was new, and customer service was on point. If you're around this area, I highly recommend this place!!

Definitely my favorite place to eat sushi. The service is amazing when she gave us options on popular rolls when we didn't know what to order. The menu is enormous with so many options from sashimi to ramens. Everything we tried was delicious. The price was also very reasonable for all that we were offered. 27$ for all you can eat dinner is a great price.

Great little sushi place. We came in for lunch and the service and sushi was great. We both did AYCE, and the food and portions were perfect. Highly recommend the fire cracker app. The nigiri sushi was fresh and the fish was meaty and delicious. I would highly recommend for dinner or lunch as the restaurant has a great atmosphere and decor. We will being dinning here again.

Where to start?? The old, overly sticky rice? The dry rolls with no sauce? The brown avocado? The undercooked scallops that were still cold? The veggie roll that was comprised mostly of lettuce? The wasabi that was an odd color, nearly brown?   Don't understand the rave reviews, this stuff wasn't good at all. There are much, much better sushi places in Henderson people.  Two stars for the nice manager and the ambience.
Amazing food! Great service. Nice people. Try the poki salad and the screaming orgasm! Save room for the tempura ice cream!

it really is hard to find a sushi bar that pleases you in every way.  Some places have great sashimi, but so so rolls.  Some places have great rolls but horrible sides.  some places are just horrible.  Here at Sushi Wa - EVERYTHING is great - decor, service, dessert, rolls, sashimi, appetizer sides - even the water.   Though everything is great, I highly suggest:  -Screaming Orgasm - the best orgasm sauce ever!  not too sour like other places.  4 pieces of fish served atop radish noodles soaking in a bowl of their sauce.  only one per person for their AYCE dinner.  Don't think you can order one for yourself, and one for a friend, hoping that your friend won't like it, so you can have more than one.   because he will.  and so will the next friend after that.  and the next after that.   - Firecracker - a small piece of crispy wonton, a cube of tuna and a cube of avocado, drizzled in firecracker sauce - Rose Roll - baked roll with lobster, scallops, mushrooms, onions - Who's Your Daddy - cream cheese and crab meat and sweet mayo and shrimp and it's deep fried in panko and crispy - Ahi Poke Salad - a little spice by thats ok.  mixed with seaweed salad.    all in all, my sushi palette has never tasted sushi this good.

Aloha,    I'm from Hawaii and I eat sushi all over Vegas.  This place by far is the worst place ever and I'll NEVER go back!!!  We ordered all u can eat.   Our server was Hayley, after we ordered our first items, we tried to get her attention to order more items. We didn't place our 2nd order for almost 30 minutes.    If we're ordering all u can eat, you would think she would be at the table more often.  They have no team work.  We asked 2 other servers there to order something, even a drink and they all told us that only our server could get it.  If I was the owner, they would all be fired.   It's called team work.   Help each other out.  After we were done, we had to ask for the bill cause no one seen to check if we were done.  Tables around us got their bill. before us and they didn't seat till after us. Smh.  Never again.   I will let people know that this place sucked!!   We had a piece of hair in our mussel and no manager came by to apologize.  We don't want nothing for free but as a owner/manager they need to go to school and take up business.
I've had sushi all over the country. This is the best I have ever had. Perfect texture and presentation. A+++

What an awful experience this evening. We hardly ever go out to eat with our kids and we decided to treat them to sushi. This is their favorite place. Well I guess tonight was just "too busy" for good service. Our server was nice but I think she might have had to many tables. She rarely came back to ask how we were doing. When we wanted to order she told us to wait until our other 2 rolls were out so when she finally allowed us to order we sat for 25 min waiting for our food. We also asked if we could have a poki roll with only crab meat and avacodo and the manager said the were not taking special orders because they were again "too busy" I should take a picture but it's really not that busy. Haven't even had a wait for the hour and a half we have been here. To say the least we will not be returning. I feel like for $150 we should be able to order what we want. But obviously at sushi wa they don't care.

Went here with my little family of 3!   The look of the restaurant was very clean with a modern look. The decor reminded me of a restaurant on the strip.  I did the AYCE and my husband and 1 year old daughter shared chicken teriyaki.  My husband thought the chicken teriyaki was alright.  I always order nigiri sushi. Hamachi, my fav, is very fresh and good here! So is the tuna! The sweet shrimp is one of the best I've had!  Although the sushi was great, the service is slow. The service is friendly, just really slow.  Don't do AYCE at the booth because the service is slow for that, so sit at the bar. I don't recommend to bring your kids here at night because there is a pub right next door. Outside of the pub there is an outdoor seating area. I didn't like walking out at night into crowds of smokers with my kid.  I would love to come here again with just my husband. I would come here during the day with my family. My husband is not a sushi person, so it'll be awhile till we come back.  It wasn't bad for our first time. I just wish the service for me was quicker.

4.5  Pros: Very good sushi Friendly staff  Cons: Sushi portions could be better  Came here for a lunch one afternoon.  This is another one of those places where I have Yelp to thank for finding it.    Walking in, I notice the place looks much bigger on the outside than inside.  There's basically 5-6 tables here, that's it.  I'm guessing a lot of their business comes from people ordering to go.  We came at the start of lunch time so it wasn't too busy.  When we were finishing up though, all the tables were taken.  I take it when it's busy, you're better off getting take out.  Sushi Wa has a wide variety of sushi with some Korean items as well.  The owner is Korean so there are some Korean restaurant trends present here as well.  You get some free appetizers when you dine in like most Korean restaurants.  For any sushi newbies, they have a menu that has pictures of every item on the menu.  Pretty useful for newbies and anyone looking to try something new as well.  My GF and I both ordered lunch time bento specials.  I got the bulgogi and she got the Sushi bento.  I ordered an extra spicy salmon roll as well.  The bentos come out pretty quickly after ordering.  Overall, the bentos are really well done.  The sushi tastes pretty good and the bulgogi was cooked very well too.  My only little gripe is the fish portion on the sushi was a little on the thin side.  Bearing in mind that the prices are pretty good here, it's nothing too big  The service here is excellent.  The waitress was very attentive and patient through out our meal here.  Joseph, the owner is one of the most friendly owners I have ever met.  He introduced himself halfway through our meal.  He wanted to know our names and wrote them down promising to remember them if we came back.  It was very nice to have chat with him.  We were told if anything was wrong, he would fix it personally.  Overall, I really like this place.  It's a great choice for a comfortable, relaxing meal.

Amazing quality! Great servers, very respectful, and the sushi cooks are great at what they do. It may seem small on the outside, but the heart is what counts. Definitely worth a try if anything else.

My favorite sushi place by far. Even the fancy sushi places on the strip don't compare. High quality sushi and you get your money's worth especially with AYCE. Recommend the Rose Roll. Also the peppered seared baby tuna and white tuna sushi is amazing. Can't find a white tuna that compares in any sushi restaurant I've been to.

Did a quick search of sushi in the area and found this gem. Arrived at 8pm and the place was still packed with happy customers. We ordered five sets of mini rolls between the two of us and it was quite filling. The complimentary dishes from the chef was very nice. The mango avocado roll was super refreshing. Ordered mini Eel Green, Pacific, Lion King, Rainbow, and Salmon Lover. Recommend Lion King and Pacific. The restaurant has around 8-9 tables. The place is cozy and staff was kind and attentive and the food is tasty.

Not only was the service bad today more because of understaffed, but the chefs, which there were 3 were soo slow.  It took over an hour to get a California Roll and a cucumber roll.  Be prepared to spend 2 hours here minimum as most of the time will be waiting for your order.

Sushi flavours are amazing, the fish is always fresh here. One big plus is that you can really see the owner putting in a ton of effort into his small (but cute) sushi place. I basically eat sushi here more than any other place now, and the prices are really fair. :) Check it out, you won't regret!

Giving three stars because the server was nice. Except there was only one of him and the place was busy. They should consider having atleast 2 servers because getting something as simple as water took forever.  I've had better sushi, and I find the price for the quality not worth it.
Most of the sushi is good, but I can't stand the taste of the propane gas torch that is used to sear the tuna. Yuck,

So this place was recommended to me awhile ago and i am not sure what took us so long to try it but we are so happy we did!  The food is great, truly. Fresh fish that makes you forget you live in a desert. But what really stood out here was service. Everyone made eye contact and smiled and they all worked together as a team and never made you feel like "oh you're not in my section let me go get your server..." (I hate that by the way) and instead, you leave feeling like you had ten servers, all of whom were nice, friendly, knowledgable and accommodating.   There was one young man who chatted with us for so long happily answering all of my questions, seeming excited at the chance to educate us. Haha.   Try the baked mussels appetizer, the himachi, octopus, any signature roll, a seaweed salad, and a bottle of the strawberry sake with some fried ice cream... I know its a lot, but you won't regret it as it is all so worth it!

Attention to detail in everything - freshness, quality and taste (outstanding!), presentation, service - well-deserving of its top reputation in the community.  Subdued with all cozy semi-private seating, centrally located at the intersection of Steeles & Bathurst with lots of free parking.
Great food, excellent service in a nice cozy atmosphere.

"Wa-Wa" (sound of failure).  Sushi wa-da-fa!?!  I got held hostage by a sushi bar!!! and not in a good way!  I came here with good intentions - going to Terri K's first UYE, sitting in the "bamboo jail" table with 12 other awesome yelpers and yelper friends, eating raw fish galore.  However, it did not turn out that way.  We came early (6 PM reservation) but could not leave until after 9:30 PM.  The only reason this gets one star from the restaurant side of things is that our bus boy was awesome.  He was polite, refilled drinks super fast, and cleared empty plates like Flash.  The service was deplorable.  We really only had one waiter, and he only liked one half of the table.  That half happened to include a lot of people that speak his language, so he spent all of his time taking their large orders and giving them food.  These are all my yelp friends, and I am glad I got to be with them, but the server only waited on them essentially.  When it came to our table, he never gave us what we ordered - 30 minutes passed and we had never received items, whereas our companions on the other side got several orders in and food was coming out in group portions.    The waiter argued with me after I asked 3 times for my mackerel sushi, one of the 3 things I ordered...after waiting 30+ minutes - he finally said he already brought it to the table (but it was someone else's order) and said I never ordered it.  After I asked for it 3 more times, couldn't he just put in another order?!  When I asked him a question about an item, he answered and ran off before I could order food.  I never got to order more than once, and most people on my side of the table had to re-order food or wait forever to order.  If only we spoke Korean!  The payment was a disaster too.  We asked for separate checks (for parties of one or 2 - we all did AYCE so it was same price all around) and we asked before we ordered and again before we asked for the check.  We were refused.  Our waiter gave attitude to Bobby Y. when he brought our credit cards and cash that added up exactly to the bill with gratuity.  Another waiter came over and Jieun spoke Korean with him - he said if he rings all of the cards up, he cannot put in any orders for other guests and they are BUSY (well, we were already there 3 hours hello!) so it would take him awhile.  Instead of going to start ringing our cards up though, he stood there and kept repeating the issues with their system - so I told him to go do it already!    It was an igloo in there - when Eric R. asked for them to turn the a/c up, I think that caused our waiter to hate us.  I had to borrow Nelson Q.'s jacket to survive the hours of hell.  I finally went to our car and put the heat on for 10 minutes.  The only reason I ate enough was that Jane shared some of the food from her side of the table with me, very generously (amaebi, ikura, saba, oysters) - because I never got my full and only order from the 6:15PMish range.  The upside -hanging with great people and meeting new people (Jane, Maria).  The envy - Terri K. bolting after convincing jerk waiter to give her a separate bill.  The downside - Wa still has a sticker on its door saying "People love us on yelp."  I call BS on that!
Awesome all you can eat sushi place. They have so many special roles that are not available anywhere else. And their drink menu is awesome!

Very very disappoint for a few different reasons. THIS PLACE DOES NOT DESERVE 5 STARS. In my opinion, maybe 2 or 2.5 at its best. I still have no idea how this place is able to maintain a 5 star rating on Yelp AND Google??!!  There is absolutely nothing special or stand out about this place - decor, ambience, kitchen, menu selection.   The only thing which was good, was the sushi chef, Joseph, greeted us after we paid the bill and took the time to talk to us and walk us out of the restaurant.  Menu - only regular buffet type of fish available  Was super disappointed as soon as I glanced at the menu, spent 10 minutes trying to figure out what I was going to order.. when I visit a 5 star a la carte jap restaurant, I expect more then just tuna, cooked shrimp, salmon, and white tuna on the menu..  30 pcs Sashimi boat was $30, pretty thinly sliced.. sake (salmon) sashimi was b grade, maguro (tuna) was also b grade.. cooked Ebi (shrimp) was from a vacuum pack..  I don't speak Japanese, but I tried to order some items using Japanese terms, waitress was clueless and needed me to order in English..  Seafood Udon had 2 over cooked chewy shrimp, 1 mussel, and 3 pcs of overcooked chewy squid.. udon was al Dante, soup base was legit..  Tempura Udon had 2 pcs of shrimp which was thick in batter and not crispy. 3 pcs of veggie tempura, the ponzu sauce came in a tea cup!? How are you supposed to sip your tempura into the tea cup!?  Rainbow Roll wasn't cut through all the way.. had to pull it apart with chopsticks and therefore started falling apart.. what Japanese chef doesn't keep their knife sharp?!  Ordered 2 cans of beer, the glasses had fingerprints and left over bits of something in the cup - so nasty!!  Billed with $100 plus tip..  This place was a complete waste of my time and meal!!

One of the better ones in the area. Food was really good. We ordered the roll special (the combination of regular/special) for roughly $15 and it was plentiful. Also had a few sashimi that were great. I was disappointed that they ran out of my go-to fish: tuna belly.   For those complaining about the prices. There's free appetizers than can easily cost you $5 at least. Free parking in the complex, so that's another bonus.   In any case, it is definitely worth it, especially if you are in the area.

Ok maybe its a bad night. The sauteed calamari smelled like fish out of lake mead, we've been here for over an hour and a half and there's only 2 of us here and the las Vegas roll is as big as an onion ring. Seriously?

5* for what it is, a neighbourhood sushi joint that serves up better-than-average sushi that does put effort into presentation/service.  Atmosphere:  Restaurant itself is quite small and a bit squishy.  There are only about 8 tables and 2 seats at the "sushi bar".  If you're waiting for a seat, the front waiting area is tight.  If you're sitting in a booth, you'll have to physically shift the table in order to be able to sit on the bench.  Small restaurant was busy on a Friday night for dinner.  I'd suggest  you make a reservation to ensure that you get a seat!  Service:  A bit slow, but adequate by the waitress.  She actually didn't have to write our order down and it was accurate!  I was impressed.  At the end of our meal, Joseph, a middle aged man who I assume to be the owner came to our table and offered us ice cream "on the house".  He even asked for our names.    Food:  We ordered an array of items from maki, aburi nigiri, sashimi.  Combos did come with salad & miso soup.  Additional edamame and crunchy noodle soup was complimentary as well.  Sushi was fresh and there was attention to presentation.  Everything was good!  It wasn't a place with a lot of sauces.     As we left, Joseph came and bowed to us, physically opening the doors.  He seemed very sweet and cared about our patronage which did enhance my experience with this place.

This place is so cute! A hidden gem for sure. Everyone from the chefs to the host are genuine and polite. Four stars for now as I'm writing this while awaiting to try their menu items! Loving the experience thus far!

New favorite all you can eat in town. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Thi and Joon and Celeste were amazing. Quick seating, wait time fair for everything and just super amazing food options. Banana tempura was delicious!!! Must try and it's definitely a cozy place to talk and just hang out. Try their sake sangria and Bohae raspberry wine!
Best sushi place in town! Always good service and the most amazing food! It's a little pricy but definitely worth every penny!
This place is soooo good. I love the ambiance and decor. Great selection and price. You cannot beat the all you can eat for lunch price!!!
Outstanding place. Staff is very friendly and fast! Atmosphere is nice and relaxing. Come check this place out

Great place to dine.  I love the menu selection and food.  I find the chef too humbling but an awesome person. They offer edamame beans and a small hot noodle appetizer before the meal. He comes by to see how you're doing as well.  Def would return. Try the aburi torched sushi!

This is more than likely my favorite place for Sushi in all of Henderson.  I really like the set up its not a huge place but the use the space well.  I have been here at least 5 times and have done both bar seating as well as one of the many booths.  I always get AYCE because it is a fantastic value.  The ambience is good too, I used to dine at Sushi Mon but it has a more of a banquent feel to it.  Our waiter was pretty quick and attentive as well( he did forget an order of soup) but he was good enough for us to not really care.  If you are looking to try one of the many Sushi spots on eastern.....this is a must try.

We used to love this place..  Got taken care of by this server Mark. (Barely checked on us) All I can say is TOO MUCH RICE. The portion of the rice is more than the portion of the fish.  Fish quality, awesome!   We used to come to this place all the time. Used to brag about this place to all my friends. Now, I cant.. I seriously can't anymore. When we brought to the manager's attention that the rice portion was ridiculous (now I wish I could have taken a picture of it) he was totally cool about it and told us they'll fix it but the server came up all irritated and told us they can't tolerate it and will have to charge us next time we can't finish the rice. Server barely checked on us, it was mainly the manager. Server didn't smile for the most part.  Just super disappointed. We thought so highly of this place before & loved it so much that no matter how long the drive was,  we would go for the overall quality of the restaurant.. heartbroken Still tipped them good ;) cause it wasn't all bad. Manager was very personable :)

My fianc√© and I visit sushi wa at least 3-4 times a month and we love it! By far the freshest sushi I have ever had! Everything is delicious especially the peppered seared tuna and the salmon nigiri! The baked salmon roll is creamy and delicious as well.   Sit at the sushi bar, order a cocktail, and enjoy the all you can eat!

This place was okay. I came here with my friend and we sat at the bar. We ordered a couple rolls and I asked for no avocado on mine. An order comes and I start eating it but it tastes nothing like what I ordered. So I let my friend have some. Then two orders came. One was the one I ordered and the other was what she ordered. Mine was loaded with avocado and hers had completely none! The taste was pretty good, nothing too special. But service sucked..

Love this place! The owner, Joseph, makes an effort to get to know his customers at the end of their meals. And he definitely remembers his repeat customers. If you are lucky, he will also treat you to a small appetizer dish or dessert "on the house". The Spicy Roll combo is my personal favourite.

One of the best Japanese food in the GTA!! They serve authentic food with fresh ingredients, the chefs are Japanese as well. The price is very reasonable for the food quality. I want to recommend everything on their menu! Love this place so much. Will definitely come back again.

Absolutely LOVE Sushi Wa! We have been coming here since it opened and won't go anywhere else for sushi. The fish is flown in daily, and is always fresh. My favorite rolls are the Lava Roll (super fresh upgraded version of a rainbow), Bikini Roll (no rice, lots of fish), and Timmy Roll (soft shell crab and salmon). Also try the Pimp My Roll! It gets crowded on Friday nights, so make sure to come in early for faster service! Service is excellent, they always remember our special rolls and drinks.

I had my meetup group event there last night. They have some great quality of food. Staff there are so nice and kind too. Manager Gio, was really fast with service he knows what he's doing.  Owner Joon was really kind and nice too.  I liked their Sweet Shrimp Sushi. I've never seen shrimp that big in AYCE places. Impressed! And of course everything else was really good too.  And one more thing I like about this place was the interior. They have some good interior there. I heard this place is about 10 years old but place looks really clean and nice. I thought they just opened up or something. Really good place to have nice sushi night with either family or group of people. Even good for by yourself at the Bar. They have some really friendly sushimans ;P I will come out and have another event there! Really nice place!

My husband and I have been coming here for sushi for many years, as a matter of fact, this is the only place we will go to when we want to have sushi. The food here is exceptional, all of it! The sushi chefs are great! The only downer here, and keep in mind we come here often and this has occured a lot lately, the service is not the best. We noticed that if you sit at the bar this is not an issue but if you sit at a table, forget about it. Our last visit was the tipping point, waited for ten minutes and nobody approached us to order or even ask for our drink order. The guy who seated us passed by and we had to flag him and ask if we could order, he signaled to a lady and said she would take our order....well we waited and waited and she didn't even acknowledged us. Well he came back with his note pad and asked if we would be doing all you can eat. After ordering my appetizer and some sushi, the sushi arrived first and no sign of my appetizer? Asked the waiter and he was was like "oh yes" and went to the back and then brought it to us. Best advice, just eat at the bar.  Update: we came here again and sat at the bar this time. Everything was excellent!

I believe this place used to be called Asahi Sushi for the longest time. I was walking my dog in the area and was kind of surprised to see the exterior change and also the name change too, so I decided to definitely try this place sometime later on...when I wasn`t walking my dog. It was always in the back of my mind whenever I was in this plaza (same plaza as Freshco) but I never got a chance to try it.  I finally decided to come here for lunch. It was around noon and I think we were the only guests at the time. I found this place very small and cramped for each table. When we were shown to our table, I was trying to wrap my head around how we were supposed to enter our booth (the table is very long and blocks off the entry to the seats). The waitress had to physically move the table sharply off to one side to let each of us enter to our seats. This is one thing I found uncomfortable about my dining experience while I was here. Even stick thin people cannot enter the booth without moving the table...That is how cramped it was. We also had to physically move the table to free ourselves out of the booth after paying the bill lol.  I had a look at the menu, and we were also given a photobook of their menu items which is something I haven`t seen at any sushi places before, which is nice. I noticed they also do some korean dishes (not officially on their main menu). So, I ordered the lunch special roll set. It was a pretty good deal. I got to choose a special roll (8pcs) and a mono roll (6 pcs) for 12.50$ which also comes with soup and salad (but is not mentioned on the menu). Really good value for the amount of good sushi. I was surprised when the waitress came to our table and also served us come complimentary appetizers before we started our lunch. It was really nice of them. When my order arrived I really thought the presentation was cute. The sushi tasted really fresh and good. The special roll I ordered was not cut up evenly, some pieces were larger than others making it slightly difficult to put into my mouth, but for the most part was manageable.  What really stood out in this place I think was the really courteous service. I also thought it was really nice of the sushi chef to come by and ask us how our meal was.

The best sushi experience ever!  Unlimited high quality sushi that just kept flowing.  Servers worked as a team.  A plate never sat.  Our drinks never empty.  The atmosphere is perfect!  Don't pass on this one.  I'll be back in a few weeks.

Food was very reasonably priced and the service was great! I like how you can order mini versions of the rolls, 5 pieces instead of 8. This way you can try a variety of different things. The takoyaki and sushi pizza were really good. They also gave us some free appetizers which was very kind.

Freeessssh sushi and the prices are good as well! Must try for every sushi lover out there! I tried the Rainbow sushi and Salmon lover sushi, loved them both! ((: I also tried their takoyaki, alsoo delicious! ((:

We love sushi. We HATE Sushi Wa. We decided to try a new sushi restaurant and regret it. First their sushi wasn't good. Their sauces were bland. Second. And this is a HUGE SECOND.. The staff is awful.  The guy we got must of been in a badass mood or just has had a bad attitude.  The whole experience here was bad. We will definitely never come back. Go somewhere else for AYCE sushi, seriously.

About a year ago, the boyfriend and I went in to SushiWa and immediately walked out when we saw not one single customer inside.   A year later, it seems like SushiWa is what everyone talks about if you live in the 89052 area code.  We finally gave it a try yesterday, and I was reasonably pleased.   The decor inside is very modern and roomy.  Not like your typical AYCE joints in town - where you can reach over to the table next to you with your chopsticks to try out their dishes.    Their menus cover your basics but with a little more.  This AYCE actually gives you sashimi (one order per person).  That was pleasantly surprising.  We then ordered our usual sushi and rolls.    The fish is VERY fresh.  The boyfriend claims that the super white tuna there is by far the best he has had, even better than the ones in California.  I must say that the freshness of the fish is comparable to the freshness of the ones in Hong Kong, so that's saying a lot.    The sushi was made of little rice and a big chuck of fish - just the way I like them.  The rolls were somewhat difference because they were cut very thinly.  Must try the super spider roll made with soft shell crab and shrimp tempura - yummy!   Their fresh oysters are also very delicious, but also one order per person - boo.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience at SushiWa and will definitely return since it is so close to my house.  Another nice thing about it is that there is no wait.  AYCE sushi joints usually have at least a 30 minute wait, and it is just plain ol' obnoxious.    Aside from the thin rolls, this place lost a star because of its strict rules about how many order per person.  By the time we had our third rounds of orders, I was getting so frustrated about what we had already order or what we can't order.  But it is what it is!  Oh, our server, Monica, was a sweetheart.  However, you guys must be mindful that this restaurant is owned and run by Koreans, so it is not your typical/ordinary Japanese place.    Lastly, this place plays awesome music!  Fresh fish, great service, awesome music!  You should be sold by now.    Enjoy!

Lunch special is awesome. 1/2 price on many of the sushi items during lunch.  My recommendations are the ultimate salmon lover's roll, pocky roll, spider roll, and the 911 roll. The 911 came with this really good spicy sauce. It didn't taste like ponzu but it was just as spicy.  The service was friendly and good. They brought every roll that we asked for and filled our drinks whenever they were low.  The ambiance and decor was really nice.  I think you can purchase your own chopsticks and they keep it there for you.

Highly recommend the seafood udon! Full of rich ingredients, very generous portion of seafood. Sushi is nothing out of the ordinary but very good for the price you're paying! I agree that the service puts them up to a 5 star rating for sure! Owner and sushi chef Joseph made it a point to come by each table and introduce himself and get our names! Give us a very homey feeling!

Went and tried out this place today and it was awesome :) waiter was nice and very fast. Didn't take long to get food. Bill was 60$ for all you can eat both plus a tea. Not too bad for a date night. And definitely got money's worth!!!!

This used to be my go to sushi spot, but the service has gone so down hill that I won't be coming back here. I guess that's what you get when you add nepotism to a restaurant. You get somebody who doesn't really care about the service twice in a row I have eaten here when there was literally no tables other than me and waited more than 20 minutes for a single roll there are too many sushi places around to waste your time with this place

Can we give this place a negative star??? The food is good but the service SUCKED bad! We only received half our order and I took literally 35mins for the first roll to hit the table, there was only like 8 tables being used so it was not busy at all. All and all I'm never coming here again.
Came back for more! Again-great service and fresh and interesting sushi! Tried the Ramen tonight along with the baked mussels and both were excellent!
Best sushi in town hands down. Joon thanks for everything!!! I've lived in San Diego for almost two years now and I still crave sushi wa. Fresh and delicious every time !

Mixed feelings towards this place.. I had come here for dinner around 5pm on a Wednesday evening, and I had all you can eat sushi.  The pros of this place is the service and cleanliness! Especially from our specific bus person - a tall lanky fella - who I didn't get to catch the name of, but he definitely was on top of asking if we'd like any plates out of the way and our drinks were always refilled constantly.   Now for the cons which really had to be brought up.. The food quality.  Now I'd understand if it was really busy (which it wasn't whatsoever), but the sushi rolls seemed like it was meh. 6-7/10. Example: The rolls ordered that had unagi (fresh water eel) on top had tiny burnt pieces of eel on top. And the nigiri I had ordered always had a fat piece of rice under the fish.   Now for my lady's bento box she ordered.  She decided to go with the teriyaki beef bento, And it came with everything any other bento box would come with (vegetable tempura, 1/2 roll of California roll, house salad) and it wasn't anything special. Yet it came out to $16.. Definitely not worth it as much.  Sadly I wish I captured photos but I didn't get to..   Overall this restaurant ambience was nice. Dimly lit, and decorated nicely. Nothing bad to say about the servers or restaurant itself.  A good date night for anybody craving sushi in general. DISCLAIMER: *I'm just nit-picky about my sushi quality after going to so many ayce sushi spots* lol.   Thanks Sushi Wa.
This place is the best.  The pepper seared tuna sashimi is the most delicious food i have ever tried. The all you can eat is a great value with 90% of the menu avaliable.
First time here.. the monkey brain is delicious.. the pork belly is deep fried a little weird for me.. the baked green mussels are amazing.. definitely worth a second order
best sushi I ever had! great service along with a wide selection of excellent sushi. little unknown gem - try the tempura fried shrimp heads (not on menu).

This is my second time eating here,it's very good place for me because I get off the work really late at work...so I am so happy they open till to 4am.last time I order spicy Korean ramen and tuna poke ,tasty very good and tonight I will try something else..

The food here was amazing, I love that the special rolls come in mini size. I was able to buy multiple rolls and try them all.   Presentation was beautiful, taste was amazing.   The customer service was amazing, the chef came out and asked us how our meals were and even offered us free ice cream.  I totally recommend this place. And would definitely come back.
Good food, great service with good price. We ordered Chirashi and sushi bento which taste very good. Will definitely come back again.

WA WA WA.  Yep, every time I passed Sushi Wa, I promised myself I would never eat there.  Why?  Because I had eaten there for lunch one day with the wife and mother in law.  I found the food was average at best.  However, one of my kids friends from 808 said that this was one of his fav places so I said, okay what the heck....  So, on a Saturday night about 8:30 pm, I came here with my young son who has never had real sushi before, only the western style sushi...  a.  Ambiance - We sat at the bar, which I never do due to larger crowds and we want to have conversation.  The bar is the best place here to sit. Everywhere else seems a bit too "cold".  but the bar is really simple and comforting at same time.   b.  Service - Very, very good.  Attentive to our needs, mostly Korean speaking, but basic Japanese words are discussed.  Small amounts of rice, that is cool!  c.  Food - here is where it is amazing:  a. Tobico - Flying Fish Roe with squid ink to a black caviar style look.  what a cool dish. Tasty and unique.  b. Amai Ebi - Here the sweet shrimp was perfect and the fried shrimp heads were suckilicious.  Meaning I  was sucking and chewing on these fried heads like it was fried chicken!  Yummy.  c.  Maguro - I always ask for Maguro with a sliver of lemon and jalapeno I did not get this here when I ordered it. Instead of a sliver of lemon, with the rind and all, I got a peeled lemon with the meat only and sprinkled with shavings of jalapeno.  this was AMAZING  d.  Uni - Fresh, awesome texture.  My young son ate it too!  That says it all.  e. Breakdown - OK, broke down and had a Dragon Roll, the quintessential westernized plan for sushi.  even this was good and I was most impressed.  This place is my newest and most favorite sushi place in the 89052 area code.

I come often for lunch. The staff, especially the owner, Joseph, are very pleasant. Always a very positive vibe in this place.   And the quality of food is definitely better than I'd expect for the price. In fact, downtown I bet a lot of people have paid twice as much for lower quality.   I keep meaning to try the sashimi, but almost always end up having sushi bento and tempura. Not much of a roll person myself, but like the sweet potato roll.  When I want to stay close to home, I probably won't go anywhere else for sushi.

This is now one of my favourite sushi restaurants uptown - service is impeccable and the staff are very attentive. Someone who I presume is the owner walks us out and holds the door open every time when we are ready to leave, even if we are just ordering takeout. He even puts in the effort to recognize all returning customers and calls us by name if he remembers it. After only ordering takeout twice, he said "Welcome back!" which pleasantly surprised us. We have since been back quite a few times over a short period of time for both take-out and dine-in.   Most Japanese restaurants uptown serve a soup and salad as an appetizer - here they serve a salad and a small bowl of noodles which is quite unique. The food is excellent and the sushi rice has the perfect balance without being overly acidic. The rolls are assembled very well with the perfect amount of pressure being applied - made evident as the rice still holds its shape without being overly compressed. The fish is as fresh as they come in that area and they don't serve uni when it is off-season. As disappointed as I was to not have uni, I highly respect their decision because it speaks to their quality of standards.   The only criticism I have is for the booth seatings by the window. The rectangular tables are a little oversized for the booth which makes getting in and out quite difficult. But this is highly forgivable as the  sushi is so so good.   I highly recommend this sushi restaurant to both those who are or are not in the area - this place is worth the drive and is very budget-friendly for high quality sushi. Service is second to none.
Ponzu everything. Rude staff. Warm, unmanageable rice. Waste of money.  Will not be back

Not exactly sure where the 4 stars rating came from.  My husband and I dined here for lunch and was far from impressed.  We started with hamachi, ahi and salmon nigiri.  Was that really sushi grade? All 3 taste nothing like what it's suppose to and left our mouths with the worse metallic after taste. Sushi rolls and appetizers have zero flavor and they love to serve things one at a time with a 5-8 minute wait time in between each entree as well as use tons or rice to get us full much faster.  As for the service, the lady at the door wasn't very pleasant but our server was nice.  Doubt we'll ever come back.  Goyemon seems to be at the top of our list and the best ayce sushi restaurant by far.

Tiny little spot near Bathurst and Steeles that is just bursting with flavour! My friend and I went here on a Saturday evening for lunch and were seated right away.   The good and bad:  Good: - Joseph the sushi chef was incredibly kind and likes others mentioned came out chatted with us and gave us free dessert. Such a kind man, VIP treatment indeed! - servers are super attentive! - food is fresh and absolutely delicious - it's a family run business and you can tell the food is made with love - rolls are incredibly massive and stuffed generously - pricing is similar to other sushi restaurants  Bad: - tiny amount of seating, had we cone later we wouldn't have gotten seats. - the decor could use some sprucing up.   I would definitely trek it out again, and maybe this time make reservations.

Warm and cozy sushi shop. My family and I came here on Family Day and it was a great experience. The fish were extremely fresh and tasty. We had the Family Boat and it was amazing. We were also treated with tako yaki, fried oysters, some kind of vegetable mango sauce wrap, and other wonderful dishes.  The chef/owner was really nice and friendly and the interior was clean. Overall, great experience and looking forward to coming back
best sushi in the area. They actually have real wasabi here if you ask for it. The Henderson Roll rocks too, love the sauce on that one.
Exceptional service from Joseph and the staff at Sushi Wa. We got 2 medium sushi boat and that filled all of us. The surprise apps and deserts were a delight. Best sushi restaurant I've been to.

You know the dining experience at Sushi WA has always been hit or miss.  Today's lunch is definately a miss.  They served me bad fish.  I sent it back  just to let them know since it was AYCE so the price doesn't change.  The Chef tried to convince me it was Hamachi belly.  He backed off when I told him truthfully that I eat sushi weekly.  Even if it was Hamachi belly, it should be fresh.  It tasted sour and has obviously been sitting around.  They said they would give me another part of the fish.  I asked for Hamachi from another fish.  I didn't get any.  I didn't get much service either.  One of the chefs perfunctorily asked how everything was.  I began to complain and he shut me down and ignored me.  What is the point of asking?  To add insult to injury, I waited for a long time for my check to be processed.  I asked about it and the waitress rudely said that their machine was offline and that I'd have to wait.  Well, wouldn't it have been nice if somebody let me know they are having tech difficulties instead of letting me sit there and stew?  No attempt at service recovery was made.

Sushi Wa is Awesome I come every week for lunch  the Lunchbox Special with my 80 year old mother and She Loves It!! Fish is Fresh!! Real Crab Meat And The Ginger is  fresh ( Not Pink in a jar!!) I highly recommend this restaurant it is extremely reasonable and not too pricey!!

What a wonderful break from the heat. The atmosphere is very cool and serene and clean. The service is excellent. The food is superb. I had a great time I would definitely recommend it this is one of my go to local favorites

Mmmm. yum. even for the veggi... The all you can eat menu for lunch is a GREAT deal. I recommend going at odd hours, like after 1:30p for lunch and after 7:30pm for dinner. If you go during peak hours the quality of the preparation is a little limited, but not enough to lose some stars. Love the Vegetarian (requested) bikini roll!!!

This is a really nice sushi restaurant. It's unassuming from the outside - just tucked into a strip mall - and the interior furnishings, while comfortable, aren't anything to write home about (they also play top 40 on the radio, which was a bit strange). But the food and the service are both fabulous. We started with some edamame and a seaweed salad, which were both tasty. Then we split five specialty rolls among the four of us (which was actually too much food - I'd recommend just one roll per person, since they're large). All of the sushi was delicious - as well as beautifully styled. Plus, at the end of the meal, the sweet sushi chef Joseph came out to chat with us. Overall we had a great experience - highly recommend.

I still continue to go here, going anywhere else ends in disappointment, of all the many places I have been in Las Vegas the fish here is always fresh and the staff is always top notch Gio the manager is awesome and always has my favorite drink and seat ready and waiting for me.  If you like fresh sushi at a VERY reasonable price this should be your spot!!  $22 for all you can eat  lunch and $27 for dinner is CHEAP considering the quality and service you get here!
Such a awesome sushi place!! Sushi is fresh with great portions! Decent prices and a very clean and modern atmosphere ! The staff is nice and very efficient! Will for sure  be going back :)

With all you can eat restaurant, service is pretty important. More so than other regular ala carte restaurants since you want to order more as you go. Service was really slow since there was only one server. Not sure why there is only one server working since they were pretty busy. Also, their menu was so confusing. Why not have one menu for ala carte and a different menu for All u can eat? Also, so many confusing restrictions on one order per person on sashimi, mochi, etc. Id rather go to other AycE sushi places like Kaizen or Umiya etc.

My go to sushi spot, especially for AYCE! The Hawaiian Roll is UNREAL! It is literally my favorite roll of all time and any sushi restaurant I have ever been to! June and his team make great food and are friendly faces who take good care of everyone. We also love their deep fried banana and ice cream desert to finish off our meals!

SUSHI Waa--heres my order?   Sushi wa-s the server ever gonna take an order?  Sushi wa-it.   Sushi wa-tttt theee FUCK?!  Im sitting in "bamboo jail" as I write with all the Yelpers here for a UYE. We started at 6pm, it is now 8:50pm as I start this review and we are sitting waiting on them transacting everyone out.  Food is still decent, however service is rude and inefficient from our main server. One half of the table was getting service and the other half where I was sitting was kinda ignored a lot more, waited more to put orders, etc. He'd take their order, leave, come back with something for them and then we would have to try to flag him. We'd wave him, he'd say he'll be back and doesn't come back to us or he would walk passed us like we didn't wave at all. A few people had lost orders and instead of saying something kind like "sorry, let me go check on that and get it out"....it's more of remarks like we never put the order, you got it (no someone else got it) ,etc. One of our Yelpers asked three times to get her first order when the other side already on their 2nd round of orders.   I was gonna do 3 stars but now with tge transactions, I'm miffed. First, they wont split the bill and kinda told us we had to just deal with it because they're busy.  We computed what we all owe and wrote in the back which cards to charge what. Now something with POS being the only one for orders and transactions so they don't want to back up orders by transacting all us out so they'll transact when orders aren't coming in. We had a Korean speaking Yelper go talk to him and he was rude about it so she went to talk to the manager who said he will do it in a bit. We had to wait for him and explain everything. It took like 20 minutes of discussing things and explaining how we wrote down what before they went to the back to start. We have no choice but to wait. I'm sorry, but one thing I learned about restaurant hospitality that turnover is important because waiting for a check lowers the impression farther than waiting a bit for good food. People are done and want to just go. We finally got our receipts back and......  they charge my credit card for two drinks and two AYCE.   We wrote everything down clearly on the back on to receipt. We put the last 4 digits of each card to identify them and what amount to charge to each card. HOW is that NOT clear enough? They charged me for someone else.   Okay, so basically then they should give me some cash back then bring back the cash people some change. Well, first time they not only gave me less than what I was owed, but also no change for people with cash. They finally gave it and we left at 9:40pm.  50 minutes to transact is pretty crazy long.   I know it's easy to say that well, it's a pretty a-typical effed up situation. That maybe with the busy place and a waitstaff that doesn't micromanage it well it went down south fast. However, I do have previous visits where I do specifically state how odd the service was odd, not friend and inefficient so that holds true that the waiter service isn't that good here. Also, it got super busy on my last visit towards the end of my dinner and I also waited 20 minutes to get a mochi and 15 minutes more to get my check back to sign so I was held hostage prior to this. So no, it can happen to you in some degree.   Please retrain the staff....and HIRE some good servers. The busboy was polite and did more than just remove plates by checking orders and refilling drinks. PLEASE make him a server and maybe make your rude server a busboy until he learns how to talk to people.   I don't deny the AYCE is good, but if you go then don't go at peak hours, don't sit at a table- ONLY with the nice sushi bar guys and do cash if you have a party splitting the check.   Look at how thorough I was in taking pictures and reviewing individual items because I wanted people to come with my last review. However after this incident I am not recommending it or coming back. I was frustrated all throughout the meal and exasperated at how I was charged and then shortchanged cashback. I haven't felt this way about a dining experience in a long time so 1 star isn't out of line.  There are many AYCE areas in the area including my favorite, Island Sushi whose staff is pure aloha hospitality.  Update- Owner sent a apologetic note....I give him kudos for that and would've given a star for his professionalism. Then a week later I get a anonymous note from someone in henderson talking about me giving bad reviews and how dare I "destroy families". Given that I only have 15 1 star reviews out of nearly 500 and havent given a bad review in ages, it made me wonder. Then I found out other people got the same message that dined with me here so it doesn't take two to figure out our crabby server didn't like what we said. SO unprofessional and cowardly! Your server really made sure we don't come back.

SOOO yummy!! Their all you can eat is really worth it! Me and my boyfriend decided to be fatties and do the all you can eat, we literally ate 100+ dollars worth of food. It was amazing, Everything is all you can eat, appetizers, desserts, sushi rolls....AMAZING..and it all tasted BOMB.  I recommend the rose roll, sooo yummy

The service was great. My friend told me that their food is delicious and not that pricey. Also, we didn't expect that Joseph (Chef) treat us free ice cream (maybe he knows my friend who went their frequently) anyway, I highly recomment Sushi Wa not only for the food but also great customer service. Sugoi!

Came for a late dinner with my girlfriend around 10pm. We came because we knew it was all you can eat and we were starving! We starting ordering nigiri and we were at about 6 different types but they only come 2 per order so it would have only been 12 pieces shared between the both of us and the server told us to stop ordering because it would be way too much to eat. So we just kind of looked at her and said okay. We got the order and finished it quick because it was little and we were hungry. So my girlfriend ordered an udon and the waitress said that it came with a lot of noodles so we shouldnt order anything else.  Last time I checked it was ALL YOU CAN EAT. We can eat a lot and we were starving. And worse the little bit of food we were allowed to order didnt even taste good. It was mediocre at best. There are many other AYCE sushi places around and I'll definitely be going to those instead now and I recommend you do as well.

I've been a friend of Joon the owner and his faithful customer for around 7 years.  Great quality good, chill vibe, and the food is delicious.  The sushi chefs Danny and Waldo definitely keep the menus interesting.  Definitely a MUST have

Great ambiance and food and great price! There was a wide selection for all you can eat. We enjoyed different rolls and had so much fun of the names of the rolls. Also the Hamachi and Salmon color was spot on! The Staff was very nice. We enjoyed our time there.

It's a decent AYCE sushi restaurant in Henderson, NV and worth the visit if you are in the area.  With the standard selection of sushi, I couldn't find a bad choice.  The fish is fresh, the rice is done right, the cuts of fish is precise and service is quick and friendly.  One note, you can pay extra if you want sashimi, but you only have one serving.  I would recommend to make your choice worthwhile, i.e. hamachi.  Also, this would also get you deep fried prawns including the heads.

Im taking stars away for a few reasons.   1- my sisters and I are practically professional at AYCE sushi. So we may have frightened our sushi chef when we ordered 20 different items right from the get-go! Need I mind you, 20 items mostly consisting of sushi that comes 2 to an order at which we order 3 of each can seem like a lot of orders but not between 3 girls. Our server came back to tell us "you know you have to eat everything in all you can eat or you get charged from left orders?" My sisters and I looked at each other with a smirk. Oh yeah! We know!! She proceeded to tell us that they are going to break up our order in half just in case we don't eat it all. Needless to say we shocked the staff by ordering more and desert!! We weren't worried about them breaking it up in half because we knew we would eat it, the timing between was just slow. Hence why we order everything first. There's nothing like a 10-15 minute gap between orders.   2- this might be TMI but I'm breastfeeding, so I can't have spicy food without burning my son's butt. I am also lactose so I can't have cream cheese. My one sister doesn't like to try new things so she likes to stick to what she knows, while my other sister is adventurous. The fact that they don't do half orders during AYCE is disappointing. The half orders are a good way for us to try a little bit of everything so we can see what we like. But we were told we can only have our last order be a half order. Bummer!! I honestly Never heard of that, and I frequent sushi!   I will say the sushi was good, and the service was ok. But what sets this place apart from the rest is their AYCE- it really left us disappointed. Being a big sushi lover, I'm sad to say neither of my sisters nor myself will be coming back and is no longer on our recommended places of sushi.
Wuv this yoint. The option for AYCE is amazing. We wuv this place. Only place to go in Henderson.  Wuv the Dragon Rolls.

The owner came around and introduced himself and asked how everything was which was a nice touch!  Offered us dessert and took our ice cream order which was a nice touch!  Just wish they came around to refill our tea without asking. Pet peeve of mine!  Fish was sliced a little too thinly I think and very small sushi pieces in comparison.   Otherwise a 5 stars for sure.  Will try again for lunch!

I ordered here through uber eats and it was really great! I got the sushi platter when I ordered but wasn't sure what rolls were coming as it didn't say in the app.  There were 45 pieces in total. The 7 rolls they gave us were California, avocado/cucumber, spicy salmon, unagi, crab, sweet potato, and dragon roll. All of the sushi was great and really yummy!   Would definitely order here again and try it out at the location!

We go here quite a bit and always have a really great time.  We sit at the sushi bar and the chefs are friendly and seem to  remember everyone.   Cool place.  Looks so-so from outside but is really nice inside!
Sushi Wa in a convenient location with awesome food! Highly recommend the seaweed salad!

Horrible.  Took family there for late lunch because my daughter back from college remembers it being good.  My sushi was worst I have ever had in Henderson (which has a LOT of sushi offerings).  The salmon and yellowtail actually smelled bad --- we should have left, but were all hungry.  The worst was the spicy octopus --- one of the two only had two VERY SMALL cuts of the fish --- for $5.50.  We will never go back there ---- they are MUCH better places to go in Henderson!!!

I'm kinda at a lost for words because I like how the place is set up and in the beginning when you come here they make you feel happy but after you order your first round they seem to not care about serving you anymore..you literally have to call them or you never get in your second order or drink refills...you guys have some work to do..ive tried this place twice so its not because they were busy or the server..

Sushi Wa   What can I say. AMAZING service, & food! I found this place as a standing 5 star on Yelp and wanted to try it out. So I came here considering all the hype... And what can I say, it stands 5 stars. Yelp reviewers are definitely right.   Service - A+. Came in and was seated right away on a Friday night (though we got the last spot hehe). Joseph the owner came around to personally give us his card, write down our names on his notepad and even got to know us a little bit! Waitresses always kept an eye on our booth to make sure no drinks were empty or we were ready for our next dish. Amazing.   Food- ordered the family boat Wa for 2. Was given 2 complimentary appetizers on top of our starting soup, tempura and edamame! Amazing. When the sushi boat came, I was already satisfied with flavour! The sushi boat was great too!! Fresh sashimi cuts, great fish to rice proportion. Last dish with the family boat wa was the chicken teriyaki and it was another hit!! To end it off, we had a choice of different ice cream flavours. We got red bean and boy... Was it a generous portion after all that food.   VERDICT- you must come here! Hidden gem and bang for your buck. Quality. Service. Food. Everything. :) definitely coming back in the near future and trying out other things. loved it.

Very small but the service is really good, friendly stuff, the chefs it's an excellent cook, also very humble and kind, he comes after you finish you and shakes your hand and talks to you, very friendly.  Overall the good quality is excellent, I've tried almost every single sushi and all of them are awesome (green and white dragon being my favourite ones )

A hidden gem. I love this place. They have an all you can eat special that is hard to resist.  My mom lives in Michigan and my sister in California and whenever they are in town we go to Sushi Wa.  The interior is very nice and modern.  The service is impeccable.  Most important, the food is amazing!
