The Food is Great.... but the service absolutely SUCKS !          A shame because it's such a nice atmosphere.

I really liked the owner of this place. He's a really nice guy who's doing a great job operating this restaurant. I had a lovely chat with him on random topics. The staff at his restaurant are all very friendly, polite and courteous. No complaints in that department.  As to the food, it's not bad, neither is it phenomenal. It's alright. I'd say it's in line with other mid-tier sushi joints in the GTA. I'm not sure if there's anything particularly outstanding about the quality of rice or freshness of fish. It's alright, hence the 3-star rating.  Would I be back? If not for the food, definitely for the owner to say "hi" to him :)

This is one of the best places to get beautiful and delicious sushi in Las Vegas.  It's located across from Trader Joe's on Eastern and Coronado Center.  Maybe the location is the reason why it's always deserted, but that's no reason to miss out on fantastic nosh that tastes as great as it looks.  Joon, the owner, is a fantastic and the service is excellent.  They're attentive without being intrusive, which is always a treat to find in a restaurant where you aren't paying over $60 a plate.  Joon also treated my boyfriend and I to real wasabi--not the green kind, but the kind made from real wasabi root--because we had mentioned that we had never tried real wasabi before.  The fish is fresh, and the rolls are creative.  I would recommend the monkey brains and the tuna tartare for appetizers.  You will also be offered miso soup with your dinner, but there isn't anything standout with the miso soup.  It's good to cleanse the palette before your meal.    For their rolls, try it all out.  I like the tiger roll, superman roll, Joon's special.  I don't have them memorized, but I've never been disappointed with an order.  Overall, the food is wonderful, the people there are friendly and unpretentious and the decor echos their menu: modern, chic and tasteful.

This place is over-priced and over-rated.  You are paying for the ambience.  Service was excellent.  i had the sashimi combo and spicy tuna roll.  Two things that are easily comparable between restaurants.  Tuna was overly dyed dark red and the yellow tail was the toughest I've ever eaten.  However, the spicy tuna roll was a generous serving.  On top of the disappointment of my dining, I started experiencing food poisoning symptoms a few hours later. Sushiwa put a damper on my plans the whole next day.  Too bad Vegas has no exceptions on their ticket refund policy.

The sushi was amazing!! We loved the environment as well. Osvaldo was the one who made our sushi and everything we had,  satisfied our sushi snob taste. The rose roll and the scallop crunch roll are a must order. We will definitely be back!!!!

We've eaten here a handful of times and while the service has been slow, the sushi has always been worth it. Sadly, not the case today. HORRIBLE service. Our waitress was so incredibly rude and recited the AYCE rules and time limits on top of trying to charge extra for things we've always gotten in the past. The halibut was disgusting. With no one in the restaurant you'd think they'd try and be accommodating to our party but it was exactly opposite. Won't be coming back here ever.

Good food! The service needs improvement. We needed to make eye contact or wave them down when we needed somethIng. It seemed like they forgot about us.  Other than the service I recommend eating there.

Some people eat just to eat as they routinely do to fulfill their three squared meals a day. I, on the other hand, eat because I have a love for food. My facebook photos can attest to that.  Knowing that, Sushi Wa is my answer when people ask me what the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas... with a grain of salt. Although Sushi Wa has its high points, it also has some low points, thus not earning its full five stars. Here's a list of likes and dislikes...  Like:  - Each person gets one order of sashimi as part of their AYCE experience.  - Fresh and thick cuts of fish  - Best tasting Unagi I've ever eaten. Generously cut and quickly seared to get a crispy edge to contrast the soft texture. (I usually never order Unagi since its rather unhealthy)  - A wide selection of side dishes  - Small details that make each dish a little extra... For example, in the Udon, there are shiitake mushrooms. You normally wouldnt see that in an order of Udon from the AYCE menu.  Dislikes:  - No half roll orders unless its your last roll.  - Limited selection of dessert... And I hate how they drizzle chocolate on every piece of dessert.  - Slow service. Some of the male wait staff seem lost.   For me, the list of likes out weigh the list of dislikes. I mostly order Nigiri so the thick slices of fresh fish are more important than desserts. Slow service? Well, that just means more time to talk with my dining date. I've eaten here well over five times and each person I bring has come back to bring other people. Sure, other AYCE eat places might have a thing or two that is done better, but Sushi Wa has the best Nigiri.   Photos included!
Great service and food! Always convenient and quick! The food is fresh and hot. I enjoy eating here because there is enough room to order Ayce without bumping into other customers!

Normally enjoy the meal here, but with no half orders, an almost explanation that any amount of sushi left on plate will result in additional item charge, and a severe flown from the sushi chef the entire time, our Sunday Sushi wasn't enjoyable. :(

My sister and I were in the area while waiting on repairs to be completed to my car so we decided to stop by and grab a bite to eat. When we first walked in, the place has a very warm and cozy environment. We were greeted at the door and walked over to our seats. The menu has many option to choose from but we ordered from their dinner bento and a their speciality sushi. The service was a bit slow but there were many people there so I understood and it didn't bother me too much. They were very attentive and kept ensuring we were doing okay. Then Joseph one of the sushi chef came out, greeted us and offered us ice cream at the end of the meal. I thought that was the sweetest thing and never have a ever experienced that in a restaurant before. We had a great experience not just the meal itself which was excellent but with the employees that worked there. If we are ever in the area again we will definitely be visiting.

I have always enjoyed this place because Joon, the owner, always makes sure to take very good care of us. Usually we order the all you can eat sushi which in and of itself is amazingly priced and encompassingly delicious. Everything from the udon to the seemingly endless list of rolls. But Last night my girlfriend and I decided to try something new: Omakase.  For those of you who are unaware, Omakase in Japanese roughly translates to "I leave it to you." Meaning the chef has free reign to give you whatever they think you'll love and you as the customer must have full faith in the chef that they will provide you with a meal that won't be forgotten.  Joon blew us away with amazing attention to detail. The fish he used literally fell apart in our mouths before we even started to chew and the flavorful combinations this 15 year veteran delivered to us were nothing short of daring and delicious. If you have the budget for it, I would highly recommend that you try Omakase from Joon, you won't regret it and I'm positive it isn't the last time I will do so either. (Oh and don't forget to tip your chef with some Mu Sake after the meal!)   Bravo.

Being from LA, we have amazing sushi bars. This one really blew me away!  It's off the beaten path from the strip, in a quiet mini mall. This was recommended by a local. Totally worth the trip out here from our hotel in vegas. Came here with a large group on a Monday night. Easy to get a table. It was fantastic. Quality of the seafood is great. And especailly great for an all you can eat sushi bar! Much better quality than the best buffets on the strip. The service was stellar. Manager Geo and server Mark made sure we were all taken care of!   There are rules to the all you can eat sushi, so you need to plan well to get a nice variety of sushi. You need to finish all your sushi, or they will charge you, so don't over order. Even if you get a few rolls, it's totally worth it. You even get an amazing dessert. I recommend the tempura banana!   If I lived here, I'd eat here all the time.

Celebrating a birthday with our granddaughter, Ordered 2 mild Korean ramen & 2 miso ramen! Korean ramen came out but waited 20 mins for miso ramen until the waitresses asked if we were waiting for something! We said yes 2 miso saimin. The waitresses went to check and said the person who took our order put in miso soup! Well we never got any miso soup so that was a lot of bull!   The guy who took our order came and said it will be 5 minutes, they thought it was miso soup and walked away. I grumbled and said well I never got any miso soup if that's the case!!   Finally, got our ramen!! Delicious but not as tasty if I got it when everyone got their food!

It's rare to find a good quality AYCE sushi restaurant that includes sashimi. Sure certain restaurants (starts with a T ends with odai and the other place starts with an M and ends with akino) serve AYCE sushi and sashimi but the quality's poor.  Although there's a limit to how much sashimi you can order at Sushi Wa, you're guaranteed to have fresh fish that looks and tastes superb. It's a 20+ miles away from where I love but it's worth it. The interior is clean and modern. The servers are great too.

I would eat Miso Soup, Sushi, and Mochi everyday if I could afford it.  When I can afford it I go to Sushi Wa for lunch or dinner.  The Sushi is delicous and fresh and the service is wonderful.  I have been to this spot six times in the past year and everytime I go it seems like the staff wait on me and my friends hand and foot.  My glass is never dry and they keep the green tea coming.  I love the salmon mango roll!  Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  The all you can eat includes soup, salad, and dessert.  Yumm-O!  Check it out you won't be disappointed.

I came here for lunch because I have been craving sushi after passing on a trip with all the Yelpers. It has been some time since I came here, but it is close to home and I remembered liking this place a lot. A couple of years later, it is still good and they have AYCE. I sat down at the bar and did the AYCE lunch ($21.95) The restaurant was quiet, at noon, since they open at 11:30. Not too long after 1pm, people started to come in. That gave me a 45 minutes of my own personal sushi chef. I got the Spicy Sashimi Salad to start. It was light on the dressing, not too spicy, and overall delicious. It could use more heat, but the mound of greens, diakon, and seaweed was a plus. The Agedashi Tofu  had an odd taste or maybe too much flavor. I usually drink all the broth, but I left mine this time. The Shrimp and Sweet Potato Tempura was good. Spears of sweet potato were wrapped in shrimp, lightly battered, and fried. Simply perfect. I also like their Monkey Brains appetizer. Spicy tuna, cream cheese, shitake mushroom which they fry up tempura style before cutting into quarters and placed on their spicy and eel sauce.   All of the nigiri I got were good, but nothing mind blowing in flavor. I do like the attention to detail though. My Ika came out looking like a baby squid. The Unagi was also better because they took a torch to it after putting on the sauce to give a nice char. Sang has some nice knife skills.  I am a sucker for a Screaming Orgasm and must try it anywhere I go. I know saying I like their orgasm sauce because it is not too creamy is going to set me up for a razzing, but I don't care. It is true, because the sauce is more on the citrus side than on the mayo and I am fan. I finished my sushi course with a half order of this roll. I wished I saved more room or asked if I could get it as a salad, because it was my favorite. Ordering a half roll is like declaring a cease fire. Once the white flag is up, there is no more sushi to be had. Make sure you are ready to call it quits before asking for this. The chefs are upfront about it, but just a warning in case it slips their minds.  At the end of my meal, I got the banana tempura with green tea ice cream. I don't normally order tempura items at Japanese restaurants, but Sushi Wa does it so well.   The service was polite, attentive, and quick on refills of my green tea and water. I had an enjoyable lunch. There can be a wait if they get hit with too many eager AYCE diners, but patience is rewarded.
I love the sushi bombs! My husband and I usually go there after work at around 12am. The service is alright but the food is really good !
Fresh seafood, attentive staff, and a nice physical layout.   First time visit for AYCE lunch. Will be back!

The venue was located in a fairly large plaza which made parking easy. My first impression as I walked in was that the interior design was a little on the conservative side and that the seating layout was odd. There was quite a bit of wasted space which¬†meant longer wait times if it got busy.¬†  Despite its lack-luster name, quality was actually quite decent. There was¬†definitely no "wow" factor to the food, but what really stood out was the service. The owner, Joseph, took the time to come greet me¬†at the table and struck up some small talk.¬†This place was owned by Koreans and served both Japanese and Korean dishes.¬†  The seafood was fresh and presentation was better than a lot of other sushi places I have been to. Selections are also reasonably priced.  Verdict:  If you're in the area and looking for a decent sushi place, definitely pay "Sushi WA" a visit. The owner there puts in a lot of effort in running his business and it shows through the quality of food and service. I will definitely be visiting again...

I found this place about a year ago and it is the best sushi I have had in Vegas, which I know is a biiiiiiig statement.   Over the past 10 years or so I have eaten at dozens of sushi restaurants in this town (on the strip as well) and I can't say I have enjoyed any as much as this place. The fish is stellar, the customer service is amazing, and the rolls are innovative and flavorful.  What brought me back is the fact that I can easily eat $100 worth of sushi in one sitting. I prefer all-yo-can-eat venues because frankly, it's cheaper. Most of the time you find yourself at one of these places, the rolls are basic and not very good, or you are prohibited from ordering any of the "good" rolls. Not this place!!! If it is on the menu, you can order it (and as much as you like). Any app, roll, sashimi, nigiri; it's all fair game. The funny thing is the place is almost always empty! It's a really nice place right next door to Shakespeare's (a trendy bar). I am positive that this is just a secret among those who live in Green Valley. This place is a must-go for any Vegas sushi-addict.

First time at Sushi Wa and probably my last.   Nothing was terribly wrong, but it just wasnt that impressive. The interior is very nice. We almost felt a bit out of place in flip flops. The service was fine, though there were a few odd moments and they forgot to bring a few things. I ended up ordering the AYCE sushi, not because I was that hungry, but because the individual roll prices are so high (most around $13) that you have already hit the AYCE price once you have ordered two. I found the roll selection pretty much standard with a few surprises, but there was something off with all the things I ordered. I couldnt tell quite what it was, but I have a feeling the fish wasnt the freshest. There was that slightly bitter aftertaste that you get from fish that has been sitting around just a little too long.  Overall Sushi Wa was decent, but there are several other better AYCE places around town that I would prefer to spend $26.
So good, highly recommend enjoying ayce sushi and sake here. Thank you Jenny for taking care of us!

Very impressed with the sushi. Quality of fish was great. The rolls were a good size and actually gave a decent amount of fillings. We ordered the small sushi/sashimi platter (which included a good assortment of nigiri/sashimi, but I was not a huge fan of the crab rolls, which made up a good portion of the platter) and a bunch of other rolls. Quality was excellent all around. The only downsides were:  1. They could not accept a credit card over the phone. Considering we had someone else picking up the food, that wasn't ideal. Also, when they forgot to include our order of edamame, they were not able to refund the difference to the card and instead had to issue a credit for our next visit (again not ideal,  as we live downtown and were uptown to visit family).  2. The nigiri pieces I thought were very small. Delicious, but very small.   Otherwise, no other complaints and would gladly be coming here more often if I lived closer.

The Chirashi was off the hook! What a work of art... A+ for presentation, fresh fish, and good serving size. Something out the ordinary... it even had a few slices of what I think what super white tuna topped with some black roe. Delicious!   A+ for ambiance, service, and good prices.... And opens late.  Oh another plus... there is a U-Swirl self serve yogurt place right next door. Sorry Sushi Wa, I'm sure your fried green tea ice cream and mochi balls are probably delicious, but you can't beat 30-something cents an ounce of yogurt + toppings next door! =)

This place used to be good but now its going down in quality.  They redo the menu so a lot of items that used to be able to get with AYCE arent available but instead in a la carte.  Every time I go in there now there's new staffs working specially sushi chefs.  The sushi rolls used to be so good but now it tastes so bland. Im feeling like I was eating at Sushi Mon. I will give it one more chance. If it still terrible I will have to change place. It sucks because I've been coming here for years.

Sushi Wa isn't the top option for AYCE but they're good enough to get regular visits. We can always walk right in when our go-to spot is busy. The sushi is consistent as is the service for us.  With plenty of seating, including some high back booths for privacy, there is rarely a wait here. On busy nights, they'll have two to three servers running the floor with male manager/owner that's doing all the seating, running food, and helping out with take out. I've noticed two servers that are consistently there, with frequent turnover with the other servers which may lead to an occasional inconsistency with service depending on who is there.  The AYCE menu is pretty standard with your regular lineup of nigiri and hot apps. Some of the hot tapas aren't that impressive such as the soft shell crab and pork belly and I would suggest you steer clear of to save room for sushi. I usually don't make it to the rolls, but when I'm there with friends the do prefer rolls, they have decent list of interesting and unique ones. For the non sushi eaters, the bento boxes are a good value with Korean BBQ short ribs being the favorite of my wife.  Pricing is $23/$27 for lunch/dinner with super late hours for the night owls. Some people get their panties all bunched up over non Japanese owned sushi joints. But for me, you can come from Mars and have an extra arm coming out of the top of your head, as long as you can make sushi rice and can place a fresh piece of fish neatly on top of it, I'm a fan and you'll get my business.
Diverse selection of sushi, rolls, and cooked food. The AYCE is also reasonably priced and decor is nicer than most other sushi places.

Walking into the place, it looked nice. Sitting down, the bench was very comfortable. Service was ok. I ordered the Korean spicy ramen combo with a spider roll. The spider roll had eel sauce on it and a carrots inside which made it weird. The other people in my group had ordered sushi also and they didn't care for what they ordered. One person ordered a tempura roll which she thought would be a roll with tempura in it. Nope, it was a roll made tempura style. The ramen I ordered was a little disappointing. I'm sure I'm wrong but it just seemed like top ramen noodles with some added stuff to it. We wanted to come back and try the all you can eat but after experiencing some of the food they served we all agreed that we would t be coming back. Some people might like the sushi here but it was such a departure from the norm that I just didn't like it.

The dinner bento is good price.  I will totally recommend the tempura, sushi and sashimi bento. It's $16.99, big portion of food. The owner is super super nice and kind.  He usually will come say hi to new customer and offer free ice cream. =P The ice-cream is not just scoop of ice cream. It's ice cream with corn flakes and taste good together.

Everything about this place was ehh. We won't be returning or recommending.  We get there when the place first opened, and upon walking in I'm thinking that because it looks nice, we'll probably have a really good experience here. Yeah, not so much.  It took the waitress a few minutes to acknowledge us after she gave us the menu to get our drink orders. Upon returning to take our order, there's like 30 thousand rules that are already listed in the menu, but the waitress decided she had to make sure we knew. I know that with AYCE sushi, you're supposed to finish your food or they say they will charge you so that people don't just order a bunch of stuff to waste. So when we're ordering the waitress made sure to tell us we needed to finish all of our food eor we would be charged.   Another issue we had was when we tried to order, everything we wanted, like plain roll were on the dinner menu. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying dinner price for AYCE sushi during dinner, but it was lunch. This lunch ended up costing 70 bucks with tip.    The food was meager. The sashimi was good, but nothing spectacular. The screaming orgasm was really good along with the peppered tuna. Philadelphia roll was very plain. The shrimp tempura roll my bf said tasted "super fishy." The Japanese lasagna was delicious.  Cucumber salad was bland. Ice cream was ice cream.  The waitress did, however, keep refilling my bf's soda without having to be asked. Which was nice. Usually, drinks are ignored. Here, it wasn't.  This place is very close to home, so we were hoping we could find another neighborhood favorite, but I guess it's back to SushiMon.

GREAT sushi, atmosphere and okay service.   They aren't too busy normally which is a blessing and a curse because they only have one or two servers at a time so the wait can be longer than normal places but the menu and sushi is amazing.

Very good. Delicious and not stingy w fish or anything. Cold beers and frozen mochi. We enjoyed the attentive waitress who asked us as the plates were 70% gone about our next orders and not stingy w the plates and numbers of rolls. We will be back for more next time in vegas.
It was terrible. Staff ignored us apon entering. Just looked up and went back to ckeaning tables. Finally sat down.  Took forever to even get a drink. Food was blah. Will not return.

My husband & I go here twice a month for all-you-can-eat sushi.  The food is fresh, the presentation is beautiful, and the service is awesome!  My husband can drink enough ice tea to kill a camel, and he always has a full glass.  When we order food, it comes quickly, and we are always asked what else we would like.   We always sit at the bar which is very clean and inviting.  The sushi chef's are friendly and  entertaining. While other sushi bars come and go, there is a reason that this sushi place has been around for years!!

So everyone seems to love to this place and I was wondering why it got 5 stars. Definitely not worth going!!!! Yes, this CAT got tricked!!  The restaurant is very small. It won't fit more than a party of 8-10 in one area. Other than that, it's good for couples. No much decor. It felt old.   The worst part is that the waitress had to apologize and tell us that she's the only one working, so indeed, the service was very slow!!!!! And I was hungry too!!!  Happy:  There were 2 free appetizers which I found out from other yelpers. One is a tiny roll of veggies and mango which was nicely presented. It was followed by a warm tuna roll which had a nice spicy sauce on it which was delicious. A crunch to it too!!   Now after that... it went downhill....  Unhappy:  The miso soup and salad that was supposed to come with it didn't come early so we can eat that while we were hungry. The soup came with our meal and it definitely took longer than any Japanese place that I've been to!! My partner ordered chicken katsu which was alright. I ordered teriyaki salmon which was 2 dried up pieces. It was overcooked. I had to remind the waitress if there was a salad and she said YES and then explained that she was the only one working there. Well, it's obvious they need to hire another one during the weekend.   We also didn't get the same napkins as the other tables. We got the cheap ones that are see-through!! We saw people that came in and walked out since there were no tables available. I wanted to tell them that they might be too hungry to even move if they receive their food.   It was quicker to pay at the tilt instead of asking for the bill.   Verdict:  It was too long a drive to get there and it was not worth it. Not worth it at all. Not sure why people are rating it so high. It doesn't deserve it at all. Sorry. Even if the food was good, I wouldn't wait over 30 minutes for my meal - at a Japanese place!

I don't say this often (sad to say because a friend of mine swears this is the best Sushi place now in the Las Vegas area), but this is the worse sushi buffet/place I have ever been to. Maybe it was because it was lunch time, but everything stunk!  First of all, there are limitations to the buffet, like one of each poke salad, dessert, etc. In addition, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters were only offered at dinner time. They also don't have sashimi for lunch time. After seeing this, I had a second thought of maybe leaving because my hubby already had several things marked off of his "must-have" list at a sushi place, but I decided to stay.  After ordering a few sushi/nigiri, the waitress asked us if we were "sure" we wanted to order all of this because there was 16 pieces for the both of us. Keep in mind, we haven't even started eating yet. Ok, I guess she doesn't get customers that eat a lot of sushi?  Again, we just brushed it off, and said we still wanted it.  When we got our sushi, I was disgusted. The raw fish was breaking apart already (most likely 2-3 days old), wasn't as cold, and the rice also wasn't as sticky. Ewwww! Gross.   The best part of the lunch was probably the mochi, and the banana tempura with green tea ice cream dessert I had them make for me.  Don't go here unless you really have to.

So far one of the nicest looking "all you can eat sushi" places i have been. And better yet the staff are all amazing, even going so far as to create custom rolls for us. Will definitely come again and bring my family again.
Excellent service. Fresh sushi, with impressive presentation.  The restraunt is very clean and well decorated.  We had the all you can eat and were very happy with everything

Looking for a new AYCE sushi and found this place.  Got seated right away, however, we were told that they had a lot of reservations so seating was limited.  Ordered our appetizers and first entrees.  Once the food started coming to the table, it all came at a nice pace.  Rolls were a bit loose, and tended to fall apart easily.  They were a bit large in portion as well, which makes it hard to eat.  They restrict how much of certain items you can have for each person and when we tried to order the Uni and was told they were out.  Service was very good, constantly clearing the dishes and taking orders for next course.  Overall, very good atmosphere, great service, good food.  No complaints.  Will be returning!

This place is great. Came on a Saturday for dinner. Server was very pleasant. Complimentary edamame and vermicelli soup.  A cozy sushi restaurant. Ordered the Red Dragon roll and Geisha roll alongside the sushi/sashimi/tempura bento box and chigurashi. The specialty rolls were so delicious! Very big and very little rice in them.  At the end, Chef Joseph came by our table to ask how everything was. He also asked for our names and gave complimentary ice cream. What a great personal touch. Also, after leaving I thought I left my glove in the restaurant. When I came back in, both the server and Chef Joseph helped me to look for it in the booth. Lovely place with great food and great customer service. Will definitely be coming back!

Just had since of the best sushi I've ever had. This is my third time here and I've liked it, but today it was perfect. Unbelievably fresh and nice size pieces of fish.. Definitely got my money's worth.. Highly recommend.. Juan was amazing. Great service and his sushi Skills are on point. Will definitely be back. Again and again..

Sushi Wa is a great neighborhood sushi restaurant .  The freshness and quality of the sushi and sashimi is consistent .  The service is warm and courteous , and the fusion sauces are delectable ! Cannot beat it for quality , variety and price .

No. WE ARE NOT GOING TO EAT HERE. First, we called the restaurant today 04/08 at around 12:15 and we spoke to a girl to ask questions for takeout and she doesn't even know what kind of food they have and she said SHE WAS BUSY. So we went to the restaurant and there's only one server (who answers the phone as well) and approached her if we could order for takeout. 30 minutes later, my husband was waving at her to order as there are only 3 tables so we thought itll be okay to already order as it was more than 30 minutes wait time. The server said, "Sorry I'm busy". So my husband told her "if you couldnt take my order, let me know so I could already walk out." We then left very disappointed.  So we understand that she was by herself taking all orders, taking the food and dishing out. But at least acknowledge the PEOPLE who comes to your restaurant. Despite the good reviews that you guys have, WE ARE NOT GOING TO TRY IT AND WILL NEVER RECOMMEND to anyone due to the fact that the service was horrible.  To whoever that server was (on 04/08, 1am), we really hope the management could read this and fire you. The restaurant doesn't deserve you.
Amazing sushi!!! AYCE is a must.  The "Salmon Crunch" is the best.  The Garlic Tuna is superb. Great restaurant!

It was one of the places my now husband brought me to on one of our first dates. 5 years later we are still coming here regularly.  I recommended Sushi Wa often .   The ayc an eat menu is large and the service is awesome. No waiting around for your next roll. My favorite...the Superman Burrito

Food 5 Stars - Service 3 stars.  We went on New Years Eve, and the restaurant was crowded... but not that crowded.  We had a reservation for 7 - they put us in a cramped rounded booth - maybe room for 5-6.  One server asked us for drinks, and then no one came to get our order... ten minutes later we asked the drink server, about ordering, and he said he wasnt' our server and left.  Finally after getting the managers attention, we got a server.   Anyway - seemed like we were an inconvenience to the manager.  She didn't smile once- looked irritated at everyone the whole time we were there.
It's my go to place if I'm in the mood for sushi! All you can eat for a great price, fantastic.

Excellent fresh fish, the staff is friendly, helpful and the restaurant is clean with a great vibe. The desserts are incredible.The only thing I would change is adding more items to the menu for those who come in a group and would like something other than sushi.
Great sushi and an even better server Jenny. Food came out right away and can't pass up a free beer!!

This place is fantastic!!!!!! Some of the best freshest fish I've had. The monkey brain is great. It sounds weird but trust me it's the best. Very classy and clean inside. The service is great. Hands down my favorite sushi place!
Probably one of my favorite sushi places in Henderson.  Great service, food, and sake selection.  Would highly recommend to anyone!!!  A++++++

I finally got a chance to come here! I came with 2 friends and only one of them had ayce sushi with me. The other friend ordered a la carte.   Upon entry, our waitresses were nice and friendly. It was a good start. Ambiance is nice and quiet, but dark inside. If you're like me and really love to take pictures of food it'll be hard without flash cause it's very dim in here.   We got served by 3 different servers. The waitress taking our order had issues with her pen not working twice and it felt slow. We were told we were not able to order half rolls unless it's for our last orders. Weird.   Ice cream is only limited to one kind per person. So if you want both the tempura and mochi ice cream, you can only pick one. :( Sad face here.   We ended with a waiter named JooSun (spelling?) and he seemed distant/apathetic but he was also nice. He let my a la carte friend get ice cream anyway. He gave me this bonus card when I asked for the stamp cards.. not sure if they have those stamp cards now. I'll find out soon enough.   All in all, it was a pretty good experience. There was this halibut that I tried which I could not for the life of me finish it nor swallow it. :(  Next time I'm back would most likely be in June for a birthday celebration. I'll update then. :)

I have been coming here for over a year and I honestly feel like this is one of the best sushi bars in vegas! Ayce sushi usually means a little bite of fish on a huge chunk of rice but not here. The fish is usually ample and so amazingly fresh! My favorites have to be the salmon and garlic tuna! They also have a great selection of rolls that do not leave you wishing you had gone somewhere else. The superman roll is by far my most favorite roll of the restaurant then the screaming o roll! Those two rolls are what keep me coming back time and time again! So if I were to rate this place on just the quality of the sushi and the rolls it would definitely be a 5 star place but unfortunately there's another part to the stars which is service. The wait staff is awesome some are more attentive then others but generally they all make yoy feel welcome and treat you well and keep your drinks filled up the sushi chefs though are not all wonderful! I feel as though sushi chefs should be personable and care about the people they are serving which I do believe two of them do but there is one sushi chef ( I think his name is danny) (I could be wrong) he is scary and he makes you feel bad for ordering more stuff and even though he's speaking in Japanese you can tell he's complaining about all the people who are there to eat or what they are ordering. He does alot of huffing and puffing and eye rolling sighing and complaining. It's horrible and every time I walk in and see him behind the bar I give a quick prayer that I don't have to sit in front of him or that he's not the main sushi chef for the night cause he makes the other chefs grumpy also. So food is amazing, prices are average for ayce in vegas and the service is great if you don't get the one chef that can make your night rough.

This is my favorite AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  The fish quality is high and the selection is great.  Each AYCE order also includes one order of sashimi.  The seared peppered tuna is my favorite, but I have yet to have something that I didn't like.
I am from New York City and my mother took me to eat here and it was great place small but very good clean and fresh sushi loved it !!

Best soft shell crab tempura! Great service, great sake, and close to home.   We've been here a few times now, and have tried a variety of items on the menu. With the exception of one or two we didn't personally have a taste for, we've never had an issue. Can't wait for our next visit!

I wish I could undo that meal selection.  Decor, music and plating of the meal were excellent  Service, freshness of fish, and pricing were good.  Here is where they disappoint.  The amount of rice they pack into the Nigiri sushi. I'm not one to fuss about eating the rice. I enjoy it quite a bit but this place over did it.  Some of the sauces were terrible and do not belong on the Nigiri that I was ordering.   The jalape√±os on my sushi were dark forest green, pickled and cut to the same diameter as the canned ones you put on a ball park hot dog. Gross!    This was the worst sushi I've had in town.   This place could be excellent if they would just use proper recipes and ingredients.
One of the best sushi places we've been to. Food is very fresh and the owner is very friendly.

I swear to never return at this sushi restaurant anbf please customers who intend to come here to dine PLEASE READ THE FINE PRINT and make your you order only as much as you can eat and clean off your plates completely to the last piece with exactly nothing left on any single plate.   My server/waitress had not taken my order correctly and did not admit to her mistake. I told her many times and had asked her please do not put Tuna in the many assorted fishes in my roll of sushi and she said oh yes the chef will simply just out more of one of the other kinds of fish. That seems like it was ordered easily and understood. Then she had mentioned many of the other dishes and rolls I had ordered alsoi had tuna but they were spicy tuna...They were different because they are slightly cooked and not if the same texture I said those are Ok. I'm fine with those. So then when the meal came to the table I told them the order was,taken wrong they admitted fault and asked if they could make a new one we said no we didn't want to order a new one because we were full already. Then when time came to pay they said those were considered left overs. They wanted to charge as left overs.   How ridiculous? Also ayce is only allowing 1sashimi per person. That's really not ayce  then.   There are so many restrictions for the price we pay. They expect us to eat sushi with the fish so that we get full quick. What a scam.   They want to charge if there is even 1piece of food left on a plate. How ridiculous.  This us what management had told me when I needed to speak with manager because he wanted to back up his worker.    This restaurant does not know how to guide the customer on ordering the right things on the menus and letting customers know the rules in the restaurant. Don't assume the customers know they have to clean the plates.   Buffets ayce don't expect people to eat everything off there plates.   You ridiculous restaurant.  Frozen Salmon.  Not so fresh salads. Seasoning is so spicy Mayonaise is so sour. How can you expect us to eat all if the food is not great.  Please get better chefs.

One of my favourite place to eat sushi.. also take out. Customer service is always great and very friendly to their guest. My family and friends come here frequently for takeout and never disappoint. They give us the Korean style noodles while waiting for takeout.

This is probably the best sushi restaurant I have ever been to. Great service, amazing food.. They are All you can eat  but food quality is better than A la carte.  For the sushi lover this place is a  must try!!

Holy hell...everything seemed fine, OK sushi, no bad...but not great, until we saw the ROACHES.  I kid you not.  When someone at the other end of the sushi bar said that they saw a bug, both my dining partner and myself tried to put it out of our minds.  BAD MOVE.  We continued to order and eat, only to have a small brown roach crawl right in front of us, on the sushi bar.  When we wigged out and pushed away from the counter, I happened to look down and saw another one at my feet.  Crap on a cracker...I was GROSSED OUT.  The worst part??? The waitress wasn't even freaked out by it....she simply walked over and went after them with a napkin....like she deals with it all of the time.  Googly moogly.  They took 30% off of the check (really????), which we didn't even ask them to, we'd have paid full price...we just wanted to leave.  I didn't know upon leaving what I wanted to do more...throw up or shower.  Super disappointing because the place looks elegant and clean.  Nasty.

Absolutely perfect! Beautiful decor on the inside & out. Once you walk in, you are completely shocked that it is so elegant, but yet comfortable for dining. Sat at the bar, and our order was taken right away. Drinks were always refilled, and food came out in a perfect time. So stuffed from the delicious food, & prices were great too. Terrific customer service. Chef JJ told me he liked my glasses, too funny! Definitely going to go back! Probably in my top 3 favorite sushi restaurants. & please tip these guys, they do such an amazing job.

Wow, we went as a party of 6 today. The food was good but the service ruined our experience. I have no idea how they have 4 stars!  The waitress was not helpful, nice or attentive to our needs. I understand you already know that you're getting an 18% auto gratuity but it does not create cause for bad service. We like to eat a lot and it means 3 or 4 rounds of ordering. We had to keep flagging the servers to put in additional orders. She didn't ask how we wanted to split the bill or provide eye contact as we were hoping to get another dessert round since it wasn't limited.   The meal was $28 each for AYCE which some items were included and others not. I really liked the nigiri and sashimi as well as the other dishes but it's not enough in a service based city.  We will not be coming back to Sushi Wa or recommending it to anyone. The location had a trendy look and feel when you walk in. Music was loud playing with hip hop music, it was a low lighting environment and the part that bothered someone in our party was that we were told to put the menus on the floor for more table space which means dirty menus in our hands.

We lived in Okinawa, Japan for 8 years and, after moving back to the US, missed the great sushi, tempura, etc. and friendly people.  After moving to Vegas in June, we found Sushi Wa and were excited to find the best Japanese restaurant since we moved back to the US!  All their food was PHENOMENAL ('Oishi' - if that's how you spell it in English) and the people were extremely welcoming.  While it's not close to where we live in Vegas, it's worth the trip for the great food, people and atmosphere.

I came here about a year ago, and remembered having a pleasant experience. But, even though I faintly remembered much about it - the salmon sushi left a lasting impression. I came back today, and was pleasantly surprised. When I asked our server why the salmon was so unique and fresh, she said the owner imports fresh every day! Extremely rare for Vegas, as we aren't near the ocean, most sushi restaurants are frozen and costly.   Whereas the AYCE closely resembles Sushi Mon, with fresher fish and closely detailed presentation and flavor. Definitely worth the price, with Kabuki sized salmon sushi that tastes even fresher.

Came here for a Meetup event with the I Love Sushi group.  We had a fairly large party, and we ended up placing a huge order right from the start as every one was marking down what they want on the order sheet without much group coordination. We were warned about not ordering too much, but as a group we failed to heed the manager's warning.  So a lot of food was prepared and served almost on top of each other.  Anyway, at the end of the meal Chef Joon (owner) came to speak to us, and said that they do their best to make the best food they can for the customers, but when they get a huge order they will rush it and may not be able to put as much attention as they normally would like, so it is better to order slowly for the best food.  Plus they do not skim for their AYCE customers, and the rolls were larger than we were accustomed to at AYCE sushi restaurants.  The restaurant itself was beautiful.  You can tell someone invested a lot of time and other resources into the design and the final look of the restaurant.  It is very modern and artistic look to it, which pairs well with the beautiful food served.  The lighting is fairly bright, so you can enjoy the food visually before savoring it with your other senses. Plus it almost feels like you are eating in a modern art museum, or a restaurant within one, since it is roomy!!! and you are not crammed in there like 7 Vienna Sausages in a can.   We ordered a wide range of items from their AYCE menu, which is practically their entire menu (with some exclusions).  Below are the highlights and my personal recommendations:  APPETIZERS:  Monkey Brain (basically spicy tuna and cream cheese stuffed in mushroom and tempura fried) - small enough to eat solo or share with up to 4 ppl. Soft Shell Crab - Tempura fried and delicious. Served san rice makes it even better (more room in the tummy for other awesome food, plus it is low carbs!)  SALADS: Tuna Poki Salad - good portions.  ROLLS: Crunch Albacore - looks good, and tastes great. Mango Salmon Roll - sweetness from the mango just pairs well with the salmon. Energy Roll - one of the deep fried rolls, great flavor, especially if you like unagi (eel). Tiger Roll - They make a good version of this popular roll.  NIGIRI: Uni, Super White Tuna, Ama Ebi were all good and they do not skimp on these just because you ordered AYCE, so you get a nice proportion of fish to rice. And most importantly the fish were fresh! Pepper Seared Baby Tuna - big fan of this!  HONORABLE MENTION: Superman Burrito (Shrimp Tempura, Soft shell Crab, Tuna, Salmon, Yellowtail with special spicy Garlic sauce) - it is a ginormous roll, be sure to bring a lot of hungry friends, or you will not get to try too many other items on the menu.  Sushi Wa offers lunch specials and 1/2 price sushi menu offers from 11:30am-3pm and dinner specials from 6-9pm, which you can check out on their website. http://www.sushiwavegas.com/menus.html  If you live near here, be sure to get their frequent visitor/loyalty card.  In hindsight I should have picked up one of these, as I am going back to Sushi Wa next week.  The staff here are nice, and checks up on their guests frequently.  Our drinks were frequently refilled.  And as I have mentioned earlier, Chef Joon (the owner) even came and spoke to us at the end of our meal.    The restaurant is located in the SE part of Las Vegas (Henderson), where there are also a lot of other really good AYCE Sushi restaurants nearby and unfortunately for me a little far (by Vegas standards), but I think it is worth the drive or if you happen to be in the area.  Decor: 5/5 I love the look of the restaurant. Ambiance: 4.5/5  Very nice Food: 4/5  I found some favorites already, while others I am glad that I have tried and will likely pass up in order to try other items. Service: 4/5  Good. Location: Worth checking out if you have your own transportation for out of town visitors.  Otherwise cab fare will be more than the price of the meal.  Solid 4 stars.  Plus it is still a hidden gem (even though they have been open for a few years already), as you don't have to wait a long time for seats compared to some other well-known AYCE sushi restaurant in the area.

My boyfriend and I go to Sushi Wa whenever we need to grab some late dinner. The owner and the staff are very friendly. The food is consistently great and they provide delicious samples of sushi and occasionally dessert :) The hospitality is simply amazing.  A must try for any sushi lover!

Good, but just not worth it!  The sushi was good... No doubts about that, and the portions were filing. Anything fried was huge. The stuffed jalape√±o was delicious. The Las Vegas Roll was good, except the rice was on the outside. I am not a fan of this. I think makes the roll taste too much like fried dough rather rice than sushi, which would be fine, except these aren't carnival prices.  At $26.95 for dinner AYCE, that is slight more than many other sushi places in Las Vegas.. And the sake was $10 for a large. That is crazy. Minus one star there.  Oh, and the $10 sake was not even hot, but warm. Minus one more star!  The service here was good, but when we asked for a table in the corner the hostess/waitress asked why... How about you just do as we requested? Most of the tables were not occupied, only a few were.

Amazing interior design, and a welcoming warm atmosphere. Fish is professionally prepared and great presentation. Staff is friendly and patient. Shout out to server Jenny, she is a champion! #amazing #jennyisachamp

My new favorite place.  I have always loved I Love Sushi and still do but the atmosphere was 10 times better and the food was great you have to try the Who's Your Daddy appetizer and all of the rolls we had were great.
Awesome Food , Best Sushi I have had in Las Vegas. Staff is great! Love the owner! We are definitely regulars here!
